full_translation:
**The Supreme Cavern Mystery Numinous Treasure Scripture of Flying Immortals and Deliverance Methods**

**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Cavern Mystery Numinous Treasure Scripture of Flying Immortals and Deliverance Methods*. The compiler is unknown, approximately dating to the Southern Song dynasty. It is one of the essential scriptures of the Jingming (Pure Brightness) tradition during the Song and Yuan dynasties. Falsely attributed to the Jingming Patriarch, Perfected Lord Xu Sun, as a commentary on the *Numinous Treasure Scripture of Deliverance*, it expounds upon present-day Daoist methods. The original text comprises five juan of main content, along with one juan of catalog and one juan of exegetical examples.

**Source of the Base Text:** *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, Cavern Mystery Section, Methods Category.

---

### **Catalog of *The Supreme Cavern Mystery Numinous Treasure Scripture of Flying Immortals and Deliverance Methods***

#### **Juan 1**
**Preface to Subtleties** – Introduces the initial matters for beginners: oral instructions, methods, entry-level practices, the Ten Precepts, and three ranks of ordination.

**Chapter on Initiating the Work** – Transmits secret oral instructions, practice methods, and the text for visualization. Opens the Dragon Han kalpa, the scripture of the Thirty-Two Heavens, the transmission of the Jade Elder’s red characters, recitation of the *Azure Vault Empty Song*, and talisman-writing.

**Chapter on True Responses** – When the Dao Lord first received the method, all the Perfected gathered at this moment. Instructs disciples to visualize the text before its revelation: close the eyes, enter quiescent observation, hold the breath for a long while, and invoke the Primordial Heavenly Worthy, who expounds the scripture, abiding atop the lion.

**Chapter on the Spirit of Consciousness** – The master states: This is the spirit governing all affairs in the Numinous Treasure methods. One should daily burn incense, perform morning rites, and maintain the following ritual implements.

**Chapter on Illuminated Responses** – When the Dao Lord first received the method, these illuminated responses were used to expound the scripture. Ten recitations return to one, forming the *Universal Summons to the Ten Directions Perfected Text*. Characters of golden script and jade seal-script are inscribed within the ritual diagram. The scripture contains oral instructions, along with summoning incantations for reference.

**Chapter on the Cavern Realm** – After the Heavenly Worthy transmitted the method, transformations were observed within the disciples’ dharmic bodies. Uses incantations over millet grains for concealment, spirit visualization, and techniques to restrain hun and po souls. Additional visualization incantations are included for practical use.

**Chapter on Body Protection** – Upon disciples receiving the method and practicing the work, the master feared residual karmic obstructions, as ghosts, spirits, wicked persons, or treacherous thieves might seek to harm them. Teaches the *Three-Step Ding Trigram Method*, instructing disciples to follow this practice for self-protection, rendering all ghosts, spirits, and wicked persons unable to cause harm.

**Chapter on Transmission** – The master admonishes disciples: This method is revered and sublime, its virtue beyond measure. The words herein are the hidden rhymes of the inner names of the Heavenly Emperors of the various heavens, as well as the secret taboos of demon kings and the concealed names of the hundred spirits—not ordinary terms of the mundane world. Practicing it with good karmic conditions, ten thousand calamities will not encroach, for it is the root of all Daoist methods.

**Chapter on Precept Procedures** – The master states: In practicing this method, one performs rituals to deliver ancestors, liberating them from the suffering of the dark night. Here, the Ten Precepts are expounded, and contracts are burned with straw effigies to summon and redeem karmic debts from eons past. This section also contains seven matters, which are elucidated in the *Clarifying Merit* section. The seven matters instruct disciples in receiving precepts, ordination, and issuing certificates.

**Chapter on Ordination Ranks** – The Dharma Master teaches disciples to traverse the passes of the various heavens, universally proclaiming texts such as the *Mandate of the Primordial Beginning to the Three Realms*. Again, the master exhorts disciples: The merit of this scripture is not small—it is the practice of superior adepts, leading to ascension. There are also three ranks of additional ordination.

**Chapter on Visualization** – Upon reaching this stage in practice, visualization incantations are employed. In daily practice, one recites only these. This chapter establishes the merit of reverent cultivation as a permanent institution.

#### **Juan 2**
**Preface to the Scripture**

**Chapter on Initiation and Transformation** – When the master sees that disciples have received transmission and practiced for three years, the sacred chart within their bodies manifests, revealing the primordial ancestral *qi* of the Origin. This gives rise to the myriad heavens, illuminating the Three Radiant Realms—this is called the Root of Heaven. Above, there is no further ancestry; only the Dao constitutes the body. Here, the methods of wearing and upholding the practice are imparted.

**Chapter on Transformative Generation** – This chapter follows the preceding one, wherein the five scriptures unfold expansively, revealing the Five Elders, the Five Emperors, the Crimson Script, and the Five Jade Sprouts of characters, displayed before all. There is the *qi* of numinous writing, which transforms into the Crimson Script. The Crimson Script then transforms into cultural artifacts. Whenever writing talismans or engaging in visualization, one recites the above text as an incantation.

**Chapter on Establishment** – Observing the ancestral *qi* generating the myriad heavens, within which lies the Jade Purity Realm, at the center—this is the Heaven within Heaven. The Three Realms are further revealed, and here, visualization is ordered as the daily practice. There are the Three Flower Detachment Talismans, inscribed within the Three Cinnabar Fields.

**Chapter on Deliverance** – The great circulation of Brahma-*qi* pervades the ten directions, revealing within it the divine powers of deliverance and immortality. The Five Emperors are also called the Five Elders. When all the sages descend in state, witnessing this vision, it is the supreme true emptiness—indestructible and imperishable, the transformed body of long-lived immortals.

**Chapter on Preserving Life** – Upon reaching this stage, one beholds the divine efficacy and the transformative manifestations of the Dharma-body. Radiance returns as the celestial chariot, and the assembled perfected ones, bearing talismans and registers, arrive before the Emperor. According to their respective functions, they rescue beings from life and death, enduring across kalpas.

**Chapter on Universal Proclamation** – Here, the Heavenly Worthy issues the true scriptures of the Three Realms, establishing covenant talismans to deliver disciples and their kalpas-spanning ancestral kin, enabling them to transcend the dark prisons. This is the Universal Proclamation Covenant for the Three Realms.

**Chapter on Mandates and Talismans** – The Heavenly Worthy issues the *Mandate of the Primordial Beginning* and golden-script talismans to transcend life and deliver the dead. Now, for the sake of disciples, to deliver their immeasurable kalpas-spanning ancestral kin, erase their evil records, and enable them to verify entry into the immortal lineage, becoming great immortals.

**Chapter on Establishing Covenants** – Within the revealed Dharma-chart, the sagely transformations of the Thirty-Two Heavens are set forth, establishing the covenant for ascending to heaven. Disciples who obtain the Dharma and practice the workings are examined daily for sagely merit. Here, the daily accumulation of evil karma and the daily dissolution of the physical body are expounded. Today, the Heavenly Worthy creates the true script of the Ascension Covenant, delivering disciples and their kalpas-spanning ancestral kin to heaven.

**Chapter on Covenant Systems** – Here, the Heavenly Worthy establishes the covenant methods, talismanic scriptures, the golden-script and jade-seal true texts of the Four Directions and Thirty-Two Heavens, along with the covenant forms. These joint covenant talismans enable transcendence beyond the dark prisons.

**Chapter on Traversing the Passes of the Heavens** – Here, the Heavenly Worthy establishes the true talismans of the various heavens, proclaiming to the heavens to sever the three evil roots. One power extends life and increases longevity; another dispels illness and removes misfortune; and another delivers ancestral kin.

**Juan 3**

**Chapter on Cosmic Transformation** – Here, the master demonstrates, universally proclaiming to the sovereigns of the boundless, commanding the center of heaven and earth. The spirits and gods of the four directions heed the mandate, carrying out the Dharma affairs.

**Chapter on Concealment and Transformation** – Within the scripture, the master expounds the *Primordial Cavern Jade Calendar*. Before heaven and earth were divided, there was originally no form or shadow; it arose only with the establishment of the great Brahma-*qi*. The *Jade Calendar* is born of the *qi* of the Northern Dipper. Now, the Dharma is transmitted to restrain and regulate it. Following the steps of the Dipper, one conceals oneself, later returning to the root—this serves as the visualization incantation for concealment. When the incantation is practiced, one naturally becomes hidden.

**Chapter on Numinous Charts** – Here, the master clarifies that within the middle section, after the primordial chaos, writing was first created. The earlier practice spoke of the transformative generation of the Crimson Script. The Crimson Script is not a text of cultivated transformation but originates from the beginning of the kalpa. Today, the Heavenly Worthy demonstrates the teaching: the Crimson Radiance unfolds the chart, as recorded in the *Scripture of the Jade Emperor’s Original Conduct*, making it the Dharma. Now, the sagely master incorporates it for application, thereby completing the Dao of flying immortals.

**Chapter on Crimson Script** – This chapter connects to the Crimson Script, the jade formulas, and the true incantations, expounding ancient texts. Later scholars found them difficult to apply. Now, the essential jade formulas are revealed, unfolding the ancient texts of the *Primordial Middle Section*. Though there are cultural artifacts of transformative generation, without methods of restraint, there are only the four directions, aligned with the Thirty-Two Heavens. The numinous script of jade characters is wondrous in its natural essence. Its *qi* emanates from the Nine Brahma Realms; its revealed jade formulas and the Eight Might Dragon Scripts wholly restrain the Nine Heavens, causing all demons to submit. Heaven establishes rites, and only then do gods and demons receive restraint within the true script and jade seals. These are compared and integrated as the Dharma.

**Chapter on Jade Formulas** – Here, the master issues the teachings of the Crimson Script’s true texts. First, one must proclaim and pacify the Five Peaks. Memorials are submitted to communicate, and those presented are deemed excellent. If done otherwise, there is no benefit. Thus, the methods for proclamation, memorials, and their application are now compiled into one chapter, enabling scholars to awaken and practice accordingly. The *Five Emperors’ Memorial Texts* follow the scripture at the front; the *Eight Might Dragon Scripts* follow at the back. The five sections are directly described below for application.

The true texts of the Five Directions’ Crimson Script have two uses, with the complete use comprising five writings. Within are secret methods for shifting applications: one proclaims to the Water Palace; one to the Earth Palace; one to the Peak Palace. The five writings are divided for use: one is offered to the sacred peaks of the mountains, inscribed on the eight solar terms, the first day of the sexagenary cycle, and one’s natal day; one is the summoning method, which, when practiced, radiantly subdues demonic spirits; one is the pacification of stellar transits to avert celestial calamities; one is the summoning of dragon heavens and water spirits to halt floods.

**Juan 4**

**Chapter on Dragon Memorials** – Here, the master transmits to the scholars of the Dao. When reciting these numinous texts as divine incantations, long cultivation of virtuous deeds with utmost sincerity ensures communion with the divine. Wherever applied, the summoning is immediately effective. Myriad transformations and wonders follow one’s will. Movement and stillness, concealment and revelation—one’s position is elevated to the Supreme Ultimate. The methods and forms are clearly set forth here.

**Chapter on the Primordial Framework** – Here, the return to the Primordial Framework is elucidated. The Primordial Framework is the essential path to ascending as an immortal, the supreme vista of the celestial steps. It clarifies for people that the Primordial Framework is none other than the primordial *qi*.

When one obtains the method and practices the work, the primordial *qi* ascends in reverse, opening and dredging the bones, vessels, sinews, and meridians throughout the body. Man is born by receiving the primordial *qi*, which forms the human frame. All above and below in the body belongs to *yin*, save only this essence, which is the *yang* essence. People fail to recognize this, so here it is clearly pointed out—transformations and divine numina—so that scholars may follow and practice accordingly.

Further contained herein is the *Cavern Chamber* method of cultivating the true. The *Numinous Sprout* chapter elucidates what precedes: when the myriad models unfold, the vermilion script of jade characters takes form, coalescing into the Five Sprouts. The transformations of the Five Sprouts—in heaven, they become the essence of the Five Thearchs; in man, they become the excellence of the Five Orbs. They govern the five *qi* at the center, thus one cultivates the *Cavern Chamber*. Practicing the *Primordial Framework* to distribute *qi* and ingesting the Five Sprouts serves as the method of refinement.

The *Eye of the Five Sprouts* method, the five-directional incantations, and the *True Writ of the Royal Directions* are here.

The *Benevolent Salvation* chapter instructs that those who receive and practice the Dao’s methods, understanding the boundless realms within the body, can deliver others. Above, the Eight Gates open, bearing the *Flying Celestial Dharma Wheel*. The sins and blessings of the human body are predetermined—prohibitions and precepts are karmic conditions of past lives. Now, all are universally received and delivered, and the body is reborn. Above the myriad heavens, each has its Gate of Life.

Within the center lies the Cavern Void, where melodies and chants resound, along with the *Numinous Scripture of the Demon Kings*. Thus, the verses of the *Numinous Scripture* are appended hereafter, for scholars to ponder their meaning and apply them accordingly.

Additionally, there are massage talismans, derived from the *Preface to the Illuminated Scripture*. This chapter is now distinguished as talismans for saving the world and arts of prohibition and control.

Herein are divided the true seal-scripts of the Three Realms:
1. In the Realm of Desire, there is the *Talisman for Severing the Hundred Evils*, the *True Script Jade Seal*, which subdues spectral beings and malevolent spirits.
2. In the Realm of Form, there are three talismanic methods:
   - One to pacify unsettled households;
   - One to resolve entangled karmic grievances;
   - One to suppress madness and demonic influences.
3. In the Formless Realm, there are two talismans:
   - One to dispel public and private calamities;
   - One as a *Talisman for Dispatching Ghosts*.

Above the Three Realms stand the Ancestral Origins. Amidst the soaring void, the chants of the Demon Kings resound. This talisman, when inscribed upon a slip and carried, traverses the passes of all heavens and may also be employed internally.

**Chapter Five: The Secret Treasury**
The Master of the Secret Treasury states: This teaches disciples that the sagely merit is no small matter—it is the celestial secret treasure. Now, the transmission of manual techniques serves as the dharma texts and incantations. The Exemplary Master clarifies two chapters herein:
- One chapter elucidates the revolutions of Heaven and Earth;
- One chapter elucidates the culmination of Heaven and Earth’s revolutions.

These two chapters comprise the hidden chants of the Celestial Emperors and the numinous Demon Kings, not ordinary words of the mundane world, hence deemed profound and difficult to fathom. As treasures of the heavens, they are secreted within the Purple Tenuity Palace of the Mystic Metropolis, transmitted once every forty thousand kalpas, and only to those of utmost integrity. After pledging an oath to the Ten Heavens, they may be conferred—never to be lightly transmitted.

The Master of the Inner Chant states: This elucidates the middle section of the *Numinous Writ of the Primordial Beginning*, which contains the hidden rhymes of the Thirty-Two Heavens. Herein, the efficacy of the cultivation of the perfected is revealed. There appears the *Crimson Clarity Unfolding Chart*, manifesting the uncorrupted True Void and the transformation of the body emerging from the chart. Further, the *Five Scripts Expanding the Vast* appear, all condensed from the *qi* of the Great Brahma. Employing the *Celestial Writ Jade Seal* and the *True Script Corresponding to the Body*, they align with the essentials of the Mystic Register. They deliver nine generations of karmic kin, establishing their names in the *Heaven-Ascending Charter*. Above, the four directions are divided, each with eight heavens. The main text is the *Primordial Beginning*, while the middle section instructs with hidden names. Those who inscribe the true script upon yellow silk and wear it will align their bodies with the Mystic Register, ascend to heaven with their nine generations, and attain immortality. Lesser scholars devoid of virtue must not lightly transmit this.

The Master of the Jade Characters states: Are the *Numinous Writ Jade Characters* wondrous in their natural essence? Their *qi* emanates from the Nine Brahma, their illumination revealed hereafter. Thus, their acquisition is meaningful, their transcription embodies form, and their ingestion is through the *qi* one receives. Their application lies in their significance. The *Jade Characters True Script* emerges from the *Heaven-Ascending Charter*.

The Master of the True Talismans herein presents twenty-five talismanic scripts. The Master of Ingesting Characters compiles the annual usage of character forms, directions, months, and days, urging Dao-cultivating scholars to diligently study and contemplate them, not to be treated lightly. Combined with practices of conduct, ingesting sprouts, and guarding the center, each has its appointed days—within a year, no more than a few. Though now taught in mundane script, the true celestial seal-scripts reside within the *Heaven-Ascending Charter*. One follows the principles of these characters in their application.

The Master of the Character Secrets elucidates herein the origins of character formation, all illuminated by Brahma-*qi* and adapted to their appropriate uses. Now, each is clarified in sequence, totaling two hundred fifty-six characters, derived from the middle section of the *Numinous Writ*.

The Master of Spontaneity states: The Dao’s subtlety is vast, encompassing all without omission. Whether arranged vertically, horizontally, inverted, or scattered, none fail to serve their purpose. The *Jade Characters of the Primordial Beginning’s* middle section emerge from the *qi* of the Great Brahma. Divided, they become characters; combined, they form sounds. Refined, they become talismans; condensed, they become incantations. Thus, they possess the forms of *flying seal-scripts* and *dispersed marvels*, all derived from the scriptural words to serve their salvific purpose. Now, they are compiled as methods.

The Master of Returning to the Mandate herein exhaustively reveals the profound and wondrous methods within this scripture. The preceding compilation of dharma teachings contains only the hidden languages of the heavens—boundless sounds. Though these sounds, characters, and texts exist within every person, among ten thousand, not one can comprehend them. The Sagely Master, therefore, repeatedly expounded in the north, breaking open the great Brahma’s hidden languages and boundless sounds of the heavens. Those who know these sounds and characters grasp the fundamental Dao of generating heaven, earth, humans, and all beings. Knowing the sounds, one knows the Dao. Knowing the Dao, one knows the nature and life within oneself. Knowing nature and life, one thus knows creation. Creation is fully realized in the cultivation merits of this scripture.

**Explanatory Notes**
The Master of the Spontaneous Jade Characters herein clarifies the *Ancestral Qi of Prior Heaven*. Once invested in the human body, it is called the *qi of the Great Brahma*. It teaches people through tangible forms and numbers to manifest the harmony of spontaneity, unfold its wonders, and establish wondrous methods of cultivation and action, transcending the primordial chaos and emerging beyond the expanse of the uncultivated. The sages employed texts to enact transformation, and texts were established by the sages to propagate teachings. Thus, methods emerged, named according to forms and numbers. From the *Mysterious Pass Illuminating the Three*, all are determined by shaping forms and numbers to fix the revolutions of destiny. The so-called *qi* is the complete embodiment of the Dao. As the Dao unfolds, its essence and brilliance manifest. The ancient sages taught observing celestial patterns to discern temporal changes and studying geography to understand mountain configurations. The so-called *texts* are not as they are today but originated from the creation of characters. This single statement must not be misunderstood as a commonplace discourse of the mundane world. If one comprehends this statement, they may escape birth and death, avoiding the wheel of rebirth.

Here follows the translation:

Now, the teachings and texts are divided into two matters, compiled into two chapters. This chapter elucidates the principles of writing. Writing, in all its forms, has been transmitted from antiquity to convey the sages’ intent, imparting sounds and meanings for human reflection. A single misstep in understanding leads to wandering through the cycles of rebirth. Having been born as humans, if one truly recognizes the preciousness of the body, the difficulty of the Dao, and the subtlety of writing, and comprehends them, one may be said to have returned the *qi* of the spirit to the original palace, and the true person to their former hidden state.

All who cultivate the truth and study the Dao must attend carefully to this chapter, pondering it deeply, for it contains profound wonders. Reflect upon it, reflect upon it.

The natural truth of the chapter’s master is revealed herein, clarifying the origin of written characters. Characters are formed by *qi*. Talismans are the essence of characters. Mantras are the principle of characters. Sounds are the resonance of characters. With cinnabar, one inscribes them upon paper. Talismans rely upon this to take form.

Originally, characters emerged from the great *qi* of Brahmā, possessing the transformative power of the myriad and the one. The true principle has three applications, and I shall now elucidate the three uses of the myriad and the one. The myriad and the one encompass heaven, earth, and humanity; all creatures, whether moving or still, and all things possessing form and number, do not depart from the creative transformations of the myriad and the one. These transformations have three uses. Generally speaking, they arise from the great *qi* of Brahmā, which then divides into the pure and the turbid. The pure becomes heaven, the turbid becomes earth, and the harmonious *qi* between them becomes humanity. Heaven is the first character, earth the second, and humanity, standing between them, is the third. Only thereafter does the human form take shape.

Initially, one is an ordinary person, mired in turbid *qi* and unaware that this body has been cultivated through the myriad and the one. The sacred transmissions and wondrous dharma texts fail to clarify this origin. Many who encounter this scripture do not understand its methods, for the sages’ intent lies concealed within its sounds and principles. They grope in darkness, passing their days as if in a dream. Even those who reach old age without encountering this scripture remain unable to comprehend it. The sacred transmissions only deliver those with latent good roots who are willing to believe.

As humans, we ought to understand these characters, deduce the principles, cultivate the body, and thereby fulfill our allotted lifespan—this is the proper path. Yet there are ordinary, turbid-minded people who, upon hearing Daoists speak of the Dao, laugh heartily. This is no wonder, for they were born in human form but lack the *qi* of the Dao to nourish them. Through countless kalpas, they have only accumulated the karmic conditions of beasts, which is why they laugh. Writing arises from the essence within; it does not belong to the likes of you.

Quietly observe the *Scripture of Salvation*: without writing, there is no illumination; without writing, there is no clarity; without writing, nothing is established; without writing, nothing is accomplished; without writing, none are delivered; without writing, none are born. In the *Chapter on the Birth of the Spirit in the Nine Heavens*, without this writing, the nine gates and barriers fail to generate spirit, and the embryo stagnates in death. Though the *qi* secures the root of truth, the spirit does not abide in life, the *qi* lacks fluidity, and one merely receives a single form.

Yet there are those who, willing to believe in the dharma, possess latent good roots and in this life have received pure *qi* from their parents. They cultivate good thoughts, love the Dao, revere heaven and earth, honor the divine, and diligently tend to incense and offerings, never departing from their original nature. Though obscured by the obstructions of past karmic debts and enmities, if they encounter a teacher who polishes the mirror and offers a single word of awakening, they immediately believe.

There are also those who, from childhood, observe abstinence, neither desiring marriage nor bearing children, and with a single thought devote themselves to cultivation. This is not by their own doing, for within their bodies reside the Three Origins, and in their palaces are inscribed golden names and purple characters, destined to become immortals of the Three Clarities in this life. Such individuals correspond to this text and its karmic conditions, which is why the supreme sages bequeathed these methods, transmitting hidden words, countless sounds, and characters to reveal the principles of creative transformation and the cultivation of truth.

Tracing this back, all things are molded and refined—what does not originate from the great Brahmā? From the moment humans are born, there is the Dao; where there is the Dao, there are methods. The sages established themselves here, the divine acted here, and the Dao flourished here. The divine became sagely through this, and thus the Dao and its methods were manifested to transform humanity. The Dao exists because of humanity; to illuminate the Dao, characters and texts are employed as teachings. With teachings established, the Dao becomes evident; with the Dao perfected, the teachings become divine. Without the utmost divinity and refinement, who could partake in this? Without the cultivation accumulated over countless kalpas, how could one encounter and hear of these teachings? Truly, these words are so.

The natural truth of the chapter’s master is revealed herein, expounding the principle of *ziran* (naturalness) and the attainment of truth. The term *ziran* is inexhaustible in meaning and not the common speech of worldly people. To "let it be natural" is to act accordingly. When matters are not yet ripe, one should speak of letting things take their natural course. Worldly people do not know the origin of these two characters. I shall now clarify this for your reflection.

The term *ziran* (naturalness) is but a humble name for your celestial nature. Before this illusory body existed, this name already was—hence it is called *ziran*. *Ziran* is heaven-born; as for you who are human, it is *ziran* that comes to invest itself in the womb. It is the parent of your body across kalpas, the one who inscribes your entire life—clothing and sustenance, poverty and lowliness, long life and early death, wealth and nobility, action and concealment—all arise from it. Thus, this person already possesses this master who governs, and so it is named. To "let it be natural" is to let all matters proceed by its will.

Now, in your cultivation, you seek to recognize and perceive it, for it can also birth you as an immortal. It governs the movement of yin and yang, subdues demons—all depends on this master within. All the myriad scriptures take these two characters as their foundation.

When you, in your cultivation, perceive it, it acts as *ziran* of its own accord, and in learning, you become the foremost sage. Here, the master clarifies that heaven and earth, all beings, and every formed thing are born of the Dao. The Dao’s generation is *ziran*; *ziran* brings forth completion.

As a human method, it is named the *qi* of Great Brahma. This *qi* enables movement and circulation. If one speaks only of *ziran*, the principle of movement, generation, and transformation cannot be seen. Yet the term *Great Brahma* must not be uttered lightly. In the Buddhist tradition, *Brahma* is mistakenly said to be the language of the Western barbarians—this is incorrect.

Within the human body lies the Seven-Treasure Flower Forest. The natural master, when investing itself in the womb to become human, dwells in this Seven-Treasure Forest, establishing life as an ordinary being. Thus, this principle is called the *qi* of Great Brahma, which generates the ten thousand things.

The preceding chapters first clarified the origin of written characters and the source of production. This chapter now elucidates the *qi* of Great Brahma. When cultivators attain the method, they arouse the *qi* of Great Brahma, returning to the root and restoring the origin. The *qi* of Brahma circulates throughout the body, coursing through the five viscera and six bowels, the nine orifices and four limbs, in harmony with the sun and moon’s movement in the great heavens—transforming and becoming real.

In general, the precious method of flying immortals who deliver others is none other than illuminating the function of *ziran* in attaining truth. Thus, they can transform, ascend, and become celestial immortals. Later in the scripture, the uses of transformation are fully prepared and may be observed.

Again, the master clarifies for the assembly the meaning of *ziran*. People of the world constantly utter these two characters in speech. Yet whenever they see someone affected or artful, or when a matter fails to come to fruition, they say, "It is naturally so." Uprightness becomes contrived, and *ziran* becomes crooked. If you examine this saying closely, you will realize the weight of these two characters. It is merely that an ordinary person, lacking understanding, speaks them lightly and considers it sufficient.

**Preface to Subtleties**
That which encompasses the Dao and thereby reveals the subtle is this.
When concluded and interpreted, it is called the *Explanatory Examples*.
The so-called *Shu Wei* clarifies the examples by emulating Heaven.

**Chapter One: Initiating the Epoch**
The Dao speaks: Long ago, in the Azure Heavens of the Beginning, within the Great Floating Li Realm of the Azure Vault’s Empty Song, the Primordial Beginning received the *Limitless Upper Grade Scripture for Delivering Humanity*.

The Master says: When this Dao Lord first received the method, he used this as the incantation talisman for contemplating the Dharma.
Facing right, bow twice to the east, burn incense, press the Zi mudra, and constrict to Chen. Inscribe one talisman.
Next, recite the *Azure Vault’s Empty Song* incantation talisman. Press the Wu mudra with the left hand and chant:
*"Wondrous is the Primordial Beginning’s Dao,
The Great Brahma unfolds the true script.
Above, it opens the Dragon Han kalpa,
Radiant and resplendent, its brilliance divides.
The script of the thirty-two heavens,
Transmitted by the Five Elders in vermilion characters.
Bestowing compassion to deliver from life and death,
Billowing forth auspicious clouds.
Within lies the long-life formula,
Cultivating sprouts to refine flying immortals.
Unsealing the profound and mysterious,
I bow my head in diligent reverence.
Gazing upward, I think of the High Spirits descending,
Riding the qi to return to the Three Clarities."*

**Chapter Two: The True Response**
When the Primordial Heavenly Worthy was about to expound this scripture, he circumambulated ten times to summon the ten directions.
As he first approached the seat, celestial perfected spirits, lofty sages, exalted worthies, and perfected ones of wondrous conduct—an innumerable host—came riding upon the void.

The Master said: *"Upon receiving the precious Dharma of *Flying Immortals Delivering Sentient Beings*, one’s name is secretly recorded and openly rewarded, entering an office in one of three grades: first, the Celestial Pivot Bureau; second, the Supreme Mystery Capital Bureau; and third, the Cavern Spirit Hall. Now, according to these three grades, the disciples’ merits shall be assessed, and their ranks determined by the depth of their karmic roots and the magnitude of their blessings:*
*1. Beginners in the Dao shall enter the Celestial Pivot Bureau’s official system.*
*2. Intermediate practitioners shall enter the Supreme Mystery Capital’s official system.*
*3. Advanced practitioners shall enter the Three Radiance and Cavern Spirit Halls’ celestial official system.*
*These three grades correspond to the depth of one’s Dharma reception."*

The Master said: *"Beyond these three grades of office, there are ranks. Ranks ascend from Immortal Aide to Perfected Duke, comprising eight levels. Those whose merits and powers are manifest may enter the Secret Register of Praise and Honor, which has three grades, from four characters to two."*

The Master said: *"Offices are divided into civil and martial branches. In the Celestial Pivot Bureau, they are called Civil and Martial Offices. Those who are illiterate, unversed in the Confucian classics, or unaware of their deeper meanings, yet aspire to the Dao, shall enter the Forest of Arms."*

**Chapter One: The Dragon Whip**

**Chapter Two: The Primordial Net**

The Primordial Net flows and unfolds,
Through thirty-two heavens.
Revolving without form,
Circling the ten directions.
Spinning the Dipper, traversing the Winnowing Basket,
Revolving through the five constants.
Thirty-five divisions,
Converge in the qi of the Upper Prime.
Eight luminous scenes merge in darkness,
Qi enters the Mystery of Mysteries.
Within the Mystery, the Grand August,
The Highest Perfected of the Supreme Emperor.
Floating upon the radiance of the great rosy clouds,
Chanting and intoning the cavernous chapters.
Golden perfection shines resplendent,
Its resonance flowing through the cloudy encampments.
Jade tones gather qi,
Spiritual winds amass mist.
The Purple Void flourishes in elegance,
Assisting and sheltering the myriad immortals.
A thousand harmonies, ten thousand unions,
Naturally attain perfection.
Within perfection dwells the spirit,
The Ever-Living Grand Lord.
The Peerless Duke,
The Venerable White Prime.
The Great One who Oversees Destiny,
Peach and Health unite to prolong life.
Grasping talismans, holding registers,
Preserving life and planting its root.
Ascending to the Upper Clarity,
Entering and exiting the Flowery Chambers.
Within the darkness,
In the subtlest of subtleties.
Below, it governs the human body,
In the Crimson Palace of the Mud Pill.
Centering the five qi,
Blending with the hundred spirits.
Ten revolutions return the numinous,
Myriad qi ascend as immortals.

The master says: "The Primordial Net is the essential path of ascending immortality, the supreme vista of the celestial steps. Once the source of the Dao divides, the divine heavens reside above the Hollow Cavern—beyond what words can exhaust, beyond what sight can perceive or hearing can grasp. Those who awaken to its perfection, through perfection cultivate perfection, and external perfection naturally responds. Those who recognize its subtlety, through subtlety attain subtlety, and external subtlety naturally responds. Observing the image of the divine heavens, the position of the Primordial Net—whether distant or near—can be known at once.

The human body possesses primordial qi, connected through the bone’s hidden apertures, ascending to the crown, just as the Primordial Net’s path exists in the heavens. The human soul and spirit within the body are like a person within the heavens—knowing their entry and exit leads to long life and flight; ignorance makes one a common fool, unlearned in arts and skills, unaware of the order of offices and ranks, yet seeking an audience with the sovereign.

When primordial qi fuses and gathers, it nourishes the soul and spirit, giving rise to true essence. The root of true essence lies between the left and right kidneys, called the Gate of Destiny, located in the spring bone’s aperture. Below it lies the great bone, its marrow penetrating the nineteenth vertebra. This aperture is often likened to the Tail of the Tortoise, its spirit the Queen Mother, who faces south to govern affairs. As the Emperor faces her, it is called the Mountain of the Western Tortoise—a metaphor adopted by Daoists. It is also called the Golden Watchtower, for its residence in the west. The right is termed the Golden Watchtower, the left the Jade Chamber. The Jade Chamber signifies jade within the mountain, its wood moistened, residing in the east. Moreover, jade is the origin of water, the transformation of yang essence, where essence congeals—named the Pure Abyss. This is the place from which the qi of the Primordial Net originates, the foundational site of its emanation. The establishment of the precious chart’s high altar begins here. The discourse on the Threefold Storage, the Terrace of Luxuriant Mist, is based upon this. The honored center of the terrace aligns directly with the heart—what is called the Numinous Terrace, the scene of the Upper Clarity. The upper boundary of the Grand Clarity lies below the heart.

The heart’s suspended root extends downward to the liver. Two divisions below the liver, the Northern Dipper’s seven stars reside. Its qi reaches the heart, its origin ascending to the tongue’s underside—named the Bubbling Spring. Its qi descends to the right kidney; the kidney’s qi leaks when the Bubbling Spring’s qi fails to restrain the crossing blades. The crossing blades refer to the Dipper’s handle star, the great □ illuminating the earth—its nature stern and deadly, its spirit the realm of desire. Those who know the Dao press the tongue against the upper palate, directly guiding the qi to ascend along the spine, connecting the spine to the head. The head is the essential path to the Upper Clarity’s Jade Capital. The so-called Western Tortoise and Jade Capital as neighboring realms—some today, unaware, mistakenly place the Western Tortoise in the brain. Yet the Tortoise lies forty million miles from the Jade Clarity’s qi—its remoteness is evident.

The heart resides in the center, its qi ascending directly to the heavens, where the Fire Star is lowest and its qi reaches first. Moreover, the heart pertains to fire, as does the Gate of Destiny’s qi—speaking of their mutual ascent and resonance. The heavens’ sun and moon align with the Fire Star, hence called the lunar triad. In the human body, the two breasts align with the heart. The two breasts are the root origin of the two eyes. The human’s two breasts store essence to nourish the eyes. Thus, when old age depletes qi and the eyes dim, the breasts lose their root, the kidneys lack essence.

The Dipper in the heavens’ northeast serves as the heavens’ pivot, the position of the mountain. In humans, this corresponds to the Shoulder Well point of the right hand. The human’s qi vessels begin on the right. The heavenly Dao moves, beginning in the northwest, proceeding west to the Ox Mansion, completing celestial affairs. Though celestial affairs conclude, generation cannot yet begin—thus creation arises in the north, re-entering the Fire Star. Though the human’s qi completes one cycle, its ebb and flow depend on re-entering the heart. Proceeding through fire, wood, water, and metal is the heavenly measure. Proceeding through heart, liver, kidneys, and lungs is the path of qi along the face and spine’s apertures. Observing the spine’s apertures reveals the above and below, left and right. Seeking its subtlety and tracing the throat’s ring, penetrating the crown gate—this is the subtlety of the Mystery of Mysteries. Subtlety cannot be fully expressed in words, nor can it be pointed to and named.

The formless realm lies below the heart, in the hollow space to the □’s left. From the Dipper’s mouth, the tongue presses the upper palate—this is called the Upper Heavenly Bridge, transcending the Upper Clarity. Thus, the scene of the Jade Clarity is the head, the scene of the Grand Clarity is the cinnabar field..."

The scene of the Upper Clarity is the Crimson Palace. The heart as the Spirit Terrace reveals the teachings of the Numinous Treasure. Thus, in guarding, one guards the heart. Thus, in audience, one attends the head. When the Three Flowers depart from their stems, the court of the Great Existence is revealed. Therefore, within the Heaven of Heaven, the assembly of Wu Ying and Bai Yuan occurs in the heart. Naturally attaining perfection, they assemble in the head. Having cultivated the Upper Dao to this point, the task is complete—no sound can contain it. Thus, it is recorded as the method of the Primordial Stem’s flying steps. Its subtleties are expounded in the *Pure Brightness* teachings; the Stem Diagram is presented below.

The Master says: The affairs of the Primordial Stem, when aligned within the body, pertain to the practices of whistling and chanting the Cavernous Chapters. Discussed in the scriptures, it is called the *Great Sovereign within the Mysterious*, culminating in the state of *Naturally Attaining Perfection and Abiding*. In essence, this is the scene of the Jade Clarity. The Jade Clarity is the Heaven above all heavens. Gazing upward, it is the Supreme; peering downward, it is the spirits of the sun, moon, five planets, and constellations, the emperors of the thirty-two heavens. This describes the assembly and audience before the High Perfected and Great Sovereign. The Great Sovereign resides in the Cavern Chamber, surrounded by the thirty-two heavens in array, encircled by the twenty-eight lunar lodges, with the sun, moon, and five planets standing in attendance—truly the court of the Great Existence.

Seeking this within the human body: the head is the Upper Heaven. The space between the eyebrows is the dwelling of the High Perfected and Great Sovereign. The floating radiance of the Great Auroras is the light within the eyes. Whistling and savoring the Cavernous Chapters are the breath entering and exiting the nose and mouth. The Metal Perfected corresponds to the nose. The flowing resonance of cloud formations and the jade tones that gather qi are the breath of the nose and mouth, their harmonics thus. The Purple Void is the space between the eyebrows. Assisting the myriad immortals, uniting the thousand harmonies and myriad unions, are the ears, eyes, and nose. Without reckless ingress or egress, true youths and children abide within. Their voices harmonize with the celestial sounds, resonating with the Cavernous Chapters. The balanced qi of central rectitude divides, and by its tone, one summons the harmonious qi to emerge, forming the incantation for spreading qi and sprinkling water.

The Master says: The Lord of Longevity is the true star of fire, the qi of the Great Sovereign within the Mysterious. Wu Ying, the Venerable Youth, and Bai Yuan, the White Prime, are the spirit-stars of metal and wood. The Supreme Unity Controller of Destiny is the honorific of water. Peach Prosperity and Union Court are the true emperors of earth. Verified through the Cavern Chamber’s immortal arts, secular texts differ in their discussions. Now, rectifying the original method and exhaustively pursuing its essential purport, we establish the *Cavern Chamber Method*.

**Method for Sprinkling Water and Spreading Qi**
For all incantations of water and spreading of qi: visualize the Great Sovereign within the Mysterious, clad in Upper Clarity robes, holding a green jade tablet, seated upon a lion throne. To his left stands the Lord of Longevity, to his right the Supreme Unity Controller of Destiny, both dressed in Upper Clarity robes and holding jade scepters in attendance. His form is the size of a jujube, located between the eyebrows, one inch square, resembling a golden palace pavilion, radiant with light like blue-red lapis lazuli illuminating water. When spreading qi, visualize the afflicted person and recite the incantation from the *Great Sovereign within the Mysterious* to *Naturally Attaining Perfection and Abiding*, nine times in total, contemplating the ears and eyes. From the nose, hear the immortal music of the Cavernous Chapters and the *Steps in Void* melody. When incanting water, blow qi into the water nine times. When spreading qi over the afflicted, blow nine breaths. If the spreading of qi proves ineffective, repeat the visualization and blowing three more times before ceasing.

**Cavern Chamber Method for Cultivating Perfection**
For all who cultivate perfection in the Cavern Chamber: this is also the essential method of *Three Guarding One*. At any time of day, sit in stillness and visualize the Great Sovereign within the Mysterious, clad in Upper Clarity robes, holding a green jade scepter, seated upon a lion throne. The Lord of Longevity stands to his left, the Supreme Unity Controller of Destiny to his right; Wu Ying to the left, Bai Yuan to the right; Peach Prosperity to the left, Peach Child to the right. The Lord of Longevity is fire. Fire transmits the kitchen without cease, hence it is called Longevity—the heart. The Supreme Unity is the spirit of the Gate of Destiny, hence the Controller of Destiny. Wu Ying is the spirit of the liver. Bai Yuan is the spirit of the lungs. Peach Prosperity and Union Court are the spirits of earth. Things entering earth decompose and generate, hence their spirits are two. These spirits reside in the navel, the root of life, as earth is the root of the Five Phases. To consider them as kidney spirits is incorrect. The kidneys are water, which is known through earth. Thus, when visualizing the kidneys, one also contemplates the two peaches. In visualization, proceed step by step: from their original palaces, each dons Upper Clarity robes woven with golden threads and auroral hues, attending the Central Venerable. The Great Sovereign resides between the eyebrows, clearly and distinctly. Within the inch between the brows lies the vast palace. The subtle incantation says: *"Within the true, the spirit abides; the myriad qi unite with the immortals."* Recite this eighty-one times, taking one breath per recitation. Next, visualize one’s own hun-soul clad in crimson silk, wearing a *Far-Wandering* crown, paying audience to the High Venerable Great Sovereign, sitting opposite him, with the host of perfected in attendance as before. Recite the previous incantation nine times, swallowing saliva eighty-one times before ceasing.

**Chapter Three: The Spirit Sprouts**
The Master says: The scriptures derive from the Brahman qi, their words encompassing myriad principles, all elucidating the Brahman qi’s distribution and the generation of numinous excellence. Thus, one knows that the red-script characters coalesce into the Five Sprouts. In heaven, they are the essences of the Five Emperors; in humans, the excellence of the five viscera. Governing the Five Qi at their center is to stabilize and pacify the One. Therefore, in cultivating the Cavern Chamber, practicing the Primordial Stem, spreading the spirit-qi, and ingesting the Five Sprouts, one employs the method of visualizing and consuming the generative qi.

**Method for Ingesting the Five Sprouts**
The Master says: The Nine Qi Azure Heaven, the Three Qi Cinnabar Heaven, the Central Yellow Heaven, the Seven Qi White Heaven, and the Five Qi Mysterious Heaven each possess the Five Emperors and Five Numinous Youths. The Azure Numinous Youth of the East oversees the books of the Pure Emperor, his name is Kai Yang, nine inches tall, clad in kingfisher-feather robes, holding a green banner, attending the left of the scripture.

The Vermilion Numinous Youth of the South oversees the books of the Vermilion Emperor, his name is Dan Zhu, three inches tall, clad in vermilion-feather robes, holding a vermilion staff, attending the front of the scripture. The Yellow Numinous Youth of the Center oversees the books of the Yellow Emperor, his name is Hong Ying, one inch and two fen tall, clad in yellow-feather robes, holding a yellow halberd, attending the center of the scripture. The White Numinous Youth of the West oversees the books of the White Emperor, his name is Ming Shi, seven inches tall, clad in plain-feather robes, holding a white banner, attending the right of the scripture. The Black Numinous Youth of the North oversees the books of the Black Emperor, his name is Yu Zi, five inches tall, clad in black-feather robes, holding a black standard, attending the rear of the scripture.

The practitioner visualizes these Five Numinous Youths descending into their body for a hundred days, and wears the true scripture for a hundred days. Their spirits reside within the five viscera, bringing forth the essence of the Five Sprouts.

On the day of *Lichun* (Beginning of Spring), at cock’s crow, enter the chamber, face east and bow nine times, sit upright, and click the teeth nine times. Visualize the Azure Emperor, whose name is Ling Wei, nine inches tall, wearing a crown of azure jade and a flying robe of nine-qi azure feathers, riding a jade chariot drawn by green dragons, bearing an owl banner, followed by ninety myriad officials of *jiǎ-yǐ* and the Elder of Beginnings descending. In an instant, generative azure qi transforms, like clouds enveloping one’s form, entering directly through the mouth into the liver viscera. Then visualize Jupiter gleaming brightly in the east, illuminating one’s body. Open the eyes, recite the incantation nine times, and swallow the twelve true characters of the Eastern scripture.

On the day of *Lixia* (Beginning of Summer), at cock’s crow, enter the chamber, face south and bow three times, sit upright, and click the teeth three times. Visualize the Vermilion Emperor, whose name is Piao Nu, two inches tall, wearing a crown of vermilion jade and a flying robe of three-qi cinnabar feathers, riding a jade chariot drawn by vermilion dragons, bearing a multicolored banner, followed by thirty myriad officials of *bǐng-dīng* and the True Elder descending. In an instant, generative vermilion qi transforms like fire, enveloping one’s form, entering through the mouth directly into the heart viscera. Then visualize Mars gleaming brightly in the south, illuminating one’s body. Open the eyes, recite the incantation three times, and swallow the twelve true characters of the Southern scripture.

On the four days of the equinoxes and solstices, at cock’s crow, enter the chamber, face the center and bow twelve times, sit upright, and click the teeth twelve times. Visualize the Yellow Emperor, whose name is Han Shu Niu, one foot and two inches tall, wearing a crown of yellow jade and a five-colored feathered robe, riding a jade chariot drawn by yellow dragons, bearing a yellow banner, followed by twelve myriad officials of *wù-jǐ* and the Primordial Elder descending. In an instant, generative yellow qi transforms like clouds, enveloping one’s body, entering through the mouth directly into the spleen viscera. Then visualize Saturn at the center of the heavens, illuminating one’s body. Open the eyes, recite the incantation twelve times, and swallow the sixteen true characters of the Central scripture.

On the day of *Liqiu* (Beginning of Autumn), at cock’s crow, enter the chamber, face west and bow seven times, sit upright, and click the teeth seven times. Visualize the White Emperor, whose name is Yao Po Bao, seven inches tall, wearing a crown of white jade and a flying robe of seven-qi white feathers, riding a jade chariot drawn by white dragons, bearing a plain banner, followed by seventy myriad officials of *gēng-xīn* and the August Elder descending. In an instant, generative white qi transforms like clouds, enveloping one’s form, entering through the mouth directly into the lung viscera. Then visualize Venus gleaming brightly in the west, illuminating one’s body. Open the eyes, recite the incantation seven times, and swallow the twelve true characters of the Western scripture.

On the day of *Lidong* (Beginning of Winter), at cock’s crow, enter the chamber, face north and bow five times, sit upright, and click the teeth five times. Visualize the Black Emperor, whose name is Yin Hou Ju, five inches tall, wearing a crown of dark jade and a flying robe of five-qi black feathers, riding a jade chariot drawn by black dragons, bearing a black banner, followed by fifty myriad officials of *rén-guǐ* and the Mysterious Elder descending. In an instant, generative black qi transforms like the light of a shooting star, enveloping one’s form, entering through the mouth directly into the kidney viscera. Then visualize Mercury gleaming brightly in the north, illuminating one’s body. Open the eyes, recite the incantation five times, and swallow the twelve true characters of the Northern scripture.

**Second Chapter: The Model Precedents**
The Dao says: These two chapters are the hidden sounds of the Celestial Thearchs and the Kings of the Numinous Demons—all are the words of the Great Brahma, not common speech of the mundane world. Their language lacks ornate rhythm, their melodies lack florid embellishment; thus, they are called profound and obscure, difficult to fathom in detail.

The heavens treasure them, secreting them in the Purple Tenuity Palace of the Mystic Metropolis. According to the Mystic Regulations, they are transmitted but once every forty thousand kalpas. If there is a perfected person whose heart is as precious as gold and jade, they must follow the old protocols, pledging an oath before the Ten Heavens, and only then are they entrusted with them.

The Dao says: The revolutions of heaven and earth also have their ends. The sun, moon, and five planets also wax and wane. Even the most sagely and divine persons have their times of rest and decline. Those of shallow learning also suffer illness and harm. When such disasters occur, all of like *qi* should unite in mind to perform purification rites, offer incense in the six periods, and recite the scripture ten times. Blessings and virtue will descend at once, dissolving all inauspiciousness.

The boundless text universally delivers the inexhaustible.

The Dao says: Those of shallow Daoist learning, whose immortal rank is not yet full, when their destined time of passing arrives and their bodies enter the Great Yin, at the moment of their departure, their fellow perfected students should offer incense on their behalf, recite the scripture ten times, and deliver the corpse according to the method. Then the soul will ascend directly to the Southern Palace, and according to the merit of their studies, after a calculated number of days, they will attain rebirth, transcend transmigration, and become immortals.

The Dao says: When the revolutions of heaven and earth reach their end, one should perform purification rites, offer incense, and recite the scripture. When the stellar lodges are misaligned and the sun and moon lose their proper times, one should perform purification rites, offer incense, and recite the scripture. When the four seasons lose their order and yin and yang are unbalanced, one should perform purification rites, offer incense, and recite the scripture. When the sovereign faces disaster and warfare arises on all sides, one should perform purification rites, offer incense, and recite the scripture. When pestilence spreads and the multitudes suffer death and injury, one should perform purification rites, offer incense, and recite the scripture. When masters or fellow students pass away, one should perform purification rites, offer incense, and recite the scripture.

The merit of purification rites and scripture recitation is weighty. Above, it dissolves celestial disasters and secures the emperor; below, it wards off poison and harm, delivering the multitudes. In life and death, all rely upon it—its blessings are beyond measure. Thus, it is called the Boundless, universally delivering gods and humans.

The Dao says: Whoever possesses this scripture and performs these meritorious deeds for heaven and earth, the sovereign, and the multitudes—on days of disaster, if they resolve to perform purification rites, burn incense, and recite the scripture ten times—all the heavens will record their names, myriad spirits will attend and protect them, and those of exceptional attainment will become sagely lords and ministers of the Golden Towers. The heavens record the merits and transgressions of people without the slightest error. Even the Demon Kings of Heaven will safeguard and recommend them. **Chapter VI: Ingesting the Characters**
The Master said: All who study the Dao must grasp its purport, its meaning, and its sequence.

What is meant by grasping its purport? To perceive without delusion, to apply with response, to trust and practice it.

What is meant by grasping its meaning? To base oneself on what is unerring, to seek with reason, to penetrate and awaken to it.

What is meant by grasping its sequence? To employ it with order, to keep it simple yet not cumbersome, to practice it with ease—then natural attainment will follow. How much more so for those with jade-like bearing and golden resolve, who diligently ponder and recite, not treating it as a hasty inquiry?

emerging from the Purple Chamber of Xuandu. Its governance presides over the kalpic conjunctions of Heaven and Earth. Those who ingest it pass through the calamities of the Nine Yangs. Precisely qián.

Wǎn-Shǒu-Shào-Dū,
emerging from the Sun Palace. Its governance presides over those who attain liberation. Those who ingest it find the Solar Lads descend, their faces suffused with radiant splendor. Upon transcending mortality, they undergo refinement. Precisely rì-jūn.

emerging from the Gate of Three Conveniences. Its governance presides over the suppression of demonic forces in the Celestial Center. Those who ingest it find their minds and spirits serene and upright, their recitations resonant and clear, their voices carried aloft to the heavens. Precisely gèn.

Huá-Mò-Yán-Yóu,

Ninefold Shoulder Discernment,
inscribed upon the Jade Tower above the Nine Heavens. Its governance presides over the qi of the four seasons. Those who ingest it find the four seasons all flourishing in abundance, with seasonal illnesses unceasingly dispelled. Precisely yín.

Ā-Nà-Pǐn-Shǒu,
emerging from the Hall of Luminous Perfection. Its governance presides over the ledgers of those who attain liberation. Those who ingest it find the registers of the Nine Dark Realms bestowing blessings upon their ancestors. Precisely yín.

Immeasurable,
emerging from the Northern Pavilion of the Purple Tenuity. Its governance presides over the elevation of those who attain the Dao. Those who ingest it find their names recorded in the Eastern Florescence. Precisely yín.

Supporting Canopy Afloat,
emerging from the Terrace of Nanyang. Its governance presides over the verification of dark ledgers. Those who ingest it find their accounts expunged in the Northern Capital, their names inscribed in the Southern Palace, and nine generations of ancestors transcending mortality. Precisely qián.

Luo-He-Shen,
inscribed upon the Terrace of Primordial Yang in the Great Veil. Its governance presides over the liberation of those of the highest rank. Those who ingest it find nine generations of ancestors emancipated and their own bodies attaining immortality. Precisely yín.

Jade Saliva of Cháng-Sāng-Dàng-Kōng,
inscribed upon the Azure Forest Trees of the Eastern Florescence. Its governance presides over the spontaneous sounds of the Celestial Center. Those who ingest it find their voices harmonizing with the Supreme Ultimate and their qi entering the Divine Empyrean. Precisely yín.

Liberating Immortality,
emerging from the Jade Terrace of Xuandu. Its governance presides over the ingestion of perfected beings. Those who ingest it find their faces suffused with jade radiance and nine generations of ancestors rejoicing together. Precisely yín.

Obtaining Non-Being,

Emerging from the Lofty Terrace of Xuandu. Its governance presides over the opening and closing of Heaven and Earth, the spontaneity of the true. Those who ingest it find themselves revolving with the cosmic wheel, never losing their original form. Precisely mǎo.

Self-Nurtured for Nine Days,
emerging from the Divine Tower. Its governance presides over the kalpas of Heaven and Earth. Those who ingest it attain extinction and receive the qi of Supreme Harmony, thereby entering the true. Precisely chén.

Dao of Qián,
also emerges. Its governance presides over unity. Those who ingest it ascend together with nine generations of ancestors. Precisely yín.

Mother of Kūn;
emerging from the Mulberry Controller’s Divine Lodge. Eastward it spreads, emerging from the Eastern Well’s Florescence Grove. Together they govern the fourfold surging of the great flood and the measures of its ebb and flow. When the waters flow, none are harmed; divine dragons guard the crossing. Precisely zǐ.

Form Enveloping the Supreme Mystery,
emerging from the Palace of the Supreme Ultimate. Its governance presides over great floods. When worn, it too can halt the waters. Inscribed in vermilion and worn. Precisely zǐ.

Dhāraṇī,
emerging from the Moon’s Lodge. Its governance presides over the yin and yang of Heaven and Earth. Those who ingest it find their bodies suffused with radiance, illuminating their five viscera. Precisely the Moon Sovereign.

Yù Miǎo,

Emerging from the Gate of Three Conveniences,
it governs the ledgers of life and death. Those who ingest it transcend great calamities and ascend to the rank of Immortal King. Precisely the primordial qi of life.

Misty Qi Converging with Clouds,
emerging from the Purple Tenuity’s Cloud Palace. It governs life and death. Those who ingest it attain passage to the Cinnabar Mound. Precisely the qi of life.

Flying Heaven,
emerging from the Jade Terrace above. It governs the natural emptiness of the Hollow Cavern. Those who ingest it find their bodies attuned to the four seasons and their nodes, their recitations ascending on high. Precisely the esoteric formula of the Original Master.

Great Chǒu,
emerging from the Gate of Three Conveniences, it governs the charts and records of life and death. Those who ingest it gain free passage through life and death, with demon kings as their guarantors. Precisely the rank and retinue of the Original Master.

Supreme Overseer of Heaven,
emerging from the Purple Lofty Long Tower. It encompasses the qi of all heavens. Those who ingest it see their seven generations ascend and transcend. Precisely yín.

Saha Kalpa Measure,
emerging from the Purple Illuminated Upper Palace. It governs meritorious deeds. Those who ingest it find their deeds inscribed across the Three Realms, ascending to the Cinnabar Mound’s precincts. Precisely the qi of life.

Dragon Han’s Radiant Essence,
emerging from the Dark Dipper’s midst. It governs the deliverance of those who attain the Dao. Those who ingest it see the souls of the Nine Glooms ascend to the boundless. Precisely the esoteric formula of the Original Master.

Azure Firmament’s Floating Li,
emerging from the Jade Clarity’s Cloud Palace. It governs the rites of the assembled perfected. Those who ingest it find myriad spirits in audience. Precisely the middle of the middle finger.

Empty Song Preserving Treasure,
emerging from the Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace. It governs spontaneous song. Those who ingest it gain knowledge of all heavenly sounds. Precisely yǒu.

Evil’s End,
emerging from the Purple Tenuity’s Great Void Lodge. It governs the deliverance of those who attain immortality.

Those who ingest it inscribe their names in the Vermilion Palace, their merit equaling that of the Flying Celestials. Precisely wǔ.

Unranked Cavern Wondrous and Spontaneously Real,
emerging from the Purple Pavilion of the Southern Sun’s Upper Palace. It governs merit. Those who ingest it know their past lives and transcend life and death. Precisely wǔ.

Primal Brahma Vast and Still,
emerging from the Supreme Ultimate Terrace of the Jade Clarity’s Upper Palace. It governs emptiness and spontaneity, engenders true knowing, and discerns the subtlest incipience. Those who ingest it gain wisdom. Precisely wǔ.

Secluded and Tranquil Deliverer of Humankind,
emerging from the Mysterious Female’s Portal of the Northern Gate. It governs the Six Repositories receiving the true body and generating radiance. Those who ingest it ascend to roam the Great Loftiness. Precisely qián.

**Chapter Eight: Spontaneity**

The Master said: The Dao’s wondrousness encompasses all without omission, vast or minute. Through its patterns—whether vertical or horizontal, inverted or direct, dispersed or coalesced—none fail to serve their purpose.

The Primordial’s middle-section jade script emerges from the Great Brahma’s qi. Divided, it becomes characters; combined, it becomes sound; refined, it becomes talismans; condensed, it becomes incantations. In the Western Han’s *Numinous Treasure* texts, there are forms of flying seal-script and scattered graphs, all derived from the scriptures to serve their use.

My present method of flying immortals and delivering humankind is rooted in ancient records, augmented by the immortal chambers, with additions and omissions to verify the *Numinous Treasure* teachings, ensuring thorough transmission without loss. Here, I briefly select one or two examples from the *Numinous Treasure* to demonstrate their unity.

First, the Five Thearchs’ Great Demons were originally for recommending the stagnant and obscure. Yet in the *Numinous Treasure*, they become deities who break altars and topple temples, governing mad, evil, martial, and valiant spirits—summonable and employable to protect and aid the weak and wandering disciples.

Second, the Eight Heavens of the East were originally four texts all serving as passports to ascent. Yet the *Numinous Treasure* retains only one, taking the East’s generative qi.

Third, the Eight Heavens of the South were originally only for praying for clear skies in the supremely yang regions. Yet the *Numinous Treasure* also employs them to pray for rain and uses their characters as talismans to command dragons.

Fourth, *Hua Mo Yan You* originally governed nightmares. Yet the *Numinous Treasure* employs it to halt thieving ghosts and bandits, for their natures are one.

Fifth, *Form Subduing the Supreme Mystery* was originally a talisman to restrain water. Yet the *Numinous Treasure* employs it to halt monstrous beasts and water spirits, for they are all yin types.

Sixth, *General Overseer of the Supreme Heavens* was originally a character governing qi. Yet the *Numinous Treasure* employs it to halt monstrosities, aid difficult childbirths, and affix it to the inner chambers to summon generative qi.

In these six cases, the *Numinous Treasure* methods differ from the *Deliverance of Humankind*. Yet if one seeks their spontaneous convergence and divergence, they are one.

**Chapter Nine: Returning to the Mandate**

The Dao said: Within these heavens, the Great Brahma’s hidden language and boundless sounds—ancient texts all measured a full *zhang* in length. The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign of Old inscribed their script to establish the correct pronunciation. Those who know these sounds and fast while reciting them will have the Flying Celestial Divine Kings of all heavens descend to observe their bodies, record their merits, and ascend to report to the heavens. Myriad spirits will pay homage, earthly deities will attend at the gates, great merit demon-kings will protect and recommend them as superior immortals. With the Dao perfected, they may roam the Three Realms and ascend through the Golden Gate.

The Master said: This is the origin of the scripture’s compilation. If one can contemplate this and awaken, they will strive without forgetfulness.

These sounds repel all, exorcise all, deliver all, and accomplish all—sounds of the Heavenly Perfected’s spontaneity. Thus, reciting them summons the Flying Celestials to descend and observe; the Supreme Thearch chants from afar; myriad spirits pay homage; the Three Realms attend at the carriage; demonic hordes bow their heads; ghostly essences perish of themselves. The jade-like resonance vibrates, the ten directions grow solemn and clear; rivers and seas fall silent; mountains and peaks swallow their mists; myriad spirits tremble and submit; immortals are summoned and gathered. The heavens are free of defilement, the earth free of demonic dust; dark wisdom is thoroughly purified, and the vastness of the Mystery of Mysteries is attained.

The Master said: This is the method of reciting the cavernal chapters. The Way of visualization values the severance of thought. Truly knowing the spontaneous sounds of heaven’s midst can summon the Flying Celestials to descend and observe. Thus, one must respond with authenticity, not false observation. Only by knowing the jade-like resonance and reciting and savoring it can the ten directions grow solemn and clear, free of external turbidity; rivers and seas fall silent, free of reckless movement; mountains and peaks swallow their mists, free of reckless leakage; myriad spirits tremble and submit, free of reckless harm; immortals are summoned and gathered, free of reckless monopolization. Thus, the nature and mind of heaven and earth become vast and empty. This is how dark wisdom is thoroughly purified and the vastness of the Mystery of Mysteries is attained.

**The Fifth Scroll of the Supreme Numinous Treasure Luminous Clarity Flying Immortals Deliverance of Humankind Scripture Concludes.**

chunks.original_text: 太上洞玄灵宝飞仙度人经法 经名：太上洞玄灵宝飞仙度人经法。 撰人不详，约出於南宋。 系宋元净明派重要经书之一。 假托净明祖师许逊真君注释《灵宝度人经》，演迷今明道法。 原书正文五卷，并目录一卷、释例一卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》洞玄部方法类。 太上洞玄灵宝飞仙度人经法目录 卷一 叙微是初学入事，诀法，下手行功，并十戒，三等受职。 启运章付秘传口诀，行功，看法文，上开龙汉劫，三十二天书，玉老赤字传，念碧落空歌，书符。 真应章道君受法之初，见众真皆会此时中 令弟子看法文未开时，冥目定观，闭息良久，念元始天尊当说是经，至师子上住。 识神章师曰：此灵宝一切法中行事之神，宜逐日烧香，朝礼，行持法具于后。 昭应章此道君受法之初，有此昭应用说经。 十遍一归，为普召十方真文。 有金书玉篆之字，书於法图中。 经内有诀法，另有召神咒可看。 洞界章天尊传法了，见弟子法身中有此变化。 用咒咒黍米，隐身存神，拘魂制魄之术。 另有存思咒诀在内，可看为用。 护身章见弟子得法行功，恐有宿业，一切鬼神、奸人、诡贼欲来害者。 行三步丁罡法，令弟子照此行持，以护身，一切鬼神、奸人不能害。 传受章师於此戒，谕弟子，此法尊妙，德难可胜。 经中所言，并是诸天上帝内名隐韵之音，亦是魔王内讳，百灵之隐名，非世上人间之常辞。 与善因缘行之，万灾不干，为万道之宗。 说戒科目章师曰：此法行功，有荐拔祖考，超出幽夜之苦。 於此演说十戒，制烧草人券，以追亿劫稽亲。 此篇中又有七事，至用明功中，大略七事，令弟子授戒付职，给牒在此。 职品章法师於此教行历关诸天，普告三界、元始符命等文。 再叮咛弟子知，此经功不小，此是上士行之，以至飞升。 又有三等加职。 存思章行功到此，有存思咒法，凡日行，只依此念。 本章以为崇修之功德，永作定制。 卷二 叙经
chunks.translated_text:
**The Supreme Cavern Mystery Numinous Treasure Scripture of Flying Immortals and Deliverance Methods**

**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Cavern Mystery Numinous Treasure Scripture of Flying Immortals and Deliverance Methods*. The compiler is unknown, approximately dating to the Southern Song dynasty. It is one of the essential scriptures of the Jingming (Pure Brightness) tradition during the Song and Yuan dynasties. Falsely attributed to the Jingming Patriarch, Perfected Lord Xu Sun, as a commentary on the *Numinous Treasure Scripture of Deliverance*, it expounds upon present-day Daoist methods. The original text comprises five juan of main content, along with one juan of catalog and one juan of exegetical examples.

**Source of the Base Text:** *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, Cavern Mystery Section, Methods Category.

---

### **Catalog of *The Supreme Cavern Mystery Numinous Treasure Scripture of Flying Immortals and Deliverance Methods***

#### **Juan 1**
**Preface to Subtleties** – Introduces the initial matters for beginners: oral instructions, methods, entry-level practices, the Ten Precepts, and three ranks of ordination.

**Chapter on Initiating the Work** – Transmits secret oral instructions, practice methods, and the text for visualization. Opens the Dragon Han kalpa, the scripture of the Thirty-Two Heavens, the transmission of the Jade Elder’s red characters, recitation of the *Azure Vault Empty Song*, and talisman-writing.

**Chapter on True Responses** – When the Dao Lord first received the method, all the Perfected gathered at this moment. Instructs disciples to visualize the text before its revelation: close the eyes, enter quiescent observation, hold the breath for a long while, and invoke the Primordial Heavenly Worthy, who expounds the scripture, abiding atop the lion.

**Chapter on the Spirit of Consciousness** – The master states: This is the spirit governing all affairs in the Numinous Treasure methods. One should daily burn incense, perform morning rites, and maintain the following ritual implements.

**Chapter on Illuminated Responses** – When the Dao Lord first received the method, these illuminated responses were used to expound the scripture. Ten recitations return to one, forming the *Universal Summons to the Ten Directions Perfected Text*. Characters of golden script and jade seal-script are inscribed within the ritual diagram. The scripture contains oral instructions, along with summoning incantations for reference.

**Chapter on the Cavern Realm** – After the Heavenly Worthy transmitted the method, transformations were observed within the disciples’ dharmic bodies. Uses incantations over millet grains for concealment, spirit visualization, and techniques to restrain hun and po souls. Additional visualization incantations are included for practical use.

**Chapter on Body Protection** – Upon disciples receiving the method and practicing the work, the master feared residual karmic obstructions, as ghosts, spirits, wicked persons, or treacherous thieves might seek to harm them. Teaches the *Three-Step Ding Trigram Method*, instructing disciples to follow this practice for self-protection, rendering all ghosts, spirits, and wicked persons unable to cause harm.

**Chapter on Transmission** – The master admonishes disciples: This method is revered and sublime, its virtue beyond measure. The words herein are the hidden rhymes of the inner names of the Heavenly Emperors of the various heavens, as well as the secret taboos of demon kings and the concealed names of the hundred spirits—not ordinary terms of the mundane world. Practicing it with good karmic conditions, ten thousand calamities will not encroach, for it is the root of all Daoist methods.

**Chapter on Precept Procedures** – The master states: In practicing this method, one performs rituals to deliver ancestors, liberating them from the suffering of the dark night. Here, the Ten Precepts are expounded, and contracts are burned with straw effigies to summon and redeem karmic debts from eons past. This section also contains seven matters, which are elucidated in the *Clarifying Merit* section. The seven matters instruct disciples in receiving precepts, ordination, and issuing certificates.

**Chapter on Ordination Ranks** – The Dharma Master teaches disciples to traverse the passes of the various heavens, universally proclaiming texts such as the *Mandate of the Primordial Beginning to the Three Realms*. Again, the master exhorts disciples: The merit of this scripture is not small—it is the practice of superior adepts, leading to ascension. There are also three ranks of additional ordination.

**Chapter on Visualization** – Upon reaching this stage in practice, visualization incantations are employed. In daily practice, one recites only these. This chapter establishes the merit of reverent cultivation as a permanent institution.

#### **Juan 2**
**Preface to the Scripture**
