chunks.original_text: 开化章师见弟子得传，行功三年，身中灵图，有显现出元始祖炁。 化生诸天，开明三景，是为天根。 上无复祖，唯道为身。 今为佩服行持法。 化生章此章叔前章，见五文开廓，现出五老五帝赤文五芽玉字，出示於人。 有灵书之炁，化为赤书。 赤书化为文物。 凡书符存思，念上文之为咒。 建立章见祖炁化生诸天，内有玉清之境，在中，为天中之天。 又显三境，於此序思； 以为日用之法。 有三华离便符，书于三丹田中。 度世章大行梵炁，周迥十方，显中有度人不死之神等。 五帝，又名五老。 众圣临轩，见有此景，是无上真空，不坏不灭，长生神仙之化身。 保生章到此，已见神功、法身造化。 倾光回驾，众真执符犯录，齐到帝前，随所应用，以救人之生死，劫劫长存。 普告章天尊於此，出三界真文，立券篆符，以度弟子亿劫种亲，超出幽户，作普告三界券。 符命章天尊出元始符命符篆金书，以超生度死。 今为弟了度无量亿劫种亲，削灭恶籍，证入仙宗，以为大仙。 立券章显法图中，有三十二天之圣化，立法升天券，弟子得法行功。 日功於此，考验圣功。 日生恶业，日消化身，在此出。 今天尊作为升天券符真文，度弟子自身，并亿劫种亲升天。 制券章天尊於此，立券法符文，四方三十二天金书玉篆真文并券式，合同券符，超出幽户。 历关诸天章天尊於此，立诸天真符，关告诸天，斩灭三恶根。 一能为延年益寿，一能为去病除祸； 一能为超度先祖。 卷三 运化章师於此示，普告无穷之主，领天地之中，四方鬼神听命，奉行法事。 隐化章师於经中，释出元洞玉历。 天地未判，本无形影，因大梵之炁立，始生。 玉历是罡炁生，今授法拘制，随罡步而隐，后命归根，以为存思隐身咒。 咒行，自然隐也。 灵图章师於此，明出中篇内，混沌之后，始制文字。 前功所说，化生赤书。 赤书非功夫造化之文，是浩劫之初。 今天尊示教，赤明开图，於玉皇本行经中，以为法。 今圣师编入参用，始全飞仙之道。 赤文章此章，接赤书，玉诀真文咒，说古文。 后来学者难施用。 今出玉诀真要，开演古文元始中篇。 虽有文物化生，无制伏之法，止有四方，按三十二天。 灵书玉字，妙体自然。 其炁分出於九梵，其开明玉诀、八威龙文，咸制九天，群魔始伏。 上天设礼，神魔才於真文玉篆之内授制。 以比相参，以为法。 玉诀章师於此，出教几行赤书真文。 先须开告、安镇五岳。 奏章疏通，呈者为佳。 便为之，无所益，故今出开告、奏章、法式、行用作一章，今学者於此悟行持。 五帝策文，随经在前； 八威龙文，随经在后。 直述五篇於于后，以为用。 五方赤书真文有二用、全用五书。 内有秘诀行移式：一告水府； 一告土府； 一告岳府。 拆用五书，一投灵山之岳，按八节、甲子、本命日书； 一摄召法，凡行，光摄伏魔精。 一安镇星度，以禳天灾。 一召龙天、水神止水法。 卷四 龙策章师於此授，学道之士。 喊此灵文施於神咒。 长修善事，精诚通达，则神灵交会。 所在施召，举向立到。 千变万奇，任意所从。 出入行藏，位推太极。 今有法式，明白在此。 元纲章归於此，明元纲者，升仙之要路，天阶之绝景。 明教人，知元纲即元炁。
chunks.translated_text:
**Chapter on Initiation and Transformation** – When the master sees that disciples have received transmission and practiced for three years, the sacred chart within their bodies manifests, revealing the primordial ancestral *qi* of the Origin. This gives rise to the myriad heavens, illuminating the Three Radiant Realms—this is called the Root of Heaven. Above, there is no further ancestry; only the Dao constitutes the body. Here, the methods of wearing and upholding the practice are imparted.

**Chapter on Transformative Generation** – This chapter follows the preceding one, wherein the five scriptures unfold expansively, revealing the Five Elders, the Five Emperors, the Crimson Script, and the Five Jade Sprouts of characters, displayed before all. There is the *qi* of numinous writing, which transforms into the Crimson Script. The Crimson Script then transforms into cultural artifacts. Whenever writing talismans or engaging in visualization, one recites the above text as an incantation.

The Three Realms are further revealed, and here, visualization is ordered as the daily practice. There are the Three Flower Detachment Talismans, inscribed within the Three Cinnabar Fields.

**Chapter on Deliverance** – The great circulation of Brahma-*qi* pervades the ten directions, revealing within it the divine powers of deliverance and immortality. The Five Emperors are also called the Five Elders. When all the sages descend in state, witnessing this vision, it is the supreme true emptiness—indestructible and imperishable, the transformed body of long-lived immortals.

**Chapter on Preserving Life** – Upon reaching this stage, one beholds the divine efficacy and the transformative manifestations of the Dharma-body. Radiance returns as the celestial chariot, and the assembled perfected ones, bearing talismans and registers, arrive before the Emperor. According to their respective functions, they rescue beings from life and death, enduring across kalpas.

**Chapter on Universal Proclamation** – Here, the Heavenly Worthy issues the true scriptures of the Three Realms, establishing covenant talismans to deliver disciples and their kalpas-spanning ancestral kin, enabling them to transcend the dark prisons. This is the Universal Proclamation Covenant for the Three Realms.

**Chapter on Mandates and Talismans** – The Heavenly Worthy issues the *Mandate of the Primordial Beginning* and golden-script talismans to transcend life and deliver the dead. Now, for the sake of disciples, to deliver their immeasurable kalpas-spanning ancestral kin, erase their evil records, and enable them to verify entry into the immortal lineage, becoming great immortals.

**Chapter on Establishing Covenants** – Within the revealed Dharma-chart, the sagely transformations of the Thirty-Two Heavens are set forth, establishing the covenant for ascending to heaven. Disciples who obtain the Dharma and practice the workings are examined daily for sagely merit. Here, the daily accumulation of evil karma and the daily dissolution of the physical body are expounded. Today, the Heavenly Worthy creates the true script of the Ascension Covenant, delivering disciples and their kalpas-spanning ancestral kin to heaven.

**Chapter on Covenant Systems** – Here, the Heavenly Worthy establishes the covenant methods, talismanic scriptures, the golden-script and jade-seal true texts of the Four Directions and Thirty-Two Heavens, along with the covenant forms. These joint covenant talismans enable transcendence beyond the dark prisons.

**Chapter on Traversing the Passes of the Heavens** – Here, the Heavenly Worthy establishes the true talismans of the various heavens, proclaiming to the heavens to sever the three evil roots. One power extends life and increases longevity; another dispels illness and removes misfortune; and another delivers ancestral kin.

**Juan 3**

**Chapter on Cosmic Transformation** – Here, the master demonstrates, universally proclaiming to the sovereigns of the boundless, commanding the center of heaven and earth. The spirits and gods of the four directions heed the mandate, carrying out the Dharma affairs.

**Chapter on Concealment and Transformation** – Within the scripture, the master expounds the *Primordial Cavern Jade Calendar*. Before heaven and earth were divided, there was originally no form or shadow; it arose only with the establishment of the great Brahma-*qi*. The *Jade Calendar* is born of the *qi* of the Northern Dipper. Now, the Dharma is transmitted to restrain and regulate it. Following the steps of the Dipper, one conceals oneself, later returning to the root—this serves as the visualization incantation for concealment. When the incantation is practiced, one naturally becomes hidden.

**Chapter on Numinous Charts** – Here, the master clarifies that within the middle section, after the primordial chaos, writing was first created. The earlier practice spoke of the transformative generation of the Crimson Script. The Crimson Script is not a text of cultivated transformation but originates from the beginning of the kalpa. Today, the Heavenly Worthy demonstrates the teaching: the Crimson Radiance unfolds the chart, as recorded in the *Scripture of the Jade Emperor’s Original Conduct*, making it the Dharma. Now, the sagely master incorporates it for application, thereby completing the Dao of flying immortals.

**Chapter on Crimson Script** – This chapter connects to the Crimson Script, the jade formulas, and the true incantations, expounding ancient texts. Later scholars found them difficult to apply. Now, the essential jade formulas are revealed, unfolding the ancient texts of the *Primordial Middle Section*. Though there are cultural artifacts of transformative generation, without methods of restraint, there are only the four directions, aligned with the Thirty-Two Heavens. The numinous script of jade characters is wondrous in its natural essence. Its *qi* emanates from the Nine Brahma Realms; its revealed jade formulas and the Eight Might Dragon Scripts wholly restrain the Nine Heavens, causing all demons to submit. Heaven establishes rites, and only then do gods and demons receive restraint within the true script and jade seals. These are compared and integrated as the Dharma.

**Chapter on Jade Formulas** – Here, the master issues the teachings of the Crimson Script’s true texts. First, one must proclaim and pacify the Five Peaks. Memorials are submitted to communicate, and those presented are deemed excellent. If done otherwise, there is no benefit. Thus, the methods for proclamation, memorials, and their application are now compiled into one chapter, enabling scholars to awaken and practice accordingly. The *Five Emperors’ Memorial Texts* follow the scripture at the front; the *Eight Might Dragon Scripts* follow at the back. The five sections are directly described below for application.

The true texts of the Five Directions’ Crimson Script have two uses, with the complete use comprising five writings. Within are secret methods for shifting applications: one proclaims to the Water Palace; one to the Earth Palace; one to the Peak Palace. The five writings are divided for use: one is offered to the sacred peaks of the mountains, inscribed on the eight solar terms, the first day of the sexagenary cycle, and one’s natal day; one is the summoning method, which, when practiced, radiantly subdues demonic spirits; one is the pacification of stellar transits to avert celestial calamities; one is the summoning of dragon heavens and water spirits to halt floods.

**Juan 4**

**Chapter on Dragon Memorials** – Here, the master transmits to the scholars of the Dao. When reciting these numinous texts as divine incantations, long cultivation of virtuous deeds with utmost sincerity ensures communion with the divine. Wherever applied, the summoning is immediately effective. Myriad transformations and wonders follow one’s will. Movement and stillness, concealment and revelation—one’s position is elevated to the Supreme Ultimate. The methods and forms are clearly set forth here.

**Chapter on the Primordial Framework** – Here, the return to the Primordial Framework is elucidated. The Primordial Framework is the essential path to ascending as an immortal, the supreme vista of the celestial steps. It clarifies for people that the Primordial Framework is none other than the primordial *qi*.

chunks.original_text: 人得法行功，元炁逆而上行，开通一身骨脉筋络。 人受元炁而生，生成人体。 一身上下皆属阴，只有这物是阳精。 人不识，故於此一一明指变化神灵，令学者遵而行之。 再有洞房修真法在此。 灵芽章师於此，明开前章。 得万范开张，化生赤书玉字，结为五芽。 五芽之化，在天，则为五帝之精； 在人，则为五官之秀。 中理五炁，故自修洞房。 行元纲布炁，而服五芽，以为修炼之法。 眼五芽法，五方咒，王方真文。 仁济章师於此，知受学道之士，得法行功，知身中无量之地能度人。 上开八门，有飞天法轮。 人身注定罪福，禁戒是宿命因缘。 令次普受开度，身又得受生。 诸天之上，各有生门。

chunks.original_text: 中有空洞，谣歌之音，及魔王灵篇，故令将灵篇之辞在后，今学士详其义而为之。 另有按摩符，出序明经也。 本章今别，以为救世之符，禁制之术。 此分出三界符文真篆。 第一欲界有断百邪符，真文玉篆，治精怪作祸。 第二色界有三道：一道镇家宅不宁； 一道解复连冤滞； 一道镇颠邪。 第三无色界有符二道：一道禳公私灾患； 一道是遣鬼符。 祖先为三界之上。 飞空之中，魔王之音。 此符一道，简上书此符，历关诸天，内亦用。 卷五 秘藏章师曰：此教弟子知圣功不小，是上天秘宝。 今换手下功，以为法文咒。 着例章师於此，明着二章。 一章明天地运度； 一章明天地运终。 此二章，并是诸天上帝及至灵魔王之隐秘之音，非世上之常辞，故谓玄奥难可寻。 详上天所宝，秘於玄都紫微上宫，依科四万劫一传，要择至人，告盟十天，然后可付，不可轻传。 内音章师曰：此明元始灵书中篇内，有三十二天隐韵之音。 於此，显修真之士功效。 有赤明开图，现真空不壤，化身出图。 又现五文开廓，皆是大梵之炁凝结。 却用天书玉篆，真文应身，应玄谱要。 度九祖亿劫种亲，立法名，升天券。 上分四方，每方八天，正文元始，中篇指教隐名。 有能以黄缯为地，书其真文佩带，身应玄谱，九祖升天，成仙也。 下士无德，勿以轻传。 玉字章师曰：灵书玉字，妙体自然？ 其炁分出於九梵，其开明见於后。 所以，取之者有义。 刘之者有体。 服之者，皆以炁之所受。 其用度，在於意义。 玉字真文，出升天券。 真符章师於此，出书二十五符文。 服字章师於此集，出终岁之用字体、方向、月日，令学道之士勤玩味读，不为造次之间乎。 兼以行持、服芽、守中，各有日子。 则一岁之间，不过数日。 今虽示教是凡间字样，真书真文天篆於升天券中。 照此字理而取用之。 字诀章师於此章，明出制字之因，皆梵炁开明，随其所宜而受持。 今逐一开明于此，计二百五十六字，出自灵书中篇。 自然章师曰：道之微妙，大无不包，小无不遗。 或以文纵横倒置，或离或散，无不当其用。 元始中篇玉字，出乎大梵之炁。 分之而为字，合之而为声； 妙之而为符，约之而为咒。 则有飞篆散殊之体，皆因经言，所以济用。 今编入，以为法。 复命章师於此，破尽此经中微奥微妙法。 前编法教中间，尽是诸天隐语，无量音。 此音字并文，人人虽有，万个中，无一人能知此音字。 圣师故於北再三说破，此诸天中大梵隐语，无量之音。 有能知其音字，便是生天、生地、生人、生物之道本。 知音，便知道。 知道，便知自身中性命。 知性命，故知有造化。 造化在此经中，方全修炼之功。 释例 自然玉字章师於此，明破先天祖炁。 一投为人身，只言大梵之炁。 教人以有形数，发自然之和，阐自然之妙，立修炼有为之妙法，超出於混沌之初，出於布夷之表。 圣人以文运化，文以圣立教。 以是而出法，依形数而名出。 自玄关明三便，皆以制形数而定期运。 则所谓炁者，道之全体。 道之敷落，其精华显。 古圣人教观天文，以察时变； 观地理，以察山势。 所谓文者，非今所为，而有始制文字。 此一句，为人不可不明，莫将为世，俗之常论。 若人知此一句，可逃生死，不入轮迥。

Within the center lies the Cavern Void, where melodies and chants resound, along with the *Numinous Scripture of the Demon Kings*. Thus, the verses of the *Numinous Scripture* are appended hereafter, for scholars to ponder their meaning and apply them accordingly.

Additionally, there are massage talismans, derived from the *Preface to the Illuminated Scripture*. This chapter is now distinguished as talismans for saving the world and arts of prohibition and control.

Herein are divided the true seal-scripts of the Three Realms:
1. In the Realm of Desire, there is the *Talisman for Severing the Hundred Evils*, the *True Script Jade Seal*, which subdues spectral beings and malevolent spirits.
2. In the Realm of Form, there are three talismanic methods:
   - One to pacify unsettled households;
   - One to resolve entangled karmic grievances;
   - One to suppress madness and demonic influences.
3. In the Formless Realm, there are two talismans:
   - One to dispel public and private calamities;
   - One as a *Talisman for Dispatching Ghosts*.

Above the Three Realms stand the Ancestral Origins. Amidst the soaring void, the chants of the Demon Kings resound. This talisman, when inscribed upon a slip and carried, traverses the passes of all heavens and may also be employed internally.

**Chapter Five: The Secret Treasury**
The Master of the Secret Treasury states: This teaches disciples that the sagely merit is no small matter—it is the celestial secret treasure. Now, the transmission of manual techniques serves as the dharma texts and incantations. The Exemplary Master clarifies two chapters herein:
- One chapter elucidates the revolutions of Heaven and Earth;
- One chapter elucidates the culmination of Heaven and Earth’s revolutions.

These two chapters comprise the hidden chants of the Celestial Emperors and the numinous Demon Kings, not ordinary words of the mundane world, hence deemed profound and difficult to fathom. As treasures of the heavens, they are secreted within the Purple Tenuity Palace of the Mystic Metropolis, transmitted once every forty thousand kalpas, and only to those of utmost integrity. After pledging an oath to the Ten Heavens, they may be conferred—never to be lightly transmitted.

The Master of the Inner Chant states: This elucidates the middle section of the *Numinous Writ of the Primordial Beginning*, which contains the hidden rhymes of the Thirty-Two Heavens. Herein, the efficacy of the cultivation of the perfected is revealed. There appears the *Crimson Clarity Unfolding Chart*, manifesting the uncorrupted True Void and the transformation of the body emerging from the chart. Further, the *Five Scripts Expanding the Vast* appear, all condensed from the *qi* of the Great Brahma. Employing the *Celestial Writ Jade Seal* and the *True Script Corresponding to the Body*, they align with the essentials of the Mystic Register. They deliver nine generations of karmic kin, establishing their names in the *Heaven-Ascending Charter*. Above, the four directions are divided, each with eight heavens. The main text is the *Primordial Beginning*, while the middle section instructs with hidden names. Those who inscribe the true script upon yellow silk and wear it will align their bodies with the Mystic Register, ascend to heaven with their nine generations, and attain immortality. Lesser scholars devoid of virtue must not lightly transmit this.

The Master of the Jade Characters states: Are the *Numinous Writ Jade Characters* wondrous in their natural essence? Their *qi* emanates from the Nine Brahma, their illumination revealed hereafter. Thus, their acquisition is meaningful, their transcription embodies form, and their ingestion is through the *qi* one receives. Their application lies in their significance. The *Jade Characters True Script* emerges from the *Heaven-Ascending Charter*.

The Master of the True Talismans herein presents twenty-five talismanic scripts. The Master of Ingesting Characters compiles the annual usage of character forms, directions, months, and days, urging Dao-cultivating scholars to diligently study and contemplate them, not to be treated lightly. Combined with practices of conduct, ingesting sprouts, and guarding the center, each has its appointed days—within a year, no more than a few. Though now taught in mundane script, the true celestial seal-scripts reside within the *Heaven-Ascending Charter*. One follows the principles of these characters in their application.

The Master of the Character Secrets elucidates herein the origins of character formation, all illuminated by Brahma-*qi* and adapted to their appropriate uses. Now, each is clarified in sequence, totaling two hundred fifty-six characters, derived from the middle section of the *Numinous Writ*.

The Master of Spontaneity states: The Dao’s subtlety is vast, encompassing all without omission. Whether arranged vertically, horizontally, inverted, or scattered, none fail to serve their purpose. The *Jade Characters of the Primordial Beginning’s* middle section emerge from the *qi* of the Great Brahma. Divided, they become characters; combined, they form sounds. Refined, they become talismans; condensed, they become incantations. Thus, they possess the forms of *flying seal-scripts* and *dispersed marvels*, all derived from the scriptural words to serve their salvific purpose. Now, they are compiled as methods.

The Master of Returning to the Mandate herein exhaustively reveals the profound and wondrous methods within this scripture. The preceding compilation of dharma teachings contains only the hidden languages of the heavens—boundless sounds. Though these sounds, characters, and texts exist within every person, among ten thousand, not one can comprehend them. The Sagely Master, therefore, repeatedly expounded in the north, breaking open the great Brahma’s hidden languages and boundless sounds of the heavens. Those who know these sounds and characters grasp the fundamental Dao of generating heaven, earth, humans, and all beings. Knowing the sounds, one knows the Dao. Knowing the Dao, one knows the nature and life within oneself. Knowing nature and life, one thus knows creation. Creation is fully realized in the cultivation merits of this scripture.

**Explanatory Notes**
The Master of the Spontaneous Jade Characters herein clarifies the *Ancestral Qi of Prior Heaven*. Once invested in the human body, it is called the *qi of the Great Brahma*. It teaches people through tangible forms and numbers to manifest the harmony of spontaneity, unfold its wonders, and establish wondrous methods of cultivation and action, transcending the primordial chaos and emerging beyond the expanse of the uncultivated. The sages employed texts to enact transformation, and texts were established by the sages to propagate teachings. Thus, methods emerged, named according to forms and numbers. From the *Mysterious Pass Illuminating the Three*, all are determined by shaping forms and numbers to fix the revolutions of destiny. The so-called *qi* is the complete embodiment of the Dao. As the Dao unfolds, its essence and brilliance manifest. The ancient sages taught observing celestial patterns to discern temporal changes and studying geography to understand mountain configurations. The so-called *texts* are not as they are today but originated from the creation of characters. This single statement must not be misunderstood as a commonplace discourse of the mundane world. If one comprehends this statement, they may escape birth and death, avoiding the wheel of rebirth.

chunks.original_text: 今出教文字两事，编二章。 此章箄明文理。 文者，皆昔同传圣意，垂言音与人省。 一念失科，流浪轮转。 今已生为人，诚能知身之贵，道之难，文之妙，而明之，可谓灵炁回元宫，真人归旧隐者也。 凡修真学道者，於此篇中，留心细详，甚有妙处，味之，味之。 自然真理章师於此篇，明字之出处。 字者，炁所结也。 符者，字之精也。 咒者，字之理也。 含者，字之音也。 以丹染纸，字之。 与符托此，而形容也。 原夫字者，出乎大梵之炁，有万一之化。 真理有三用焉，吾今开明万一三用。 万一者，天地人物，蠢动含灵，一切有形有数，皆不离万一之造化。 造化，有三用，大抵总而言之，乃大梵之炁，遂有清浊之分。 清者为天，浊者为地，中和之炁为人。 天一字，地二字，中者为人，三字也。 人之形体，而后於此。 一为凡夫，省事入浊秽之炁中，俱不明此身是万一上修来。 上件圣传，妙法文字，皆不能明於此出处，多有得遇此经，亦不明此经法，皆是圣意，隐音义理。 上求冥冥於幽暗之中，度日又如梦中人。 皓首不遇此经，亦不能明。 上件圣传，止度得宿有善根，肯信之人。 本乎为人，合明此文字，推道理修身，而全终天年之寿，是本等道路。 有等凡夫浊子，遇道人谈道，大笑。 详之，非怪，不由他，他本受人形为人，无道炁所养，累劫至今，止结得畜生业缘，故所以大笑。 文字，体中所生，无有汝等。 静看度人经中一篇，无文不光，无文不明，无文不立，无文不成，无文不度，无文不生。 九天生神章，而无此文。 九户关塞，体不生神，则胞胎结滞死。 炁固根真，景不守生，炁无津，徒受一形。 又有一等肯信法之人，宿有善缘，今世又受父母之清炁，仍习善念，好道，敬天地，重神明，勤香火，还不离旧性。 虽被宿业冤亲障蔽朦昧，若遇磨镜之师，点化一言，而便信。 又有一等，自小斋戒，男女不愿婚配，一念修行者，亦不由他，此子身中有三元，宫中宿有金名，紫字刻书，来生应为三清神仙之人。 当应此文，有此数等之缘会，故上圣垂此法，教留传隐语、亿音、文字，显发造化修真之义理。 由是而推，万范陶冶，孰不出乎大梵者哉。 原人之有生则有道，有道则有法。 圣於此立，神於此行，道於此兴。 神因此而成圣，故显道法以化人。 道因人而有，明道，则出字文为教。 教设而道着，道成而教神矣。 非天下之至神至精，其孰能与於此。 若非累劫之熏修，岂得见闻此教。 诚哉，是言也。 自然成真章师於此，释出自然成真真理。 自然二字，释之无尽，非世人常俗之言。 听其自然，是为此。 事不及，便开言说听其自然。 世俗之人，不知此二字出处。 吾今明汝等省。

Here follows the translation:

Now, the teachings and texts are divided into two matters, compiled into two chapters. This chapter elucidates the principles of writing. Writing, in all its forms, has been transmitted from antiquity to convey the sages’ intent, imparting sounds and meanings for human reflection. A single misstep in understanding leads to wandering through the cycles of rebirth. Having been born as humans, if one truly recognizes the preciousness of the body, the difficulty of the Dao, and the subtlety of writing, and comprehends them, one may be said to have returned the *qi* of the spirit to the original palace, and the true person to their former hidden state.

All who cultivate the truth and study the Dao must attend carefully to this chapter, pondering it deeply, for it contains profound wonders. Reflect upon it, reflect upon it.

The natural truth of the chapter’s master is revealed herein, clarifying the origin of written characters. Characters are formed by *qi*. Talismans are the essence of characters. Mantras are the principle of characters. Sounds are the resonance of characters. With cinnabar, one inscribes them upon paper. Talismans rely upon this to take form.

Originally, characters emerged from the great *qi* of Brahmā, possessing the transformative power of the myriad and the one. The true principle has three applications, and I shall now elucidate the three uses of the myriad and the one. The myriad and the one encompass heaven, earth, and humanity; all creatures, whether moving or still, and all things possessing form and number, do not depart from the creative transformations of the myriad and the one. These transformations have three uses. Generally speaking, they arise from the great *qi* of Brahmā, which then divides into the pure and the turbid. The pure becomes heaven, the turbid becomes earth, and the harmonious *qi* between them becomes humanity. Heaven is the first character, earth the second, and humanity, standing between them, is the third. Only thereafter does the human form take shape.

Initially, one is an ordinary person, mired in turbid *qi* and unaware that this body has been cultivated through the myriad and the one. The sacred transmissions and wondrous dharma texts fail to clarify this origin. Many who encounter this scripture do not understand its methods, for the sages’ intent lies concealed within its sounds and principles. They grope in darkness, passing their days as if in a dream. Even those who reach old age without encountering this scripture remain unable to comprehend it. The sacred transmissions only deliver those with latent good roots who are willing to believe.

As humans, we ought to understand these characters, deduce the principles, cultivate the body, and thereby fulfill our allotted lifespan—this is the proper path. Yet there are ordinary, turbid-minded people who, upon hearing Daoists speak of the Dao, laugh heartily. This is no wonder, for they were born in human form but lack the *qi* of the Dao to nourish them. Through countless kalpas, they have only accumulated the karmic conditions of beasts, which is why they laugh. Writing arises from the essence within; it does not belong to the likes of you.

Quietly observe the *Scripture of Salvation*: without writing, there is no illumination; without writing, there is no clarity; without writing, nothing is established; without writing, nothing is accomplished; without writing, none are delivered; without writing, none are born. In the *Chapter on the Birth of the Spirit in the Nine Heavens*, without this writing, the nine gates and barriers fail to generate spirit, and the embryo stagnates in death. Though the *qi* secures the root of truth, the spirit does not abide in life, the *qi* lacks fluidity, and one merely receives a single form.

Yet there are those who, willing to believe in the dharma, possess latent good roots and in this life have received pure *qi* from their parents. They cultivate good thoughts, love the Dao, revere heaven and earth, honor the divine, and diligently tend to incense and offerings, never departing from their original nature. Though obscured by the obstructions of past karmic debts and enmities, if they encounter a teacher who polishes the mirror and offers a single word of awakening, they immediately believe.

There are also those who, from childhood, observe abstinence, neither desiring marriage nor bearing children, and with a single thought devote themselves to cultivation. This is not by their own doing, for within their bodies reside the Three Origins, and in their palaces are inscribed golden names and purple characters, destined to become immortals of the Three Clarities in this life. Such individuals correspond to this text and its karmic conditions, which is why the supreme sages bequeathed these methods, transmitting hidden words, countless sounds, and characters to reveal the principles of creative transformation and the cultivation of truth.

Tracing this back, all things are molded and refined—what does not originate from the great Brahmā? From the moment humans are born, there is the Dao; where there is the Dao, there are methods. The sages established themselves here, the divine acted here, and the Dao flourished here. The divine became sagely through this, and thus the Dao and its methods were manifested to transform humanity. The Dao exists because of humanity; to illuminate the Dao, characters and texts are employed as teachings. With teachings established, the Dao becomes evident; with the Dao perfected, the teachings become divine. Without the utmost divinity and refinement, who could partake in this? Without the cultivation accumulated over countless kalpas, how could one encounter and hear of these teachings? Truly, these words are so.

The natural truth of the chapter’s master is revealed herein, expounding the principle of *ziran* (naturalness) and the attainment of truth. The term *ziran* is inexhaustible in meaning and not the common speech of worldly people. To "let it be natural" is to act accordingly. When matters are not yet ripe, one should speak of letting things take their natural course. Worldly people do not know the origin of these two characters. I shall now clarify this for your reflection.

The ancient sages taught observing celestial patterns to discern temporal changes and studying geography to understand mountain configurations. The so-called *texts* are not as they are today but originated from the creation of characters. This single statement must not be misunderstood as a commonplace discourse of the mundane world. If one comprehends this statement, they may escape birth and death, avoiding the wheel of rebirth.

chunks.original_text: 自然是汝天性之小名。 未有此幻身，先有此名，故称自然。 自然是天生，汝等为人，是他来投胎。 他是汝历劫生身亲父母，他能注汝一生，衣禄、贫贱、寿夭、富贵、行藏，悉由他生，以为此人已有此主主张，故叫名。 听其自然，诸事由他。 今安修行，又要寻见识得他，他又能生汝为神仙。 运阴阳，降魔，皆凭此主人公。 以此经万卷，不离此二字为头。 今汝修行见他，他便作自然而然，学而第一圣。 师於此，明天地、人物、一切有形，皆凭道生。 道生是自然，自然生成。 为人法，名大梵之炁。 炁能运行，若只言自然，不能见运行生化之理，大梵二字，又不可轻易而言。 释氏门中，称梵言为西番番人之言，非也。 人身中有七宝华林，自然主人投胎为人，他在七宝林中安身立命为凡夫。 故将此理，称大梵之炁，能生万物。 前二章，先明始制文字，生产之源出处了。 此一章，草明大梵之炁，修行人得法，制起大梵之炁，返本还元。 一身梵炁周流，与大天地中日月运行，同贯穿五脏六腑，九窍四肢，变化成真。 大率飞仙度人宝法无他，萆明自然成真之用，故能变化，飞升作天仙。 经后有备，悉变化之用可照。 又明与大众，省自然二字。 世之人，口头常不离此二字。 但凡见人扭捏巧篇，一件事后不成，便说天生自然。 端正扭捏，自然歪斜。 可将此语详之，便省此二字不小可。 只是做一个凡夫不省，只凭说得出便了。

The term *ziran* (naturalness) is but a humble name for your celestial nature. Before this illusory body existed, this name already was—hence it is called *ziran*. *Ziran* is heaven-born; as for you who are human, it is *ziran* that comes to invest itself in the womb. It is the parent of your body across kalpas, the one who inscribes your entire life—clothing and sustenance, poverty and lowliness, long life and early death, wealth and nobility, action and concealment—all arise from it. Thus, this person already possesses this master who governs, and so it is named. To "let it be natural" is to let all matters proceed by its will.

Now, in your cultivation, you seek to recognize and perceive it, for it can also birth you as an immortal. It governs the movement of yin and yang, subdues demons—all depends on this master within. All the myriad scriptures take these two characters as their foundation.

When you, in your cultivation, perceive it, it acts as *ziran* of its own accord, and in learning, you become the foremost sage. Here, the master clarifies that heaven and earth, all beings, and every formed thing are born of the Dao. The Dao’s generation is *ziran*; *ziran* brings forth completion.

As a human method, it is named the *qi* of Great Brahma. This *qi* enables movement and circulation. If one speaks only of *ziran*, the principle of movement, generation, and transformation cannot be seen. Yet the term *Great Brahma* must not be uttered lightly. In the Buddhist tradition, *Brahma* is mistakenly said to be the language of the Western barbarians—this is incorrect.

Within the human body lies the Seven-Treasure Flower Forest. The natural master, when investing itself in the womb to become human, dwells in this Seven-Treasure Forest, establishing life as an ordinary being. Thus, this principle is called the *qi* of Great Brahma, which generates the ten thousand things.

The preceding chapters first clarified the origin of written characters and the source of production. This chapter now elucidates the *qi* of Great Brahma. When cultivators attain the method, they arouse the *qi* of Great Brahma, returning to the root and restoring the origin. The *qi* of Brahma circulates throughout the body, coursing through the five viscera and six bowels, the nine orifices and four limbs, in harmony with the sun and moon’s movement in the great heavens—transforming and becoming real.

In general, the precious method of flying immortals who deliver others is none other than illuminating the function of *ziran* in attaining truth. Thus, they can transform, ascend, and become celestial immortals. Later in the scripture, the uses of transformation are fully prepared and may be observed.

Again, the master clarifies for the assembly the meaning of *ziran*. People of the world constantly utter these two characters in speech. Yet whenever they see someone affected or artful, or when a matter fails to come to fruition, they say, "It is naturally so." Uprightness becomes contrived, and *ziran* becomes crooked. If you examine this saying closely, you will realize the weight of these two characters. It is merely that an ordinary person, lacking understanding, speaks them lightly and considers it sufficient.

chunks.original_text: 太上洞玄灵宝飞仙度人经法目录竟 太上灵宝净明飞仙度人经法卷一 高明大使神功妙济真君许旌阳释 叙微 言其道包含，所以彰微者，此也。 终而释之，谓之释例。 所谓叔微者，以明例象天。 启运章第－ 道言：昔於始青天中，碧落空歌大浮黎土，受元始度人无量上品。 师曰：此道君叔，受法之初，用为看法之咒符。 右面，东再拜烧香，掐子，勒至辰，书符一道。 次念碧落空歌咒符，左手掐午，歌曰： 妙哉元始道，大梵敷真文。 上开龙汉劫，焕烂光彩分。 三十二天书，五老赤字传。 垂慈度生死，郁勃吐祥云。 中有长命诀，植芽炼飞仙。 开函发玄奥，稽首生精勤。 仰思高灵降，乘气归三清。 真应章第二 元始天尊当说是经，周回十过，以召十方。 始当诣座，天真大神、上圣高尊、妙行真人、无鞅数众乘空而来。 飞云丹霄，绿舆琼输，羽盖垂荫，流精玉光，五色郁勃，洞焕太空，七日七夜。 诸天日月星宿，游玑玉衡，一时停轮，神风静默，山海藏云，天无浮翳，四炁朗清。 一国地土，山川林木，缅平一等，无复高下，土皆作碧玉，无有异色。 众真侍座，元始天尊玄座空浮五色狮子之上。 师曰：此道君受法之初，众真皆会。 此时始有 净明二篇灵书。 明王因之造法着经，用之净身。 看法文时，存思咒#1。 右弟子看法文。 净身了，未开法文时，再拜，以两手掐中指上节，闭息良久，暝目定观，念咒。 见众真皆会，再拜放诀。 看法文念咒时，先云：我闻元始天尊至狮子之上。 则 又曰：弟子庆幸，今日愿受度

The *Tai Shang Dong Xuan Ling Bao Fei Xian Du Ren Jing Fa* Catalog Concludes
*Tai Shang Ling Bao Jing Ming Fei Xian Du Ren Jing Fa*, Scroll One
Interpreted by the High and Illustrious Great Envoy, Divine Merit and Wondrous Salvation True Lord Xu Jingyang

**Preface to Subtleties**
That which encompasses the Dao and thereby reveals the subtle is this.
When concluded and interpreted, it is called the *Explanatory Examples*.
The so-called *Shu Wei* clarifies the examples by emulating Heaven.

**Chapter One: Initiating the Epoch**
The Dao speaks: Long ago, in the Azure Heavens of the Beginning, within the Great Floating Li Realm of the Azure Vault’s Empty Song, the Primordial Beginning received the *Limitless Upper Grade Scripture for Delivering Humanity*.

The Master says: When this Dao Lord first received the method, he used this as the incantation talisman for contemplating the Dharma.
Facing right, bow twice to the east, burn incense, press the Zi mudra, and constrict to Chen. Inscribe one talisman.
Next, recite the *Azure Vault’s Empty Song* incantation talisman. Press the Wu mudra with the left hand and chant:
*"Wondrous is the Primordial Beginning’s Dao,
The Great Brahma unfolds the true script.
Above, it opens the Dragon Han kalpa,
Radiant and resplendent, its brilliance divides.
The script of the thirty-two heavens,
Transmitted by the Five Elders in vermilion characters.
Bestowing compassion to deliver from life and death,
Billowing forth auspicious clouds.
Within lies the long-life formula,
Cultivating sprouts to refine flying immortals.
Unsealing the profound and mysterious,
I bow my head in diligent reverence.
Gazing upward, I think of the High Spirits descending,
Riding the qi to return to the Three Clarities."*

**Chapter Two: The True Response**
When the Primordial Heavenly Worthy was about to expound this scripture, he circumambulated ten times to summon the ten directions.
As he first approached the seat, celestial perfected spirits, lofty sages, exalted worthies, and perfected ones of wondrous conduct—an innumerable host—came riding upon the void.
Flying clouds in the cinnabar firmament, jade chariots with emerald canopies, feathered canopies casting shade, flowing essence and jade radiance, five colors billowing, illuminating the great void, for seven days and seven nights.
The sun, moon, and stellar lodges of the various heavens, the jade turning mechanism and the stellar balance, all halted their wheels. Divine winds stilled, mountains and seas concealed their clouds, the heavens were free of drifting veils, and the four qi shone clearly.
The lands of the entire realm, its mountains, rivers, forests, and trees, were leveled as one, with no more high or low. The earth transformed into azure jade, uniform in color.
The assembled perfected ones attended the seat, while the Primordial Heavenly Worthy’s mysterious seat floated upon five-colored lions.

The Master says: When this Dao Lord first received the method, all the perfected ones gathered.
At this time, the two scrolls of the *Ling Bao Jing Ming* scripture first appeared.
The Illuminated King, relying on them, created methods and composed scriptures, using them to purify the body.
When contemplating the Dharma text, visualize and recite *Incantation #1*.
The disciple, when contemplating the Dharma text, purifies the body.
Before opening the Dharma text, bow twice, press the upper joint of the middle finger with both hands, hold the breath for a long while, close the eyes in fixed contemplation, and recite the incantation.
Seeing all the perfected ones gathered, bow twice and release the mudra.
When contemplating the Dharma text and reciting the incantation, first say: *"I have heard that the Primordial Heavenly Worthy has arrived upon the lions."*
Then say: *"Disciple, how fortunate! Today, I vow to receive deliverance."*

chunks.original_text: 识神章第三 祖师太阳上帝孝道仙王灵宝净明天尊，祖师太阴元君孝道明王灵宝净明黄素天尊，经师至孝恭顺仙王，籍师玄都御史真君，监度师三天扶教辅元大法天师正一冲玄静应真君，度师九州都仙太史高明大使至道玄应神功妙济真君，灵宝 净明玄中传教圣师，灵宝净明下教仙乡，灵宝净明飞天度人大元帅帝君，灵宝净明飞天度人大使者帝君，灵宝净明飞天度人三十六位帝君，灵宝净明飞天度人十方神王，灵宝 净明飞天度人三百六十万神王，灵宝净明飞天度人十方长生大神，灵宝净明飞天度人三部秘法羽衣誊籍判官，灵宝净明飞天度人绣衣玉童玉女，灵宝净明飞天度人侍经五帝直符，灵宝 净明飞天度人侍经五炁功曹，灵宝净明飞天度人周天传言、传香、传文、典籍使，灵宝争明飞天度人护身、传真、卫真、监真吏，灵宝净明飞天度人前后二十四史吏，灵宝争明飞天度人直事传言飞龙骑吏，灵宝 净明飞天度人八万四千灵官寨主将，灵宝净明飞天度人八万四千寨节员甲马，灵宝净明飞天度人八万四千受事，灵宝净明飞天度人三界直符，灵宝净明飞天度人怛他苏伽功曹。 师曰：此灵宝一切法中行事之神，宜於每日遂烧香朝礼。 行持法具于后： 每日子时起，烧香，存法院向西，法师向东立，垂两手掐寅，叩齿三十六通。 放诀，收手一拜，如见日光，圆数丈，直照面。 又两拜，叩齿九通。 咒曰： 道香德香，无为清争香，灵宝净明香。 供养灵宝净明尊，六位都法主，一切灵宝君、帝君及天君神王、诸主宰。 愿我所行法，速得遂我心。 上报君父母，下救众生苦。 真炁常满体，役使诸万灵，万灵尽归依。 急急如律令。 咒毕，吸太阳一口吞。 凡遇每月朔望，即子时出庭，下掐寅，叩齿三十六通，存想十方无极飞天神王侍立四方，青龙、白虎、朱雀、玄武卫身。 放诀收手，心拜三过，叩齿三通，后咒： 道香德香，无为清净香，灵宝序明香。 供养太上三境尊、八极诸天帝、净明灵宝上圣，三界五帝大魔，七政五斗诸星辰，十方无极无量品神王官将，一切威灵。 今日欣庆，修行至经，惟愿安镇国家，济度天人，九祖升迁，万神侍卫，稽首归依无极大道。 又叩齿三通，咽睡二过，再拜二过。 师曰：於此迷识神章。 一者，所以叙行道受法之人，上真护卫，贵在崇奉。 逐日清旦行香诵持，知其衣服仪卫之像，存念不失於生时。 因奉至道，名受遥勋，字载玄谱。 神澄气彻，日作真游。 死则正入仙阶，身厕三十六位灵宝真人之下。 夫为灵宝真人者，即天真大神妙行真人之果也，如玄中传教圣师者。 如今日 净明设教，则有玄中大法师等降汝身中，辅汝心性，使自达晓。 故开一位洞神下教仙卿者。 汝等开度人，使忠孝之道李明之说，行之不失，有益生齿，必证此位，令洞府神仙管摄之。 昭应章第四 说经一徧，诸天大圣同时称善，是时一国男女聋病，耳皆开聪。 说经二徧，盲者目明。 说经三徧，暗者能言。 说经四徧，跛病积逮，皆能起行。 说经五徧，久病疝疾，一时复形。 说经六徧，发白返黑，齿落更生。 说经七徧，老者返壮，少者皆强。 说经八徧，妇人怀娠，乌兽含胎，已生未生，皆得生成。 说经九褊，地藏发泄，金玉露形。

**Chapter Three: The Chapter on Recognizing the Spirit**

The Patriarch, the Sun Emperor, the Filial Dao Immortal King, the Numinous Treasure Pure Illumination Heavenly Worthy; the Patriarch, the Moon Primordial Sovereign, the Filial Illumination King, the Numinous Treasure Pure Illumination Yellow Simplicity Heavenly Worthy; the Scripture Master, the Utmost Filial Reverent Immortal King; the Register Master, the Mysterious Capital Censor True Lord; the Supervising Master, the Three Heavens Upholding Teaching, Assisting Primordial Great Dharma Heavenly Master, Orthodox Unity, Penetrating Mystery, Serene Response True Lord; the Deliverance Master, the Nine Provinces All Immortals Grand Scribe, Illustrious Enlightener, Supreme Dao, Mysterious Response, Divine Merit, Wondrous Salvation True Lord; the Numinous Treasure Pure Illumination Mysterious Center Transmission Teaching Sage Master; the Numinous Treasure Pure Illumination Lower Teaching Immortal Realm; the Numinous Treasure Pure Illumination Flying Heaven Deliverance Humans Great Marshal Emperor Lord; the Numinous Treasure Pure Illumination Flying Heaven Deliverance Humans Great Envoy Emperor Lord; the Numinous Treasure Pure Illumination Flying Heaven Deliverance Humans Thirty-Six Emperor Lords; the Numinous Treasure Pure Illumination Flying Heaven Deliverance Humans Ten Directions Divine Kings; the Numinous Treasure Pure Illumination Flying Heaven Deliverance Humans Three Hundred Sixty Myriad Divine Kings; the Numinous Treasure Pure Illumination Flying Heaven Deliverance Humans Ten Directions Longevity Great Spirits; the Numinous Treasure Pure Illumination Flying Heaven Deliverance Humans Three Divisions Secret Dharma Feathered Robe Register Judges; the Numinous Treasure Pure Illumination Flying Heaven Deliverance Humans Embroidered Robe Jade Lads and Jade Maidens; the Numinous Treasure Pure Illumination Flying Heaven Deliverance Humans Attending Scripture Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans; the Numinous Treasure Pure Illumination Flying Heaven Deliverance Humans Attending Scripture Five Qi Functionaries; the Numinous Treasure Pure Illumination Flying Heaven Deliverance Humans Circumpolar Heaven Transmitting Words, Transmitting Incense, Transmitting Texts, and Canonical Scribes; the Numinous Treasure Pure Illumination Flying Heaven Deliverance Humans Protecting Body, Transmitting Perfection, Guarding Perfection, and Supervising Perfection Officers; the Numinous Treasure Pure Illumination Flying Heaven Deliverance Humans Former and Latter Twenty-Four Historiographers; the Numinous Treasure Pure Illumination Flying Heaven Deliverance Humans Direct Attendants Transmitting Words Flying Dragon Riders; the Numinous Treasure Pure Illumination Flying Heaven Deliverance Humans Eighty-Four Thousand Numinous Officials, Camp Commanders, and Generals; the Numinous Treasure Pure Illumination Flying Heaven Deliverance Humans Eighty-Four Thousand Camp Officers, Armored Horses, and Cavalry; the Numinous Treasure Pure Illumination Flying Heaven Deliverance Humans Eighty-Four Thousand Attendants; the Numinous Treasure Pure Illumination Flying Heaven Deliverance Humans Three Realms Direct Talismans; the Numinous Treasure Pure Illumination Flying Heaven Deliverance Humans *Tatāsūtra* Functionaries.

The Master says: These are the spirits who act in all Numinous Treasure methods. It is fitting to burn incense and pay homage to them daily.

The method of practice is as follows:
Each day at the *zi* hour, rise and burn incense. Visualize the Dharma courtyard facing west, with the Dharma master standing east. Let both hands hang down, press the *yin* position, and click the teeth thirty-six times. Release the mudra, withdraw the hands, and bow once. Visualize the sunlight, round and several *zhang* in size, shining directly upon the face. Bow twice more and click the teeth nine times.

The incantation says:
*Dao* fragrance, virtue fragrance,
Non-action pure and clear fragrance,
Numinous Treasure Pure Illumination fragrance.
I offer to the Numinous Treasure Pure Illumination Worthy,
the Six Positions’ Dharma Lords,
all Numinous Treasure Lords, Emperor Lords, Heavenly Lords, Divine Kings, and all sovereigns.
May the Dharma I practice swiftly fulfill my heart’s desire.
Above, repay the kindness of sovereign and parents;
below, relieve the suffering of all beings.
May true qi always fill my body,
commanding the myriad spirits,
all spirits submitting in reverence.
Swiftly, swiftly, as in the statutes and ordinances.

After the incantation, inhale the sun’s qi and swallow it.

On the first and fifteenth of each month, at the *zi* hour, go out to the courtyard. Press the *yin* position below, click the teeth thirty-six times, and visualize the boundless Flying Heaven Divine Kings of the ten directions standing in attendance at the four quarters, with the Azure Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, and Dark Warrior guarding the body. Release the mudra, withdraw the hands, bow three times in the heart, click the teeth three times, and then recite the incantation:

*Dao* fragrance, virtue fragrance,
Non-action pure and clear fragrance,
Numinous Treasure Illumination fragrance.
I offer to the Supreme Three Realms Worthies,
the Eight Poles’ Thearchs of the Heavens,
the Pure Illumination Numinous Treasure Upper Sages,
the Three Realms’ Five Thearchs, Great Demons,
the Seven Governors, Five Ladles’ stellar spirits,
the boundless, immeasurable ranks of Divine Kings, officials, and generals of the ten directions,
all majestic spirits.
Today, rejoicing in celebration,
I practice and recite the supreme scripture.
I only wish for the nation’s peace and stability,
the salvation of heaven and humanity,
the ascension of the nine ancestors,
the ten thousand spirits’ attendance and protection.
I bow my head in reverence to the boundless Great Dao.

Click the teeth three more times, swallow saliva twice, and bow twice more.

The Master says: Herein lies the obscurity of the *Recognizing the Spirit* chapter.
First, it recounts how those who practice the Dao and receive the Dharma are protected and guarded by the Upper Perfected. Their reverence lies in esteeming and serving them. Each day at dawn, perform the incense ritual and recitation, knowing the attire and retinue’s appearance, visualizing without fail in one’s lifetime. By serving the supreme Dao, one’s name is recorded for distant merit, and one’s name is inscribed in the Mysterious Register. Spirit clear and qi penetrating, one daily engages in true wandering. In death, one rightly enters the immortal ranks, one’s body placed beneath the thirty-six Numinous Treasure Perfected of the thirty-six positions. To be a Numinous Treasure Perfected is to attain the fruit of the Heavenly Perfected, the Great Divine, the Wondrous Practice Perfected—like the Mysterious Center Transmission Teaching Sage Master. Now, in the Pure Illumination teaching’s establishment, there are Mysterious Center Great Dharma Masters and others who descend into your body, assisting your heart and nature, enabling self-realization. Thus, opening a position for the Cavern Spirit Lower Teaching Immortal Ministers. You who deliver others, cause the Dao of loyalty and filial piety, the teachings of Li Ming, to be practiced without fail, benefiting the living and ensuring attainment of this position, allowing the grotto palace immortals to govern and oversee it.

**Chapter Four: The Chapter on Manifest Responses**

After the scripture is recited once, all the Heavenly Great Sages simultaneously praise its goodness. At that time, the deaf and mute of the entire kingdom have their ears opened and hear clearly. After the second recitation, the blind regain their sight. After the third recitation, the mute can speak. After the fourth recitation, the lame and those with chronic illnesses can all rise and walk. After the fifth recitation, those with long-standing *shan* illnesses instantly recover their form. After the sixth recitation, white hair returns to black, and fallen teeth regrow. After the seventh recitation, the old return to youth, and the young grow stronger. After the eighth recitation, pregnant women, birds, and beasts bearing young—whether born or unborn—all successfully give birth. After the ninth recitation, the earth’s treasures are revealed, and gold and jade appear in their forms.

It is used as the universal summons for the true scripture of the ten directions, comprising a celestial seal-script text of one hundred fifty-two characters. For all memorials and ritual offerings, this must be employed to invoke the ten directions. The text is written in cinnabar on azure paper.

Inhale a mouthful of qi from each of the five directions, recite the Upper, Middle, and Lower Chapters of the *Numinous Scripture* once, then hold the breath. With the left hand, form the master’s mudra and trace the *mao* seal over the text. First inscribe the following: *"Your servant [Name] has heard that when the Heavenly Worthy first inscribed the scripture and recited it once through to completion, all attained longevity."* Then write: *"Today, rejoicing in the celebration of this purification rite, I pray to receive deliverance."*

When the writing is complete, face east with white cogon grass, recite the incantation, and burn it. Below the incantation is a passage from the scripture, beginning with *"The Dao declares..."* and ending with *"all arrive together."* Then bow twice and say: *"Disciple, rejoicing in the celebration of this purification rite today, humbly prays that the host of perfected beings from the ten directions and three realms descend to this altar. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!"*

chunks.original_text: 召神咒 道言：是时元始天尊说经一徧，东方无极无量品至真大神无鞅之众，浮空而至。 说经二徧，南方无极无量品至真大神无鞅之众，浮空而至。 说经三徧，西方无极无量品至真大神无鞅之众，浮空而至。 说经四徧，北方无极无量品至真大神无鞅之众，浮空而至。 说经五徧，东北无极无量品至真大神无鞅之众，浮空而至。 说经六徧，东南无极无量品至真大神无鞅之众，浮空而至。 说经七徧，西南无极无量品至真大神无鞅之众，浮空而至。 说经八徧，西北无极无量品至真大神无鞅之众，浮空而至。 说经九徧，上方无极无量品至真大神无鞅之众，浮空而至。 说经十徧，下方无极无量品至真大神无鞅之众，浮空而至。 十徧周竟，十方无极天真大神，一时同至。 师曰：此道君受法之初，诸天皆至，用为烧真文咒。 洞界章第五 一国男女，倾心归仰。 来者有如细雨密雾，无鞅之众，注国一半，土皆偏陷，非可禁止。 於是元始天尊悬一宝珠，大如黍米，在空玄之中，去地五丈。 元始登引，天真大神、上圣高尊、妙行真人、十方无极至真大神，无鞅数众，俱入宝珠之中。 天人仰看，唯见勃勃从珠口中入。 既入珠口，不知所在。 国人廓散，地还平正，无复欹陷。 元始即於宝珠之内，说经都竟，众真监度，以授於我。 当此之时，喜庆难言。 法事粗恶，诸天复位，倏忽之间，寂无遗响。 师曰：此天尊说经之时，有此变化，用为法师咒。 黍米隐身存神，拘魂制魄之术。 右取黍米一升，选天德月德日，北向，左手掐本师诀卯文，右手斗诀。 先启白六师真师、北斗真君。 取北斗紫炁七。 ，念咒曰： 吾闻元始天尊度人无量说经既周一国男女至，寂无遣响。 吾今咒此黍米，隐身存神，拘魂制魄。 变化莫测，运度无边。 急急如太上勑。 次吹炁入黍米，放净合内供养，每日、一存思吞服。 存思法 每日早晨入靖，吞净明宝箓了，取黍一米一百二十粒，入室静坐。 存泥丸中有青炁，心中有白炁，脐中有黄一炁。 三炁俱生，如云覆身。 因变成一大火烧身，身色洞彻内外，良久乃止。 於是以黍米就服炁，以鼻引青炁，一百二十行咽之止，次以水吞米。 护身章第六 是时，人巡值经法，普得济度，全其本年，无有中伤。 倾土归仰，咸行善心。 不杀不害，不嫉不妬，不淫不盗，不贪不欲，不憎不(女十自)。 言无华绮，口无恶声，齐同慈爱，异骨成亲，国安民丰，欣乐太平。 经始出教一国，以道预有至心，崇奉礼敬，皆得度世。 师曰：此元始天尊，为道君说经之际，天人遇值经法，皆生此道心，为法师护身咒。 右每以本命生受胎日，於寅上步罡，七徧念此咒，即一切鬼神、奸人诡贼，欲见害者，皆自消散； 十方善人，皆来钦重。 如要见贵人，即隔日步罡，而后往。 步罡时，存身为道君，手执道君玉印。 右取受胎日法，谓如甲子月生，以乙卯为受胎月，戊辰日生。 戊与癸合，辰与酉合。 癸酉日受胎日，於前戊辰日内寻，不前则后。 每年於此日，作用不拘。 南斗讳魑魍魅魅魑魁五行水火木金土 已上自取三步丁罡，入魁至魒。 右步水至金，右足起步南斗，从尾至头，入斗中。 以左挑北斗盖头，自斗反身出，再丁罡步，入北斗，凡七徧止，思变为七身，七身如一。
chunks.translated_text:
**Summoning Deities Incantation**

The Dao declares: When the Primordial Heavenly Worthy first recited the scripture once through, the host of perfected and great deities of the boundless and immeasurable ranks from the East arrived floating through the void. When recited twice, those from the South arrived floating through the void. When recited thrice, those from the West arrived floating through the void. When recited four times, those from the North arrived floating through the void. When recited five times, those from the Northeast arrived floating through the void. When recited six times, those from the Southeast arrived floating through the void. When recited seven times, those from the Southwest arrived floating through the void. When recited eight times, those from the Northwest arrived floating through the void. When recited nine times, those from the Upper Realm arrived floating through the void. When recited ten times, those from the Lower Realm arrived floating through the void. After ten recitations were complete, the boundless perfected and great deities of the ten directions arrived together in unison.

The Master says: At the inception of the Heavenly Lord’s reception of the Dharma, all the deities of the heavens descended, and this was used as the incantation for burning the true writ.

**Chapter Five: The Permeating Realm**

In a single land, men and women turned their hearts in reverence. Those who came were as fine rain or dense mist—an immeasurable host filling half the land, causing the earth to tilt and sink unevenly, beyond all restraint. Thereupon, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy suspended a precious pearl, as large as a grain of millet, in the void five *zhang* above the earth. The Primordial Heavenly Worthy ascended and led the perfected and great deities, the exalted sages, the perfected of wondrous conduct, and the boundless host of the ten directions’ perfected and great deities—all entered into the pearl. The heavenly beings looked up and saw only a surging stream entering the pearl’s mouth. Once within, none knew their whereabouts. The people of the land dispersed, the earth returned to levelness, and the uneven sinking ceased. Then, within the pearl, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy completed the recitation of the scripture in full. The host of perfected beings oversaw the deliverance and transmitted it to me. At that moment, joy and celebration were beyond words. When the Dharma rites were roughly concluded, the deities of the heavens returned to their stations, vanishing in an instant without a trace.

The Master says: When the Heavenly Worthy recited the scripture, such transformations occurred, and this was used as the incantation for Dharma masters—a technique of concealment, spirit-preservation, soul-binding, and spirit-subduing through millet grains.

Take one *sheng* of millet, select a day of Heavenly Virtue or Monthly Virtue, face north, form the left hand into the Master’s mudra with the *mao* trigram, and the right hand into the Dipper mudra. First, invoke the Six Masters and Perfected Masters, as well as the Perfected Lords of the Northern Dipper. Draw seven breaths of the Northern Dipper’s purple *qi* and recite the incantation:

*"I have heard that the Primordial Heavenly Worthy, in delivering boundless beings, completed the recitation of the scripture. The men and women of a land arrived, then vanished without a trace. Today, I consecrate this millet to conceal the body, preserve the spirit, bind the soul, and subdue the spirit. Let transformations be unfathomable, and deliverance boundless. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the Supreme Decree!"*

Next, blow the *qi* into the millet, place it in a clean container for offerings, and each day, visualize and swallow it.

**Method of Visualization**

Each morning, enter the oratory, swallow the pure and luminous precious talisman, then take one hundred and twenty grains of millet and sit in quietude within the chamber. Visualize within the *niwan* a green *qi*, within the heart a white *qi*, and within the navel a yellow *qi*. Let the three *qi* arise together, like clouds covering the body. They transform into a great fire burning the body, rendering it transparent inside and out. After a long while, cease. Then, with the millet, inhale the green *qi* through the nose, swallowing it one hundred and twenty times before stopping. Next, swallow the millet with water.

**Chapter Six: The Protective Body**

At that time, those who encountered the scripture and its Dharma universally attained deliverance, preserving their allotted years without harm. The people of the land turned in reverence, all cultivating virtuous minds. They did not kill, did not harm, did not envy, did not covet, did not lust, did not steal, did not greed, did not desire, did not hate, did not slander. Their words were free of embellishment, their speech free of malice. They were uniformly kind and loving, transforming strangers into kin. The land was at peace, the people prosperous, and all rejoiced in great harmony. When the scripture first spread its teachings in a land, those who had prior sincerity, reverence, and devotion all attained deliverance from the world.

The Master says: When the Primordial Heavenly Worthy expounded the scripture to the Heavenly Lord, the heavenly beings who encountered the Dharma all generated this aspiration. This serves as the Dharma master’s protective incantation.

Each time, on the day of one’s birth or conception, step the *gang* at *yin* seven times while reciting this incantation. Then, all ghosts, spirits, deceitful persons, and treacherous thieves who seek to harm will naturally disperse. The virtuous from the ten directions will all come to revere and honor. If one wishes to meet a noble person, step the *gang* the day before and then proceed. While stepping the *gang*, visualize oneself as the Heavenly Lord, holding the Heavenly Lord’s jade seal.

**Method for Determining the Conception Day**

For example, if born in the *jiazi* month, take *yimao* as the conception month, and *wuchen* as the birth day. *Wu* aligns with *gui*, and *chen* aligns with *you*. The conception day is *guiyou*, sought within the preceding *wuchen* day—if not before, then after. Each year on this day, perform the rites without restriction.

**Names of the Southern Dipper:**
*Chī, Wǎngliǎng, Wèi, Chī, Kuí*
**Five Phases:**
Water, Fire, Wood, Metal, Earth

Above, take three steps of the *ding gang*, entering from *Kuí* to *Piāo*.

Step with the right foot from Water to Metal in the Southern Dipper, from tail to head, entering the Dipper. With the left, lift the Northern Dipper’s cover, then reverse out of the Dipper. Step the *ding gang* again, entering the Northern Dipper, repeating seven times before stopping. Visualize transforming into seven bodies, the seven bodies as one.

chunks.original_text: 传受章第七 道言：元始天尊说经中所言，并是诸天上帝内名隐韵之音，亦是魔正内讳，百灵之隐名也，非世上之常辞。 上圣已成真人，通玄究微，能悉其章。 诵之十过，诸天遥唱，万帝设礼，河海静默，山岳藏云，日月停景，游玑不行，群魔束形，鬼精灭爽，回尸起死，白骨成人。 至学之士，诵之十过，则五帝侍卫，三界稽首。 魔精丧眼，鬼妖灭爽，济度垂死，绝而得生。 所以尔者，学士秽气未消，体未洞真。 召至十方威，未制天政，德可伏御地祇，束缚魔灵，但却死 而已，不能更生。
chunks.translated_text:
**Chapter Seven: Transmission of the Teachings**

The Dao speaks: What the Primordial Heavenly Worthy expounds in the sutras are the hidden, resonant sounds of the inner names of the myriad celestial emperors, the secret appellations within the struggle between demons and orthodoxy, the concealed names of the hundred spirits—these are no ordinary words of the mundane world. Only the perfected *zhenren* of the highest sageliness, who have penetrated the mysteries and plumbed the subtleties, can fully grasp their import.

When recited ten times, the heavens afar chant in response, the ten thousand emperors render homage, rivers and seas fall silent, mountains and peaks conceal their clouds, the sun and moon pause in their course, the turning jade mechanism halts, all demons bind their forms, ghostly essences vanish, the dead return to life, and white bones become human.

For the earnest scholar who recites them ten times, the Five Emperors stand guard, the Three Realms bow in reverence, demonic essences lose their sight, ghostly and spectral beings perish, and those on the brink of death are delivered, cut off from demise yet restored to life.

The reason for this is that the scholar’s defiled *qi* has not yet dissipated, and their body has not yet attained thorough realization. Though they may summon the might of the ten directions and have not yet mastered celestial governance, their virtue suffices to subdue and command earthly deities, to bind and restrain demonic spirits. Yet this only averts death—it does not restore life.

chunks.original_text: 轻诵此章，身则被殃，供养尊礼，门户兴隆，世世昌炽，与善因缘，万灾不干，神明护门。 斯经尊妙，独步玉京，度人无量，为万道之宗。 巍巍大范，德难可胜。 师曰：此是道君授经与灵宝 净明天尊之时，元始所说，尊妙如是，永为传度之先言。 右自道言元始天尊说经中所言，至德难可胜，续之曰：吾今得此秘法以度汝，汝宜克心勉励，慎守科戒。 说戒具科目章第八 道言凡诵是经十过，诸天齐到。 亿曾万祖幽魂苦爽，皆即受度，上升朱宫，格皆九年受化更生，得为贵人。 而好学至经，功满德就，皆得神仙，飞升金阙，游宴玉京也。 师曰：此是道君授经於灵宝 净明天尊之时，具说此经有荐拔祖考，超出幽夜之功用。 於说戒之后云：此乃为弟子烧草人券，追资亿劫种亲。 右自道言凡诵是经，至玉京也，续云：吾今授汝秘法，为汝奉依明科，荐拔先亡亿劫春属。 汝得法之后，切冀荣华，敷扬教风，上报道君之恩。 乃为弟子存念烧草人。 事见本章具载。 上学之士，修诵是经，皆即受度，飞升南宫。 世人受诵，则延寿长年，后皆得作尸解之道，魂神暂灭，不经地狱，即得返形，游行太空。 此经微妙，普度无穷。 一切天人，莫不受度。 无量之福，生死蒙惠。 师曰：此是道君传经与灵宝净明天尊之时，受记保举之词。 於拔度弟子先祖魂魄之后，再伸此言，加补弟子仙职，出给文牒。 右烧草人文券了，师就坐说上文。 自上学之士，至生死蒙惠，续云：吾今授汝秘法，说超汝玄祖。 今更依科，祈叩上圣高尊，保举汝姓名书注玄谱，遥补仙阶，汝慎无忽。 所有度补札牒文，付弟子，乃以下文勑励神将度印。 上天所宝，不传下士，至士资金宝，效心盟天而传。 轻泄漏慢，殃及九祖，长役鬼官。 侍经五帝，玉童玉女，各二十四人，营卫神文，保护受经者身。 师曰：此是道君授经之时，差玉童玉女护度弟子，因作是语，今为定格。 右补职弟子了，念上天所宝，至受经者身，续云：凡受仙官，必有将佐，汝宜修检。 次念勑励官将咒，勑曰：洞神有约，元帅帝君。 司恶司善，史史精勤。 玉童玉女，保卫侍经。 一切佐治，不得违盟。 右以左手掐中指玉皇文，一发而出面中山，取炁一口吹弟子。 次付法书剑印，付弟子毕，再念下文。 道言：正月长斋，诵咏是经，为上世亡魂，断地逮役，度上南宫。 七月长斋，诵咏是经，身得神仙，诸天书名，黄箓白简，削死上生。 十月长斋，诵咏是经，与国王帝主、君臣父子，安镇国祚，保天长存，世世不绝，常为人君，安镇其方，民称太平。 八节之日，诵咏是经，得为九宫真人。 本命之日，诵咏是经，魂神澄正，万炁长存，不经苦恼，身有光明，三界侍卫，五帝司迎，万神朝礼，名书上天，功满德就，飞升上清。 师曰：此是道君传度之后，重伸劝戒灵宝 净明天尊之词。 谢恩毕，以示叮咛委曲之意。 师曰：凡传度，随力建醮行科，三献宣词讫，就六位前，左设香案坐，法师存神戴远游冠，衣绛绫文袍，青巾单皂，赤舄，衣朱裳，手执玉珪、铜佩，如洞神下教仙卿。 先拜祖师众真毕，就傍立，为弟子说戒，弟子各长跪。 法师先祝香，皈依三宝，为君王师资祷福。 次自道言元始天尊说经中所言，至德难可胜，续云#2；

Should one recite this chapter lightly, misfortune shall befall the body. Yet with reverent offerings and solemn rites, one’s household shall flourish, prosperity span generations, and good karmic bonds be forged. Ten thousand calamities shall not intrude, and divine spirits shall guard the gate.

This scripture is most sacred and wondrous, unmatched in the Jade Capital. It delivers countless beings and stands as the root of all Dao. Its majestic model of virtue is beyond measure.

The Master said: This was the moment when the Dao Lord bestowed the scripture upon the Pure and Luminous Heavenly Worthy, as the Primordial Beginning spoke these words. So exalted and wondrous is it that it shall forever serve as the opening discourse for transmission.

From the Dao’s words—where the Primordial Heavenly Worthy expounded the scripture—through *"its virtue is beyond measure,"* it continues:

*"Now that I have granted you this secret method to deliver you, you must apply your heart with diligence and guard the precepts with care."*

**Section on Precepts and Ritual Procedures, Chapter Eight**

The Dao speaks: Should one recite this scripture ten times, all heavens shall arrive in unison. The suffering souls of countless generations of ancestors shall immediately receive deliverance, ascend to the Crimson Palace, and after nine years of transformation, be reborn as noble persons. Those who diligently study this scripture, fulfilling their merit and perfecting their virtue, shall all attain immortality, ascend to the Golden Towers, and wander the Jade Capital in joy.

The Master said: This was when the Dao Lord bestowed the scripture upon the Pure and Luminous Heavenly Worthy, fully expounding its power to redeem and uplift ancestral spirits, liberating them from the dark night.

After the precepts were spoken, it was said: This is for disciples to burn paper effigies and contracts, thereby aiding their kin from infinite kalpas past.

From the Dao’s words—*"Should one recite this scripture"*—through *"wander the Jade Capital,"* it continues:

*"Now I grant you this secret method, that you may follow the luminous precepts and redeem your ancestors from infinite kalpas past. After receiving this method, do not covet glory or splendor, but propagate the teachings and repay the grace of the Dao Lord."*

This is for disciples to visualize and burn paper effigies, as fully recorded in the original chapter.

Those of superior learning who cultivate and recite this scripture shall immediately receive deliverance and ascend to the Southern Palace. Those in the world who recite it shall extend their years and longevity, and later attain the Way of *shijie*, their souls temporarily extinguished yet spared the underworld. They shall swiftly regain form and roam the vast heavens. This scripture is subtle and wondrous, universally delivering boundless beings. All heavenly and mortal beings shall receive its grace. Infinite blessings shall bestow favor upon the living and the dead.

The Master said: This was when the Dao Lord transmitted the scripture to the Pure and Luminous Heavenly Worthy, uttering the words of confirmation and recommendation. After the deliverance of the disciple’s ancestral souls, these words were reiterated to elevate the disciple’s immortal rank and issue official documents.

After the burning of the paper effigy contract, the Master sat and spoke the above text.

From *"Those of superior learning"* through *"bestow favor upon the living and the dead,"* it continues:

*"Now I grant you this secret method to transcend your primordial ancestors. Further, in accordance with the precepts, entreat the exalted sages to inscribe your name in the Mystic Register, remotely elevating your immortal rank. Guard this well, and do not neglect it."*

All documents of elevation and appointment were conferred upon the disciple, followed by the below incantation to empower the divine generals and transmission seal.

What heaven treasures is not imparted to the unworthy. Only those who offer gold and treasures, pledging their hearts in oath to heaven, may receive it. Should one lightly disclose or slight it, misfortune shall extend to nine generations, and one shall be eternally bound to serve as a ghostly official.

The Five Emperors who attend the scripture, along with twenty-four Jade Lads and Jade Maidens, shall encircle and protect the sacred text, safeguarding the recipient’s body.

The Master said: This was when the Dao Lord bestowed the scripture, dispatching Jade Lads and Jade Maidens to protect and deliver the disciple, establishing this as the fixed protocol.

After the disciple’s rank was elevated, from *"What heaven treasures"* through *"safeguarding the recipient’s body,"* it continues:

*"Every immortal official must have attendants. You must cultivate discipline."*

Next, recite the incantation to empower the officials and generals:

*"By the pact of the Cavernous Spirit, the Marshal and Celestial Lord. They oversee evil and good, their scribes ever diligent. Jade Lads and Jade Maidens, guard and attend the scripture. All aides and administrators, do not violate the covenant."*

With the left hand, press the Jade Emperor’s seal upon the middle finger, projecting it into Mount Zhong of the face. Draw in *qi* and blow it upon the disciple. Then confer the talismanic script, sword, and seal, completing the transmission. Next, recite the following:

The Dao speaks: During the long fast of the first month, recite and chant this scripture to sever the earthly bonds of past generations’ souls, delivering them to the Southern Palace. During the long fast of the seventh month, recite and chant this scripture to attain immortality, with all heavens inscribing one’s name on the Yellow Register and White Tablet, erasing death and granting life. During the long fast of the tenth month, recite and chant this scripture to stabilize the nation’s destiny for kings, emperors, lords, ministers, fathers, and sons, ensuring eternal peace, unbroken lineage, and perpetual rule. On the eight seasonal festivals, recite and chant this scripture to become a True Person of the Nine Palaces. On one’s natal day, recite and chant this scripture to purify the soul, perpetuate the myriad *qi*, avoid suffering, and radiate light. The Three Realms shall attend, the Five Emperors shall receive, all spirits shall pay homage, one’s name shall be inscribed in heaven, and upon fulfilling merit and perfecting virtue, one shall ascend to the Upper Clarity.

The Master said: After the transmission, the Dao Lord reiterated these admonitions to the Pure and Luminous Heavenly Worthy, expressing gratitude and offering earnest reminders.

The Master said: For all transmissions, perform rites according to one’s capacity, completing the three offerings and reciting the proclamations. Before the six directions, set up an incense table to the left and sit. The Dharma Master, visualizing the spirit, wears the Far-Wandering Crown, a crimson silk robe with patterns, a blue headscarf, black trousers, red shoes, and a vermilion skirt. Holding a jade tablet and bronze pendants, they embody the celestial teachings of the Cavernous Spirit. First, bow to the ancestral masters and all perfected beings, then stand to the side and expound the precepts to the disciples, who kneel in reverence. The Dharma Master first consecrates the incense, takes refuge in the Three Treasures, and prays for blessings upon the sovereign and teachers. Then, from the Dao’s words—where the Primordial Heavenly Worthy expounded the scripture—through *"its virtue is beyond measure,"* it continues...

chunks.original_text: 吾今得此秘法，用以度汝等，汝等宜克心勉励，慎守戒科。 弟子法帅就坐，演说十戒。 一者，无忘八极。 忠者钦之极，孝都顺之极，康者清之极，馑者戒之极，宽者广之极，裕者乐之极，容者和之极，忍者智之极。 天以斗为极，地以岳为极。 天以有极，则能聚众炁。 地以有极，则能聚众形。 屋以有极，则能聚众木。 人之有八极，亦如是也，故能集善。 善立则道备，道备则所闻所见自然廓开，所应所修自然顺适。 此得灵宝 净明飞仙度人之基也。 二者，无忘鉴水。 镒者喻心，水者喻性。 心明则万法皆照，性 净则五浊不归。 道之在人圆通，非蒙蔽可了，非操动可达。 托镒水而悟心性，此得灵宝净明飞仙之体也。 三者，无忘日录。 日录者，所以修检善恶之处。 世患不能自知，患不能闻，不能听言，则无所益。 今以日录，录日所为，不可下笔处，皆己非也，改之为贵。 则日录者，不教之师也，不说之友也，不诏之君父，不约之法度，不可忘之。 此得灵宝 净明飞仙之相也。 四者，无忘追度安镇。 人之所亲，不过父母，所尊不过君王。 上知君王、父祖之德，而思必报者，追度安镇是也。 追者，谓诵经行符，上为父祖六亲之过去者，以资冥路。 度者，谓诵经行符，上为父祖六亲之存者，以资福算。 安镇者，谓诵经行符，上祝国王帝主圣寿，安镇四方。 召龙行雨，驱妖诚毒，保护民物，禳度星辰，皆其一也。 或在家行祖父之志，在官分君主之职，种种利益，有可报称，皆即为之。 凡木之叶落，尚自粪其本根，复命之义也。 人之报本，不可不勉。 此得灵宝 净明飞仙度人之宜也。 五者，无忘救治。 救治之卫，慈悯为先。 凡有病者，为其诵经行符，至诚禳却，如己父母。 男女凡有方便，种种惠泽，皆尽其心。 只如往官行法，务布阴功。 宽平设法，思久而有弊，三省而行。 智勇用兵，思进而有败，三省而动。 其或修治桥梁，当涂种植，有益於世者，皆力行之。 夫人之有慈念，如木之有本根。 人而不仁，不逮於禽兽。 故昔有猩猩活象，义鹘搏蛇。 救难除害，有如此者，可不思之。 此得灵宝 净明飞仙度人之由也。 六者，无忘服炼。 服炼之卫，参同天地，效法阴阳，念念正真，存存不缺，则自然超脱，变化无方。 今之虫豸，有能舍陆走而至飞翔，脱川游而遂奔逸。 在物既尔，人胡不然。 此得灵宝 净明飞仙度人之方也。 七者，无忘刚洁。 刚则有守，而不行非淫。 洁则戒污，而不慕非食。 不淫，则不损身之精神。 戒食，则不杀物之性命。 见人妻女，如己尊亲。 见物性命，如己所生。 自然精神全，而冤对少。 此得灵宝 净明飞仙度人之实也。 八者，无忘俭约。 凡所衣服食用，当知皆是元始祖炁化生。 灰水荡秽，不用修饰。 粟麦充饥，不用珍庖。 此得灵宝 净明飞仙度人之福也。 九者，无忘愿约。 愿者，从初入道时发心。 约者，自初入道后设誓。 天地神明司之，无辄中变。 洞神有科，不得不慎。 此得灵宝 净明飞仙度人之念也。 十者，无忘师友。 师者，所以教。 友者，所以劝。 教汝者似父，劝汝者似兄，孰谓父兄，而可不钦重，而委弃乎。 此得灵宝 净明飞仙度人之宗也。 次明经中大略，区贯七事：载于释例。

chunks.original_text: 一明元始祖炁从何而生，先化玉字，而后发生造化。 二明生育混沌，陶冶万物。 三明灵宝大法，自然生成图书，总括万象，为三才机纽，含融於黄素之书，要约於 净明三十五篇之奥，详悉於飞仙度人之宝法。 四明灵宝大法，为三洞之祖教，黄素则蓄其造化，净明则着其关键，飞仙度人宝法贯而详通，发指枢户者也。 五明人生体法，元始造立混沌圣胎法身。 六明元始祖炁无形之先。 作何比拟？ 降气成质，是生万宝，今世作何体状？ 探炼此炁，以为宝饵之登真。 七明得此法者，上则白日登升，次则长生度世，或得尸解之道。 务在观心无心，乃是真心，观形无形，乃是真形，心形都无，自入无形，则太定神光，湛然见玉清境，乃白日上升法也。 弟子再拜复跪，法师重伸戒言。 自道言凡诵是经十过，至玉京也。 吾既授法於汝，今再为汝等奉依明科，荐拔先亡，至上报大道之恩。 弟子再拜，起身序立。 法师依法宣读历关诸天、元始符命等文。 次存思，烧草人符券。 事见拔亡传度章。 烧讫。 次法师复位，弟子再拜谢跪。 法师重伸戒言。 自上学之士，至飞升上清。 见传度章。 次法师同弟子起谢醮会高真，依仪送神法事。 师曰：於此出科品二章，以明入道之仪。 职品章第九 师曰：凡受飞仙度人宝法者，风名玄谱，已注仙籍，依科补职，序其高下，随功计迁，以证将来入道之果。 故於此立职品。 师曰：凡授飞仙度人宝法，阴注阳报，入职有三等：一曰入天枢局。 一曰太玄都省局。 又有洞神堂。 今依三等，浑其高下，为弟子考课，随其庆源福基深浅叙次： 一初地学法，与入天枢职制。 一中地学法，与入太玄都省职制。 一上地学法，与洞神堂三景诸天职制。 以上三等，随受法深浅入局。 师曰：凡三等职制之外有阶。 阶者，由仙佐至真公之仙阶，凡八等。 功力显着者，入褒荣秘格，凡三等，四字以至二字。 师曰：职有文、武二等。 在天枢院，曰文武职。 在太玄，曰文林、武林。 在洞神，曰文郎、武郎。 凡有不识字，未通儒典，义意未知，唯慕道者，入武林。 师曰：天枢为常选，太玄为重选，洞神三景诸天为密选，凡以此分三等。 重选压常选，其预密而阶仙佐者，压重选、常选。 内洞神乃三洞之要地，一曰洞神，一曰洞玄，一曰洞真，皆有堂，而洞玄、洞真，自非位在天帝，无因入此堂也。 而洞神者，赤明开图之时，天仙之所贵，官卑而地要。 三景之职，而非洞神之职者，在洞神之下。 已上并出天枢、太玄二都录须知，及洞神都总职制律令。 存思章第十 道言：行道之日，皆当香汤沐浴，入净室，东向叩齿三十二通，上闻三十二天，心拜三十二过。 闭目静思，身坐青、黄、白三色云气之中，内外蓊冥，有青龙、白虎、朱雀、玄武、狮子、白鹤，罗列左右。 日月照明，洞映室内。 项生圆象，光映十方，如此分明。 咒睨曰：贪罗郁罗，符无苏陀，太冲太极，阴阳包和。 出有入无，入生出死，鬼神莫测，变化自然。 元始混气，玄中之玄，上干有终，下洞大渊。 诵之一徧，沈痾自痊。 炼魂浴魄，真阳自全。 斋戒礼诵，万过飞仙，无上秘咒，受命绵绵。 重宣心咒，贪罗洞明。 玉清上极，梵气氤氲。 分灵布气，降注付身，形神俱妙，与道合真。

First, it clarifies whence the primordial ancestral qi of the Yuan Shi originates—first transforming into the Jade Scriptures, then giving rise to all creation and transformation.

Second, it elucidates the nurturing of the primordial chaos and the refining of the myriad things.

Third, it expounds that the great Dharma of Lingbao naturally generates the sacred charts and books, which encompass all phenomena, serving as the pivotal mechanism of the Three Powers. These are contained within the Yellow Plain Scriptures, distilled into the thirty-five profound chapters of the *Pure Brightness*, and expounded in detail through the precious Dharma of *Flying Immortals Delivering Sentient Beings*.

Fourth, it reveals that the great Dharma of Lingbao is the ancestral teaching of the Three Caverns. The Yellow Plain Scriptures store its creative transformations, the *Pure Brightness* articulates its key principles, and the precious Dharma of *Flying Immortals Delivering Sentient Beings* thoroughly interconnects and elucidates them, unlocking the gateways of the cosmic pivot.

Fifth, it explains the corporeal Dharma of human existence, wherein the Yuan Shi establishes the sacred embryonic Dharma-body within the primordial chaos.

Sixth, it inquires: *Before the formless primordial ancestral qi took shape, to what could it be compared? Descending as qi to become substance, it generates the myriad treasures—what form does it assume in this world? Refining this qi serves as the elixir for ascending to immortality.*

Seventh, it states that those who attain this Dharma shall, at the highest level, ascend in broad daylight; at the next, achieve longevity and transcend the world; or attain the Way of liberation through the corpse. The essential practice lies in observing the mind until it becomes no-mind—this is the true mind; observing form until it becomes formless—this is the true form. When both mind and form dissolve, one naturally enters the formless, where the radiance of supreme samādhi shines forth, clearly revealing the Jade Clarity Realm—this is the method of ascending in broad daylight.

The disciples bowed again and knelt once more as the Dharma Master reiterated the preceptual admonitions:
*"Whoever recites this sutra ten times shall ascend to the Jade Capital."*
*"Having transmitted this Dharma to you, I shall now, in accordance with the luminous regulations, perform rites to deliver your departed ancestors and repay the great kindness of the Dao."*

The disciples bowed again, rose, and stood in order. The Dharma Master, following the ritual, recited the texts of the successive passes through the heavens, the Yuan Shi’s talismanic decrees, and other documents. Next, they visualized and burned the straw effigy and talismanic contract—a procedure detailed in the chapter on *Delivering the Departed*. After the burning was complete, the Dharma Master returned to his position, and the disciples bowed in gratitude and knelt once more. The Dharma Master again reiterated the precepts:
*"From the beginning student to those who ascend to the Upper Clarity, see the chapter on transmission and deliverance."*

Next, the Dharma Master and disciples together expressed gratitude to the exalted perfected ones of the jiao offering and performed the ritual to send forth the deities according to the prescribed rites.

The Master said: *"Herein are presented two sections of the ritual code to clarify the protocols for entering the Dao."*

**Section Nine: The Ranks and Offices**

The Master said: *"All who receive the precious Dharma of *Flying Immortals Delivering Sentient Beings* shall have their names inscribed in the Mysterious Register and recorded in the immortal ledgers. According to the regulations, they shall be appointed to offices, ranked by seniority, and promoted based on merit, thereby verifying their future attainment of the Dao’s fruition. Thus, the ranks and offices are established here."*

The Master said: *"Upon receiving the precious Dharma of *Flying Immortals Delivering Sentient Beings*, one’s name is secretly recorded and openly rewarded, entering an office in one of three grades: first, the Celestial Pivot Bureau; second, the Supreme Mystery Capital Bureau; and third, the Cavern Spirit Hall. Now, according to these three grades, the disciples’ merits shall be assessed, and their ranks determined by the depth of their karmic roots and the magnitude of their blessings:*
*1. Beginners in the Dao shall enter the Celestial Pivot Bureau’s official system.*
*2. Intermediate practitioners shall enter the Supreme Mystery Capital’s official system.*
*3. Advanced practitioners shall enter the Three Radiance and Cavern Spirit Halls’ celestial official system.*
*These three grades correspond to the depth of one’s Dharma reception."*

The Master said: *"Beyond these three grades of office, there are ranks. Ranks ascend from Immortal Aide to Perfected Duke, comprising eight levels. Those whose merits and powers are manifest may enter the Secret Register of Praise and Honor, which has three grades, from four characters to two."*

The Master said: *"Offices are divided into civil and martial branches. In the Celestial Pivot Bureau, they are called Civil and Martial Offices. In the Supreme Mystery Capital, they are called the Forest of Letters and the Forest of Arms. In the Cavern Spirit Hall, they are called Civil and Martial Gentlemen. Those who are illiterate, unversed in the Confucian classics, or unaware of their deeper meanings, yet aspire to the Dao, shall enter the Forest of Arms."*

The Master said: *"The Celestial Pivot serves as the regular selection, the Supreme Mystery Capital as the elite selection, and the Three Radiance Cavern Spirit Halls of the myriad heavens as the secret selection—these distinctions define the three grades. The elite selection supersedes the regular, and those who partake in the secret selection and attain the rank of Immortal Aide supersede both the elite and regular selections. The Cavern Spirit is the vital ground of the Three Caverns: one is the Cavern Spirit, one the Cavern Mystery, and one the Cavern Truth. Each has its hall, but the Cavern Mystery and Cavern Truth are inaccessible unless one holds a position among the Celestial Emperors. The Cavern Spirit, however, was honored at the time of the Crimson Clarity’s revelation of the cosmic chart—though its officials are of low rank, its terrain is strategically vital. The Three Radiance offices, though not part of the Cavern Spirit’s system, are subordinate to it. All the above is drawn from the *Essentials of the Celestial Pivot and Supreme Mystery Capital Records* and the *General Regulations and Ordinances of the Cavern Spirit Capital."*

**Section Ten: Visualization**

The Dao states: *"On the day of practicing the Dao, one must bathe with fragrant water, enter a purified chamber, face east, and knock the teeth thirty-two times to ascend to the thirty-two heavens. Bow thirty-two times with utmost sincerity. Close the eyes and meditate, visualizing oneself seated amidst clouds of blue, yellow, and white qi, both within and without shrouded in mist. A blue dragon, white tiger, vermilion bird, dark warrior, lion, and white crane array themselves to the left and right. The sun and moon illuminate the chamber with penetrating radiance. A circular halo emanates from the crown of the head, its light suffusing the ten directions—all must be vividly clear. Recite the incantation:*
*‘Tanluo Yuluo, Fuwu Sutuo, Taichong Taiji, yin and yang harmoniously enveloped. Emerging from existence, entering non-existence; entering life, emerging from death. Spirits and gods cannot fathom it; transformations arise naturally. The primordial qi of the Yuan Shi, the mystery within mystery, above it pierces the ultimate end, below it penetrates the great abyss.’*
*Reciting this once, chronic illnesses heal spontaneously. Refining the hun and bathing the po, the true yang is preserved whole. Through fasting, ritual, and recitation ten thousand times, one ascends as a flying immortal. This supreme secret incantation ensures an everlasting mandate.*
*Recite the heart incantation again:*
*‘Tanluo reveals the Cavern’s clarity. The Jade Clarity’s supreme extremity, the Brahma qi billows and swirls. Distributing the numinous and deploying the qi, they descend and infuse the body. Form and spirit both wondrous, one merges with the Dao in truth.’"*

chunks.original_text: 言其道经有常也，使后之达者，因经观释明例。 释例二卷，以象地，合三十二章，以成三十二天。 叙经四卷，以象四时。 开化章第一 元始洞玄，灵宝本章，上品妙首，十回度人。 百魔隐韵，离合自然，混沌赤文，无无上真。 元始祖炁，化生诸天，开明三景，是为天根，上无复祖，唯道为身。 仙师曰：此是元始说本章中篇，是祖炁之先，已有此炁，变结成文，遂有赤书及二篇灵书之符，净明宝图，为化生之根本。 今书元始灵书中篇，佩服行持，救人治病。 於未诵洞章存神以前，先默念上文毕，续云：某今日欣庆会入事，书此玉字，伏愿天恩开度。 心拜讫，存思如法。 法事具载本章。 化生章第二 五文开廓，普植神灵。 无文不光，无文不明，无文不立，无文不成，无文不度，无文不生。 是为大梵。 师曰：此是说经叙，迷中篇及二品灵书之炁，化为赤书，赤书之炁，化为文物。 今书五老赤书，五芽玉字。 凡书符，未召神存思之前，先念上文，续云：今日庆会入事，伏愿天恩开度。 建立章第三 天中之天，郁罗萧台，玉山上京，上极无上，大罗玉清，渺渺劫仞，若亡若存，三华离便，大有妙庭，金阙玉房，森罗净霐。 师曰：此是说，玉字之炁，化生诸天。 而玉清之境在中，为天中之天。 郁罗萧台者，玉清天宝，又重而灵宝、神宝，三丈人之炁，在空悬之中，不见可闻，若亡若存。 三华者，炁分为三。 金阙玉房，森罗净震，炁变而有形也。 今人分大梵祖炁，以有其身，当与天地合。 故上文为存思三炁之法。 师曰：行飞仙度人之道者，当以本命太岁，其夜亥时，漏水下七刻，入室朝真。 再拜静坐，存思己身丹田下有池，皆金玉砌岸，上有金阙玉房，楼台三层。 太上老君在下层，太上道君在中层，元始天尊在上层。 其台直向顶门，而三君所坐，正当丹田、绛官、泥九三处，有三色云炁毫光自泥丸出。 叩齿九通，咒曰：天中之天至森罗净霐止。 掐都监诀，书三华符各一道。 第一符 第二符
