The Dao and its scriptures follow eternal principles, enabling later adepts to observe and elucidate their patterns through explication. The *Explication of Patterns* in two scrolls corresponds to Earth, comprising thirty-two chapters to complete the thirty-two heavens. The *Preface to the Scripture* in four scrolls corresponds to the four seasons.

**Chapter One: The Chapter of Transformation and Generation**
The Primordial Beginning’s Cavernous Mystery, the fundamental chapter of the Numinous Treasure, the supreme and wondrous inception, delivers beings ten times over. Its hundred demonic hidden rhymes merge and part naturally; its chaotic crimson script embodies the Utmost True of Non-Being. The Primordial Ancestral Qi transforms and gives birth to the myriad heavens, unfolding the Three Luminaries—this is the root of Heaven. Above, there is no further origin; only the Dao constitutes its body.

The Immortal Master says: This is the middle section of the fundamental chapter spoken by the Primordial Beginning. Prior to the existence of the Ancestral Qi, this Qi already existed, congealing into script. Thus arose the Crimson Writ, the two sections of numinous talismans, and the *Precious Chart of Pure Clarity*, which form the root of transformation and generation. Now, inscribe the middle section of the Primordial Beginning’s Numinous Writ, wear it, and practice it to save others and cure illnesses. Before reciting the Cavernous Chapter and visualizing the deities, first silently recite the above passage in full, then continue: *"Today, I joyfully enter this assembly to inscribe these jade characters. Humbly, I pray for the Heavenly Grace to open the path of deliverance."* Bow in reverence, then visualize as prescribed. The ritual procedures are fully recorded in the fundamental chapter.

**Chapter Two: The Chapter of Transformative Generation**
The Five Scripts unfold and expand, universally planting the divine spirits. Without script, there is no radiance; without script, there is no illumination; without script, there is no establishment; without script, there is no completion; without script, there is no deliverance; without script, there is no generation. This is the Great Brahmā.

The Master says: This explains the scriptural preface, wherein the Qi of the middle section and the two sections of numinous talismans transform into the Crimson Writ, and the Qi of the Crimson Writ transforms into cultural artifacts. Now, inscribe the Five Elders’ Crimson Writ and the Five Sprouts’ Jade Characters. Before summoning the deities and visualizing, first recite the above passage, then continue: *"Today, I enter this joyous assembly. Humbly, I pray for the Heavenly Grace to open the path of deliverance."*

**Chapter Three: The Chapter of Establishment**
Within Heaven is Heaven: the Verdant Canopy and Jasper Terrace, the Jade Mountain’s Upper Capital, the utmost of the supreme, the Great Luo’s Jade Clarity. Vast and boundless through kalpas, it seems absent yet present. The Three Flowers part and depart; the wondrous court of the Great Existence, the golden towers and jade chambers, arrayed in pure clarity.

The Master says: This explains how the Qi of the Jade Characters generates the myriad heavens. The realm of Jade Clarity resides at the center, forming the Heaven within Heaven. The Verdant Canopy and Jasper Terrace are the Heavenly Treasures of Jade Clarity, further encompassing the Numinous Treasure and Divine Treasure, the Qi of the Three Venerable Ones, suspended in emptiness—unseen yet audible, seeming absent yet present. The Three Flowers are the Qi divided into three. The golden towers, jade chambers, and arrayed pure clarity are the transformations of Qi into form. Now, humans, having received the Great Brahmā’s Ancestral Qi, possess their bodies and should unite with Heaven and Earth. Thus, the above passage serves as the method for visualizing the Three Qi.

The Master says: Those who practice the Dao of Flying Immortality and Deliverance should, on the night of their life-destiny’s Greater Year-Star, at the seventh mark after the hour of *hai* when the water clock drips, enter the chamber to pay homage to the Perfected. Bow twice, sit in stillness, and visualize a pool below their cinnabar field, its shores inlaid with gold and jade, surmounted by golden towers and jade chambers in three tiers. The Most High Lord Lao resides on the lower tier, the Most High Dao Lord on the middle tier, and the Primordial Heavenly Worthy on the upper tier. The terrace aligns directly with the crown of the head, and the Three Lords’ seats correspond to the cinnabar field, Crimson Palace, and Mud Pill Palace, with three-colored clouds and Qi radiating from the Niwan Palace. Strike the teeth nine times and recite the incantation from *"Within Heaven is Heaven"* to *"arrayed in pure clarity."* Form the *Du Jian* mudra and inscribe one talisman each of the Three Flowers:

chunks.original_text: 第三符： 右吞一道符，存入丹田，有红气上透泥丸。 吞第二道符，存入丹田，有红气上透绛宫。 吞第三道符，存入丹田，有红气与前二气升降交合。 凡九次，成青、黄、白三气，冲顶门，作祥云，如车盖。 乃微祝曰：金房之内有三君，变化大梵生宝璘。 正气真精入玄玄，结成琼台体自然。 巍巍凌空高三层，流霞丹霄翼琼田。 上通棱层九重天，下有万丈幽谷泉。 合会洞门造灵根，三华宝耀生明鲜。 咒毕，咽气九口止。 度世章第四 大行梵炁，周回十方，中有度人不死之神，中有南极长生之君，中有度世司马大神，中有好生韩君丈人，中有南上司命司录、延寿益筹度厄尊神。 回骸起死，无量度人。 今日校录，诸天临轩。 师曰：此言元始化生之初，发挥大梵，弥罗十方，分炁流光，以有众圣，救度无量。 今为发符咒，凡救治申发章奏，追度安镇，悉道飞天神王随方而往。 凡用浄明，须存思呢内众真及六师临轩，方遣将念咒。 自大行梵炁，至诸天临轩。 咒时，面东，恰卯文，吸五方五色炁五口。 发挥时放诀，嘘炁一口，出五色。 东方无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人。 南方无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人。 西方无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人。 北方无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人。 东北方无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人。 东南方无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人。 西南方无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人。 西北方无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人。 上方无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人。 下方无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人。 十方至真飞天神王长生度世无量大神，并乘飞云丹舆绿辈，羽盖琼轮，骖驾朱凤，五色玄龙。 建九色之节，十绝灵旛。 前啸九凤齐唱，后吹八鸾同呜。 狮子、白鹤，啸歌邕邕，五老启途，群仙翼辕，亿乘万骑，浮空而来。 师曰：此言遣神王行事存思也。 初，天尊遣神王下度亿劫万品之时，其仪卫如此。 今法师治事，用关牒如常仪，分明书事，因随方所遣之。 如上方，则关告上天。 下方，则关告九地。 不历四方者用之。 凡所遣关引上，以朱书神王真篆於其差役处，以冷明法主印印之，仍书浄明怛他苏伽功曹符。 凡行用，亦须照此，作两行书之。 保生章第五 倾光回驾，监真度生。 诸天丞相、南昌上宫、韩司主录、监生大神，执箓把籍，齐到帝前。 随所应度，严校诸天。 师曰：此言灵宝大法天真大神圣众，会集於上帝之前，救度生死。 今裂以为求嗣续之法。 吞符 书日字时，口念郁仪，取太阳炁，从左目出。 书月字时，口念结璘，取太阴炁，从右目出。 二炁交合，如后法。 佩符 书明字。 左日七缚，右月七杀。 存日月红黄光，交合入符中。 取东方炁一口，西方炁二口发出，念咒掐诀。 如要男，以手自寅左转，至巳出。 要女，以手自申右转，至巳上出。 夫妇相望，夫面西，妇面东，以清水日吞一道，百日内有子。 吞符，烧入水中服之。 佩符，亦用前咒咒之。 书符，白素朱书，男左女右带之。 普告章第六 普告三界，无极神乡、泉曲之府、北都罗酆、三官九署、十二河源。 上解祖考，亿劫种亲。 疾除罪簿，落灭恶根。 不得拘留，逼合鬼群。 师曰：此言灵宝天尊道君说经，可以超度生死。 今为真文灵符，为弟子亿劫种亲超出幽户，作普告三界券。

**Chapter Four: The Scripture of Transcendence**
The great Brahmā qi pervades the ten directions, wherein dwell the divine beings who deliver the dead to immortality, the Southern Culmen Lord of Longevity, the Transcendence Marshal of the Celestial Bureau, the Life-Nurturing Elder Han, and the Southern Supreme Directors of Destiny and Records, the Longevity-Extending and Calamity-Averting Honored Spirits. They reverse decay and revive the dead, delivering boundless multitudes. Today, as the celestial registers are reviewed, the hosts of heaven descend in audience.

The Master says: This speaks of the primordial beginning when the Origin transformed and emanated the great Brahmā, suffusing the ten directions. The qi dispersed and light flowed forth, giving rise to the multitude of sages who save and deliver the limitless. Now, when issuing talismans and incantations for healing, memorials, deliverance, or pacification, the flying celestial divine kings are dispatched to the respective quarters.

When employing the Pure Clarity method, one must visualize the assembly of perfected beings within the Niwan Palace and the Six Masters in attendance before dispatching the generals and reciting the incantation. From *"The great Brahmā qi pervades"* to *"the hosts of heaven descend in audience,"* face east, form the *Mao* mudra, and draw in five breaths of the five directions’ five-colored qi. When releasing the incantation, release the mudra and exhale one breath of five-colored qi:

*Eastern Limitless Flying Celestial Divine King, Great Sage of Longevity, Deliverer of Boundless Multitudes.*
*Southern Limitless Flying Celestial Divine King, Great Sage of Longevity, Deliverer of Boundless Multitudes.*
*Western Limitless Flying Celestial Divine King, Great Sage of Longevity, Deliverer of Boundless Multitudes.*
*Northern Limitless Flying Celestial Divine King, Great Sage of Longevity, Deliverer of Boundless Multitudes.*
*Northeastern Limitless Flying Celestial Divine King, Great Sage of Longevity, Deliverer of Boundless Multitudes.*
*Southeastern Limitless Flying Celestial Divine King, Great Sage of Longevity, Deliverer of Boundless Multitudes.*
*Southwestern Limitless Flying Celestial Divine King, Great Sage of Longevity, Deliverer of Boundless Multitudes.*
*Northwestern Limitless Flying Celestial Divine King, Great Sage of Longevity, Deliverer of Boundless Multitudes.*
*Upper Limitless Flying Celestial Divine King, Great Sage of Longevity, Deliverer of Boundless Multitudes.*
*Lower Limitless Flying Celestial Divine King, Great Sage of Longevity, Deliverer of Boundless Multitudes.*
*The Ten Directions’ Perfected Flying Celestial Divine Kings, Great Spirits of Longevity and Transcendence, all ride upon flying clouds in cinnabar carriages with green canopies, jade wheels, and vermilion phoenixes in harness, five-colored dark dragons in equipoise. They bear nine-colored standards and ten sacred banners. Ahead, nine phoenixes cry in unison; behind, eight simurghs sing in harmony. Lions and white cranes chant in melodious chorus. The Five Elders lead the way, while hosts of immortals flank the procession—myriads of chariots and legions of cavalry descending through the void.*

The Master says: This describes the visualization of dispatching the divine kings to act. When the Heavenly Worthy first sent the divine kings to deliver the myriad beings across kalpas of eons, their retinue was thus arrayed. Now, when the Dharma Master performs rituals, the writs are prepared as usual, clearly stating the matter at hand, and dispatched to the respective direction. For the upper realm, the writ is addressed to the heavens; for the lower realm, to the nine earths. This method is used when the four directions are not traversed.

For all dispatches and summons, inscribe the divine kings’ true seal scripts in cinnabar at the designated post, affix the seal of the Pure Clarity Dharma Master, and write the *Dhatarasuka* functionary talisman of Pure Clarity. When employed, this is also written in two columns.

---

**Chapter Five: The Preservation of Life**
The light turns back, the chariot returns, as the perfected oversee deliverance and the nurturing of life. The Celestial Chancellors, the Southern Palace of Supreme Prosperity, the Han Director of Records, and the Life-Monitoring Great Spirits hold the registers and ledgers, all assembling before the Emperor. According to what is to be delivered, they strictly review the celestial records.

The Master says: This speaks of the great divine hosts of the Numinous Treasure Dharma assembling before the Celestial Emperor to deliver the living from death. Now, it is adapted as a method for seeking descendants.

**Swallowing the Talisman:**
When writing the character for "sun," recite *Yuyi* and draw the solar qi from the left eye. When writing the character for "moon," recite *Jielin* and draw the lunar qi from the right eye. The two qi merge as per the following method.

**Wearing the Talisman:**
Write the character for "brightness." On the left, bind the sun sevenfold; on the right, restrain the moon sevenfold. Visualize the red and yellow light of the sun and moon merging into the talisman. Draw one breath of eastern qi and two breaths of western qi, then exhale while reciting the incantation and forming the mudra. For a son, move the hand from the *yin* position leftward to the *si* position. For a daughter, move the hand from the *shen* position rightward to the *si* position. Husband and wife face each other—he to the west, she to the east—swallowing one talisman daily with pure water. Within a hundred days, a child will be conceived. For swallowing, burn the talisman and dissolve it in water to drink. For wearing, use the previous incantation to consecrate it. Write the talisman in cinnabar on white silk: the man wears it on the left, the woman on the right.

---

**Chapter Six: The Universal Proclamation**
A universal proclamation is issued to the Three Realms, the Limitless Divine Lands, the Yellow Springs’ Courts, the Northern Capital of Fengdu, the Three Officials and Nine Bureaus, and the Twelve River Sources. May the ancestors of kalpas past be delivered, and the karmic kin of eons be released. May their sin registers be swiftly expunged, their evil roots eradicated. Let them not be detained or coerced into ghostly throngs.

The Master says: This speaks of the Heavenly Worthy of Numinous Treasure and the Dao Lord expounding the scriptures to transcend life and death. Now, through the true writs and numinous talismans, the disciples’ karmic kin of eons past are delivered from the dark prisons, and a universal proclamation is issued to the Three Realms.

chunks.original_text: 普告三界符文 太岁年月　日下。 上清灵宝大法师者衔。 书时，用真文，并中中旨#1下节。 普告三界符 右用桐木板，长九寸，阔三寸二分，朱书黄地，贴简上，太玄都省印印之。 符命章第七 元始符命，时刻升迁。 北都寒池，部卫形魂。 制魔保举，度品南宫。 死魂受炼，仙化成人。 生身受度，劫劫长存。 随劫轮转，与天齐年。 永度三途，五苦八难。 超凌三界，逍遥上清。 师曰：此言灵宝天尊说经，此可以超生度死。 今为弟子无量亿劫种亲削灭恶籍，证入仙宗，作元始符命文。 元始符命真文 太岁年月　日　告下。 位职。 元始符命符 书符同真文，并掐中指中。 右用相木或桐木板，长九寸，阔三寸二分，朱书青纸。 符命真文，贴於简上。 符下用太玄都省印印之。 立券章第八 上清之天，天帝玉真无色之境梵行。 东方八天 太皇黄曾天帝郁监玉明。 太明玉完天帝须阿那田。 清明何童天帝元育齐京。 玄胎平育天帝刘度内鲜。 元明文举天帝丑法轮。 上明七曜摩夷天帝恬侩延。 虚无越衡天帝正定光。 太极蒙翳天帝曲育九昌。 南方八天 赤明和阳天帝理禁上真。 玄明恭华天帝空谣丑音。 耀明宗飘天帝重光明。 竺落皇笳天帝摩夷妙辩。 虚明堂曜天帝阿娄生。 观明端靖天帝郁密罗千。 玄明恭庆天帝龙罗菩提。 太焕极瑶天帝宛黎无延。 西方八天 元载孔升天帝开真定光。 太安皇崖天帝婆娄阿贪。 显定极风天帝招真童。 始皇孝芒天帝萨罗娄王。 太皇翁重浮容天帝闵巴狂。 无思江由天帝明梵光。 上揲阮乐天帝勃勃监。 无极昙誓天帝飘弩穹隆。 北方八天 皓庭霄度天帝慧觉昏。 渊通元洞天帝梵行观生。 太文翰宠妙成天帝那育丑瑛。 太素秀乐禁上天帝龙罗觉长。 太虚无上常容天帝总监鬼神。 太释玉隆腾胜天帝眇眇行元。 龙变梵度天帝运化玄玄。 太极平育贾奕天帝大择法门。 三十二天，三十二帝。 诸天隐讳，诸天隐名，天中空洞，自然灵章。 诸天隐韵，天中之音，天中之尊，天中之神，天中大魔，天中之灵，九和十合，变化上清。 无量之奥，深不可详，敷落神真，普度天人。 师曰：此是三十二天上帝魔王内讳，有能知其灵音者，魔王保举升仙。 故今为弟子自身，及先代亿劫种亲，给付升天券。 必自东方八天讫，默念至欣庆受度封券毕，再拜，以道君玉印印之。 制券章第九 凡补弟子，及为弟子追荐祖先，并给券文。 男为左券，女为右券，佩带。 以黄绢朱书之，各高九寸，长三尺二寸。 每月用两本，书升天符，合同於上。 男留左，女留右。 其一本烧，随家藏天枢门下照应，其一本与之佩带。 追度，则一本烧付亡人，一本送天枢为合契。 书券之法，於天门上坐，面对巽方，掐上清诀，存身为道君。 默祝事因毕，今魔王歌章，依式写中篇真文。 魔王歌章曰： 梵行冠太罗，淳风抗玄纪。 无形有常存，观世翻然理。 屡践不终劫，探幽度生死。 三乘通便路，清虚无尘滓。 长夜对一魂，地狱五苦解。 剑树不摇条，刀山不伤体。 门有浩劫翁，地无夭年子。 今日庆斯会，诸天并欢喜。 不胜情欣悦，高唱稽首礼。 念歌章毕，吸炁三十二口，存太黄皇曾天帝，自东北方揖四方天帝皆至，部领玉童玉女、直符吏众，手执丹笔，候看书券，同为保明弟子九祖六亲，拔出地户，以成大仙。
chunks.translated_text:
**Universal Proclamation Talisman for the Three Realms**
On the day of the year, month, and *taisi* cycle, issued by the Grand Master of the Highest Clarity and Numinous Treasure.

When inscribing, employ the true writs and the central decree of the middle section.

**Universal Proclamation Talisman for the Three Realms**
Inscribe on paulownia wood, nine *cun* in length and three *cun* two *fen* in width, with cinnabar on a yellow ground. Affix to the bamboo slip and seal with the Seal of the Great Mystery Capital Bureau.

---

**Chapter Seven: The Primordial Talisman Decree**
The Primordial Talisman Decree governs timely ascension.
The Northern Capital’s Frigid Pool guards the forms and souls.
It subdues demons, ensures protection, and elevates ranks to the Southern Palace.
Dead souls undergo refinement, transforming into immortals.
Living beings receive deliverance, enduring through kalpas.
Through cyclic revolutions, they share the heavens’ lifespan.
Forever delivered from the Three Ways, the Five Sufferings, and the Eight Difficulties,
they transcend the Three Realms, roaming freely in the Highest Clarity.

The Master says: This speaks of the Heavenly Worthy of Numinous Treasure expounding the scriptures to transcend life and death. Now, for the disciples’ karmic kin of limitless kalpas, their evil registers are expunged, and they attain entry into the immortal lineage, composing the Primordial Talisman Decree.

**Primordial Talisman Decree True Writ**
On the day of the year, month, and *taisi* cycle, proclaimed below.
[Rank and title.]

**Primordial Talisman Decree Talisman**
Inscribe as per the true writs, pressing the middle of the middle finger.

Use catalpa or paulownia wood, nine *cun* in length and three *cun* two *fen* in width, with cinnabar on blue paper. Affix the Primordial Talisman Decree true writ to the bamboo slip. Seal below with the Seal of the Great Mystery Capital Bureau.

---

**Chapter Eight: The Establishment of the Contract**
The Heaven of Highest Clarity, the Jade-True and Formless Realm of the Heavenly Thearch, the Brahma-conduct.

**The Eight Heavens of the East**
- Supreme August Yellow-Canopy Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Yu Jian, Jade Brightness.
- Supreme Brightness Jade-Perfection Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Xu A Na Tian.
- Clarity-Brightness He-Tong Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Yuan Yu Qi Jing.
- Mysterious Womb Level-Nurturing Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Liu Du Nei Xian.
- Primordial Brightness Literary Elevation Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Chou Fa Lun.
- Supreme Brightness Seven Luminaries Ma-Yi Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Tian Kuai Yan.
- Void Transcending Balance Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Zheng Ding Guang.
- Supreme Ultimate Veiled Radiance Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Qu Yu Jiu Chang.

**The Eight Heavens of the South**
- Crimson Brightness Harmonious Yang Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Li Jin Shang Zhen.
- Mysterious Brightness Reverent Splendor Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Kong Yao Chou Yin.
- Radiant Brightness Ancestral Whirl Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Chong Guang Ming.
- Bamboo-Falling August Reed Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Mo Yi Miao Bian.
- Void Brightness Hall-Luminance Heaven: Heavenly Thearch A Lou Lou Sheng.
- Contemplative Brightness Upright Tranquility Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Yu Mi Luo Qian.
- Mysterious Brightness Reverent Celebration Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Long Luo Pu Ti.
- Supreme Radiance Ultimate Jade Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Wan Li Wu Yan.

**The Eight Heavens of the West**
- Primordial Capacity Cavernous Ascent Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Kai Zhen Ding Guang.
- Supreme Peace August Cliff Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Po Lou A Tan.
- Manifest Stability Ultimate Wind Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Zhao Zhen Tong.
- Primordial August Filial Vigor Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Sa Luo Lou Wang.
- Supreme August Venerable Floating Countenance Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Min Ba Kuang.
- No-Thought River Origin Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Ming Fan Guang.
- Supreme Scrutiny Joyous Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Bo Bo Jian.
- Limitless Cloud-Vow Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Piao Nu Qiong Long.

**The Eight Heavens of the North**
- Luminous Courtyard Rosy Dawn Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Hui Jue Hun.
- Abyssal Penetration Primordial Cavern Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Fan Xing Guan Sheng.
- Supreme Literary Elegance Wondrous Completion Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Na Yu Chou Ying.
- Supreme Simplicity Splendid Joy Prohibition Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Long Luo Jue Chang.
- Supreme Void Utmost Constant Countenance Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Zong Jian Gui Shen.
- Supreme Release Jade Exaltation Soaring Victory Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Miao Miao Xing Yuan.
- Dragon Transformation Brahma-Penetration Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Yun Hua Xuan Xuan.
- Supreme Ultimate Level-Nurturing Jia-Yi Heaven: Heavenly Thearch Da Ze Fa Men.

The Thirty-Two Heavens, the Thirty-Two Thearchs.
The hidden taboos of the heavens, the hidden names of the heavens,
the empty caverns within the heavens, the spontaneous numinous chapters.
The hidden rhymes of the heavens, the sounds within the heavens,
the revered within the heavens, the spirits within the heavens,
the great demons within the heavens, the numina within the heavens,
the Nine Harmonies and Ten Unions, transforming into the Highest Clarity.
The boundless mysteries, too profound to detail,
they unfold and descend as divine perfected beings, universally delivering heavenly and mortal beings.

The Master says: These are the inner taboos of the Heavenly Thearchs and Demon Kings of the Thirty-Two Heavens. Those who know their numinous sounds are protected and elevated to immortality by the Demon Kings. Thus, now for the disciples themselves and their karmic kin of kalpas past, the contract for ascension to heaven is bestowed. Begin by silently reciting from the Eight Heavens of the East to the end, then bow twice and seal with the Jade Seal of the Dao Lord.

---

**Chapter Nine: The Contract System**
For all newly initiated disciples and those performing ancestral deliverance, contracts are issued.
For men, the left contract; for women, the right contract, to be worn.
Inscribe with cinnabar on yellow silk, each nine *cun* in height and three *chi* two *cun* in length.
Each month, prepare two copies, inscribing the Ascension to Heaven Talisman and uniting them above.
Men keep the left; women keep the right.
Burn one copy, storing it beneath the Celestial Pivot Gate for correspondence, while the other is worn.
For deliverance, burn one copy for the deceased and send the other to the Celestial Pivot as a matching contract.

The method for inscribing the contract: sit at the Heavenly Gate, facing the *xun* direction, form the Highest Clarity mudra, and visualize oneself as the Dao Lord. Silently invoke the circumstances, then inscribe the central true writ according to the Demon Kings’ hymn.

**Hymn of the Demon Kings:**
Brahma-conduct crowns the Supreme Net,
pure winds uphold the mysterious record.
Formless yet eternally abiding,
contemplating the world’s reversed principles.
Treading often without kalpic end,
exploring the obscure to deliver life and death.
The Three Vehicles open the convenient path,
clarity and void without dust or dregs.
Facing the lone soul through the long night,
the Five Sufferings of hell are dissolved.
Sword trees cease their swaying branches,
blade mountains no longer harm the body.
The gate holds the Elder of Vast Kalpas,
the earth lacks children of premature death.
Today we celebrate this assembly,
all heavens rejoice together.
Overwhelmed with joyful emotion,
we raise our voices in reverent homage.

Upon reciting the hymn, inhale *qi* thirty-two times, visualize the Supreme August Yellow-Canopy Heavenly Thearch, and bow to the Heavenly Thearchs of the four directions from the northeast. They arrive with their retinues of jade lads and maidens, direct talisman officials, and attendants holding cinnabar brushes, awaiting the contract’s inscription. Together, they guarantee the deliverance of the disciple’s nine generations of ancestors and six relations, extracting them from the earthly prisons to achieve great immortality.

chunks.original_text: 玃无自育，九日导乾。 坤母东覆，形摄上玄。 陀罗育邈，眇炁合云。 飞天大丑，总监上天。 沙陀劫量，龙汉瑛鲜。 碧落浮黎，空歌保珍。 恶奕无品，洞妙自真。 元梵恢漠，幽寂度人。 计一十六句，该六十四字。 右给付弟子某甲收执。 佩带以后，五苦咸解，三途并原，长灭恶根，南宫上生，劫劫受度，与天齐年。 急急如律令。 太岁某年某月某日某朔，告下 具职： 度师九州都仙太史高明大使至道玄应 神功妙济真君。 监度师三天扶教辅元大、法天师正一冲 玄神化显佑真君。 籍师玄都御史真君。 经师至孝恭顺仙王。 祖师太阴元君孝道仙王灵宝浄明黄素天尊。 祖师太阳上帝孝教道明王灵宝摩明天尊。 太皇黄曾天尊。 历关章第十 历关诸天，请灭某人三恶，斩绝地根，飞度五户，名列太玄。 魔王监举，无拘天门。 东斗主算，西斗记名，北斗落死，南斗上生一中斗大魁，总监众灵。 青帝护魂，白帝侍魄，赤帝养炁，黑帝通血，黄帝中主，万神无越。 青天魔王，巴元丑伯。 赤天魔王，负天担石。 白天魔王，反山六目。 黑天魔王，监丑朗馥。 黄天魔王，横天檐力。 五帝大魔，万神之宗。 飞行鼓从，总领鬼兵，麾幢鼓节，游观太空。 自号赫奕，诸天齐功，上天度人，严摄北邓。 神公受命，普扫不祥，八威吐毒，猛马四张，天丁前驱，大帅仗旛，掷火万里，流铃八冲，敢有干试，拒遏上真，金钹前戮，巨天后刑，屠割鬼爽，风火无停，千千截首，万万剪形，魔无干犯，鬼无妖精，三官北酆，明检鬼营，不得容隐，金马驿呈。 师曰：此元始天尊所说之经，一能为延年益算，一能为去病除祸，一能超度先祖。 凡为弟子行事，皆书其文，历关诸天。 凡行关告，若为弟子延年益算，自历关诸天，至总监众灵，再自神公受命，至金马驿传。 若为弟子除病去祸，自历关诸夫，至无拘天门，再自青帝护魂，至万神无越，又自神公受命，至金马驿呈。 若为弟子追度先祖，自历关诸天，至无拘天门，再自青天魔王，至金马驿呈。 书关毕，用泰玄都省印印之。 如延年治病，非章醮不可轻用。 历关诸天真文 关式

chunks.original_text: 赤帝符 南向叩齿三通，思赤气从口入，注心中，生三重丹华宝光，彻映胸前，书符置前。 咒日： 丹华流映，宝芝生光，神精彻幽，散灵八方，直符摄炁，啸命朱童，三精敷焕，注我绛宫，赤神安镇，五香溢充。 洞映形外，表里发光，身生水火，独步飞行。 毕，引炁三咽止。 一服一佩。 若置杖，则一纳其中。 黄帝符 向王叩齿十二通，思黄气从口入，注脾中，生十二重黄华宝光，洞映一身，书符置前。 咒曰： 总元高灵，回神四乡，黄上散华，五帝交芳，流精散漫，十二重光，混合我形，万神相迎，安脾养炁，中房保龄，度脱亿劫，永镇无穷。 毕，引炁十二口止。 一服一佩。 若置杖，则一纳其中。 白帝符 向西叩齿七通，思白气从口入，注肺中，生七重素华宝光，彻映丹田，书符置前。 咒日： 金灵七炁，素华流芬，金精童子，首建元巾，带符摄炁，万神会门。 宝光奕奕，照我命根。 安镇脾华，万劫长存。 毕，引黑七炁止。 服一佩一，若置杖，则一纳其中。 黑帝符 向北叩齿五通，思黑熙从口入，注肾中，生五重玄华宝光符置前，咒曰： 北上太玄，五黑徘徊，宝华五重，流光焕辉，灵景郁秀，洞映太微，仰注我身，肾府鲜开，安镇灵宅，万神总归，身生羽服，举形自飞。 毕，引黑七炁止。 服一佩一，若置杖，则一纳其中。 置神策杖法 取向阳之竹，长七尺七寸，有七节者，作神策杖，使上下通直，甘竹为佳。 书黑帝符，安下第二节中。 次白帝符，安第三节中。 次黄帝符，安第四节中。 次赤帝符，安第五节中。 次青帝符，安第六节中。 空上一节通天，下一节立地。 蜡封上节，节中实以元始之章即灵书中篇也。 又封下节，节中实以五帝之章即五老赤书也。 皆黄素绛文。 作室，长短大小足容杖。 外息坐起，当以自随行住。 可脱衣盖竹，隐以出入。 或不以随身，当别安洁处，无失之也。 受持既久，以杖指天，天神设礼； 指地，地只侍迎； 指束北方，万鬼束形。 凡乘杖行住，及欲施为，当叩齿三十六通，思五帝直符吏各一身随方色衣服，有五色之光，流映杖上。 五帝，玉女各一人，共卫杖左右。 微咒日： 太阳之山，始元上精，开天张地，甘竹通灵，直符守吏，部卫神兵，五色流焕，朱火金铃，辅翼上真，出幽入明。 召天天恭！ 摄地地迎，指鬼鬼灭，妖魔束形。 灵符神杖，威利百方，与我俱成，与我俱生，万劫之后，以代我形，置我五解，神升上清。 承符告命，靡不敢听。 急急如律令。 毕，引五方炁二十五口，咽止。 右本命、八节日，当烧香，左右朝拜。 行此九年，精谨无失，神真形见于杖，则载人空行。 若欲尸解，以杖代形，倏忽之间，已成真矣。 太上灵宝浄明飞仙度人经法卷二竟 #1中中旨：疑当作『掐中指』。 太上为宝净明飞仙度人经法卷三 高明大使神功妙济真君许旌阳释

Resplendent radiance shines forth,
Illumining the root of my destiny.
Securely settle the splenic splendor,
Abide through ten thousand kalpas."*

Conclude by drawing in black qi seven times. Ingest one and wear one. If placing it within a staff, insert one therein.

**Talisman of the Black Emperor:**
Face north, knock the teeth five times, and visualize black qi entering through the mouth, infusing the kidneys, where it generates fivefold layers of mysterious radiance. Place the talisman before you and recite the incantation:
*"Supreme Mystery of the northern heights,
Fivefold blackness lingers in circuit.
Precious blossoms in five layers,
Flowing light blazes in splendor.
Numinous brilliance flourishes in lushness,
Suffusing the Great Subtlety.
Gazing upward, it infuses my form,
The kidney palace unfolds in freshness.
Securely settle the numinous abode,
Myriad spirits all return.
Body born of feathered raiment,
Form ascends in spontaneous flight."*

Conclude by drawing in black qi seven times. Ingest one and wear one. If placing it within a staff, insert one therein.

**Method for Preparing the Divine Strategy Staff:**
Select a sun-facing bamboo, seven feet and seven inches in length, with seven nodes, to fashion the divine strategy staff. Ensure it is straight from top to bottom; sweet bamboo is best. Inscribe the Black Emperor’s talisman and place it within the second node from the bottom. Next, inscribe the White Emperor’s talisman and place it within the third node. Then, inscribe the Yellow Emperor’s talisman and place it within the fourth node. Next, inscribe the Vermilion Emperor’s talisman and place it within the fifth node. Finally, inscribe the Azure Emperor’s talisman and place it within the sixth node. The topmost node reaches heaven, and the bottommost node stands upon the earth. Seal the upper node with wax, filling it with the *Chapter of the Primordial Beginning*—the middle section of the *Numinous Writ*. Seal the lower node with wax, filling it with the *Chapter of the Five Emperors*—the *Red Writ of the Five Elders*, all inscribed in yellow silk with vermilion script.

Construct a case, its length and size sufficient to contain the staff. When at rest or in motion, keep it with you. You may remove your outer robe to cover the bamboo, concealing it when entering or exiting. If not carried on your person, store it in a clean place, ensuring it is never lost.

With prolonged practice, point the staff toward heaven, and heavenly spirits will offer obeisance; point it toward the earth, and earthly deities will attend in welcome; point it toward the northeast, and myriad ghosts will submit in reverence. Whenever holding the staff to walk or stand, or when intending to act, knock the teeth thirty-six times and visualize the five emperors’ true talisman officials, each clad in the color of their direction, their five-colored radiance flowing and illuminating the staff. The Five Emperors and Jade Maidens, one each, will together guard the staff on either side. Recite the incantation softly:
*"Mountain of the Great Yang,
Primordial essence of the supreme origin,
Opening heaven and unfurling earth,
Sweet bamboo channels the numinous.
True talisman officials and guardian soldiers,
Five colors flow in splendor,
Crimson fire and golden bells,
Assisting the perfected ascendant,
Emerging from darkness into light.
Summon heaven, and heaven obeys!
Command earth, and earth welcomes!
Point at ghosts, and ghosts perish!
Demons and malevolent spirits submit in reverence.
Numinous talisman and divine staff,
Potent and efficacious in all directions,
Attain completion with me,
Attain birth with me.
After ten thousand kalpas,
Replace my form,
Place me in the Five Liberations,
Spirit ascends to the Upper Clarity.
By the talisman’s decree,
None dare disobey.
Swiftly, swiftly, as in the statutes and ordinances!"*

Conclude by drawing in the qi of the five directions and swallowing twenty-five times.

On one’s natal day and the eight solar terms, burn incense and bow in reverence to the left and right. Practicing this for nine years with utmost diligence and without lapse, the divine perfected will manifest their form upon the staff, enabling one to ride it through the void. If desiring *shijie* (liberation through apparent death), the staff may substitute for one’s form, and in an instant, one will attain perfection.

chunks.original_text: 运化章第－ 普告无穷，万神咸听。 三界五帝，列言上清。 师曰：此元始说经之次，度弟子至历关诸天。 其普告无穷，万神咸听，三界五帝，列言上清。 今为行遣咒，凡有行遣事毕，法师微咒曰：普告无穷，至列言上清。 存天地四方鬼神，听命奉行之。 隐化章第二 元洞玉历，龙汉延康。 眇眇亿劫，混沌之中。 上无复色，下无复渊。 风泽洞虚，金刚乘天。 天上天下，无幽无冥。 无形无影。 无极无穷。 淇津大梵，辽廓无光。 师曰：此是天尊说元洞玉历之始，天地未立，祖炁未分，混沌之中，本无幽冥，无影．穷极，唯大梵之炁，辽廓眇眇，未有昭示，无光。 至龙汉元年，方始出书。 今本天尊之言，以为隐身咒。 凡隐化之道，摄有形以归无形，合有数以入於无数，无始而反终，还淳而复朴，灭念超寂，故天神人鬼，莫能见其微也。 其法，存五脏之炁，随罡步而生，随罡步而灭。 念元洞玉历，至辽廓无光。 存身归大梵之炁，炁如云烟覆身，身与炁合，自然隐也。 但君子之固穷自若，小人得知轻命，以为变怪。 今略具而不传，慎之也。 罡图 灵图章第三
chunks.translated_text:
**Chapter on Circulation and Transformation – First**
*"Universally proclaimed without end, let all spirits hearken.*
*The Three Realms and Five Emperors, arrayed in words of the Upper Clarity."*

The Master said: This was the moment when the Primordial Beginning expounded the scripture, guiding disciples through the passes of all heavens. *"Universally proclaimed without end, let all spirits hearken; the Three Realms and Five Emperors, arrayed in words of the Upper Clarity."* Now, as an incantation for dispatching, whenever matters of dispatch are concluded, the Dharma Master shall softly intone: *"Universally proclaimed without end... arrayed in words of the Upper Clarity."* Envision the spirits of heaven and earth and the four directions, heeding the command and executing it.

**Chapter on Concealed Transformation – Second**
*"Primal Cavern Jade Chronicle, Dragon Han’s Eternal Prosperity.*
*Vast and boundless kalpas, within the chaos of primordial undifferentiation.*
*Above, no further colors; below, no further abyss.*
*Wind and marsh pervade the void; Vajra rides the heavens.*
*Between heaven above and heaven below, no darkness, no obscurity.*
*No form, no shadow.*
*No limit, no end.*
*Vast and boundless Great Brahma, expansive and lightless."*

The Master said: This is the beginning of the Heavenly Worthy’s exposition of the *Primal Cavern Jade Chronicle*—before heaven and earth were established, before the ancestral *qi* was divided, within the chaos of primordial undifferentiation. There was no obscurity, no shadow, no end, only the *qi* of Great Brahma, vast and boundless, yet without illumination or light. Only in the first year of the Dragon Han did the scriptures first emerge. Now, these words of the Heavenly Worthy serve as the incantation for concealment. The Dao of concealed transformation gathers form into formlessness, unites enumeration into the unenumerable, returns from no beginning to no end, and restores simplicity to return to primordial purity. Extinguishing thoughts to transcend stillness, thus gods, humans, and ghosts cannot perceive its subtlety.

The method: Envision the *qi* of the five viscera, arising with the steps of the *Big Dipper* and dissolving with its steps. Recite *"Primal Cavern Jade Chronicle... expansive and lightless."* Envision the body merging with the *qi* of Great Brahma, the *qi* like cloud and mist enveloping the body. Body and *qi* unite, and one naturally conceals oneself. Yet the noble man remains steadfast in adversity, while the petty man, upon learning this, treats life lightly and indulges in strange transformations. Now, this is briefly outlined but not fully transmitted—exercise caution.

**Diagram of the Big Dipper**
**Chapter on the Numinous Diagram – Third**

chunks.original_text: 赤明开图，运度自然，元始安镇，敷落五篇，赤书玉字，八威龙文，保制劫运，使天长存。 梵炁弥罗，万梵开张。 师曰：此是元始天尊叔祖炁化生．玉字，出书度人之次。 谨按恭华天梵形落空四字，出於玉京山，主天元开运变化之灵。 以此砍之，则灵书中篇在开图之初，谓之中者，黑之和融而成书。 一生二，二生三，则灵书上下二品，因之以生。 贯三为一，则黄素八十一字次之。 灵书二篇应於阴，阴中有阳，日官孝道明王主之。 八十一字应於阳，阳中有阴，月宫孝道仙王主之。 阴阳之后五行生，五行生而分五位，於是有赤书五老之文。 五行分矣，上下显之，故有三皇内文。 内文之合，而为三华，分而有九章，生神之经是也，於是则大有金书。 昔元明文举天答落大梵四字，书三便之门，开大有之关，通龙汉之真是也。 九章具，而三才之理分，则三而成质有，二而成地，三而成人，其理着矣。 故日：三华离便，大有妙庭。 此又见其文之所以济生死，保劫运者。 如是度人之经，大体本赤书中篇，即以一而生五，生成之终始，原其相参以为用，则不可为易通也。 求其文，元始中篇着於末者，取生物首下之义，故赤书先之。 今随经意，明以为法。 赤文章第四 师日：按赤书玉诀，真文呢说古文，后来学者难施用。 故高上注笔，以解曲滞玉诀真要，开演古文，微解玄妙，诸天所传，披诵玉音，十方遥唱，上天设礼，神魔降伏。 而今后世书道法，以旧文通之，多有谬异。 世俗尚同，溺於先见，故文字以先得者为贵。 世俗文以常有者为贱，而偶得者为宝。 世俗复以难得者为奇，而易得者为庸谬。 所以世师有得妙者，多不以及人。 而盲师错说，各立方论，遂误后人。 今审谛，先以仙房参同，务为简要，直指宗说无疑，乃笔尔。 束方玉篆 一百二十字，正文在后。 译文
chunks.translated_text:
The *Red Clarity Unfolds the Diagram*, its movements and measures naturally ordained. The Primordial Beginning securely establishes, unfolding the five scriptures—crimson writings on jade, eight mighty dragon scripts—preserving and regulating the kalpas, ensuring heaven’s eternal endurance. The *qi* of Brahma pervades the cosmos, myriad Brahma realms unfurl.

The Master says: This is the *qi*-transformed manifestation of the Primordial Heavenly Worthy, the Venerable Ancestor, the jade characters emerging to deliver humanity in sequence. Reverently examining the *Gonghua Tianfan*’s four celestial characters descending into the void, they issue from Jade Capital Mountain, governing the numinous transformations of heaven’s primordial unfolding.

Thus, within the *Numinous Writ*, the central chapter arises at the diagram’s inception. "Central" denotes the harmonious fusion of black and red to form the script. From one arises two, from two arises three, whence the upper and lower ranks of the *Numinous Writ* are generated. Uniting the three as one, the *Yellow Plain*’s eighty-one characters follow in sequence.

The two chapters of the *Numinous Writ* correspond to *yin*, wherein *yang* resides, governed by the Solar Palace’s Filial Dao Bright King. The eighty-one characters correspond to *yang*, wherein *yin* resides, governed by the Lunar Palace’s Filial Dao Immortal King. After *yin* and *yang*, the five phases arise; the five phases generate and divide into five positions, giving rise to the writings of the *Five Elders of the Crimson Script*. The five phases having divided, they manifest above and below, hence the *Inner Writings of the Three Sovereigns*. The convergence of the inner writings forms the *Three Florets*, which divide into the *Nine Chapters*—the *Scripture of Spirit Generation*—whereupon the *Golden Writ* emerges in full.

Of old, the *Yuanming* script raised the four characters of *Great Brahma Descending into the Void*, inscribing the *Three Conveniences Gate*, unlocking the *Great Possession*’s barrier, and revealing the true origin of *Dragon Han*. The *Nine Chapters* complete, the principles of the *Three Powers* divide: one forms heaven, two forms earth, three forms humanity—this principle is thus made manifest. Hence it is said: "The *Three Florets* depart from the *Conveniences*, the *Great Possession*’s wondrous court." This further reveals how its writings deliver from life and death, preserving the kalpas.

Such is the *Scripture of Delivering Humanity*: its essence derives from the central chapter of the *Crimson Script*, taking one to generate five, the beginning and end of generation and completion. Tracing their mutual interpenetration for application, it cannot be easily comprehended. Seeking its text, the Primordial Beginning’s central chapter appears at the end, adopting the principle of "the head of living things descending," hence the *Crimson Script* precedes it. Now, following the scripture’s intent, it is elucidated as method.

**Chapter on the Crimson Script – Fourth**

The Master says: According to the *Crimson Script Jade Formula*, the true writ’s ancient characters are abstruse, rendering later scholars unable to apply them. Thus, the Most High annotated and penned explanations to resolve the *Jade Formula*’s recondite essentials, expounding the ancient script’s subtle mysteries—transmitted by the myriad heavens, recited in jade tones, chanted afar by the ten directions. Above, heaven establishes rites; gods and demons submit. Yet in later ages, scriptural methods, though transmitted through old texts, often diverge into error.

The worldly cling to uniformity, drowning in preconceptions, prizing whatever they first obtain. Common texts are deemed base, while rare finds are treasured. The worldly further deem the hard-won extraordinary and the easily obtained vulgar and false. Thus, masters who attain the wondrous often withhold it from others. Blind masters misinterpret, each erecting their own doctrines, thereby misleading posterity.

Now, carefully examining and verifying, first aligning with the immortal chambers’ concordances, striving for simplicity and essentials, directly pointing to the宗说 without doubt—thus it is penned.

chunks.original_text: 东方九炁，始皇青天，碧霞郁垒，中有老人，总校图箓，摄炁举仙。 岁星辅肝，角亢镇真，氏房心尾，四景回旋，箕主七辰，正斗明输，承炁捕非，扫除灾群。 东山神咒，摄召九天，赤书符命，制会酆山，束魔送鬼，所诛无镯，悉诣木宫，敢有稽延。 下制东河，淇海水神，大劫洪灾，蛟龙负身，水府开道，通径百千。 上帝赤文，风火无间。 南方玉篆 凡一百五十二字，正文列在后。 译文 南方丹天，赤书玉堂，中有大神，号曰赤皇，上炎流烟，三炁勃光，神仙受命，应运太阳。 荧辅心，井鬼守房，柳星张翼，统御四乡，翰总七宿、回转天常，召运促会，正道驿行。 赤文命灵，北摄酆山。 束送魔宗，斩灭邪根，符教所讨，明列罪原。 南山神咒，威伏八方，群妖灭爽，万试摧亡。 南河水帝，太伯龙王，神咒流行，普扫不祥，洪水非灾，正蛟召龙，开除水径，千道万通。 敢有干试，摄送火宫。 赤书所告，莫有不从。

chunks.original_text: 西方素天，白帝七门，金灵皓映，太华流氛，白石峨峨，七气氤氲，上有始生，皇老大神，总领肺气，主校九天，检定图录，制召上仙。 太白检肺，奎娄守魂，胃昂毕觜，主制七关，参总斗魁，受符北元。 赤书玉字，九天正文，摄召万炁，普归帝君。 西山神咒，八威七传，符水上龙，召山送云，在所校录，同到帝门，辅卫上真，斩灭邪源，若有不祥，截以金关。 赤书符命，风火驿传。 北方玉篆 凡一百二十字，正文在后。 译文 北方玄天，五炁徘徊，中有黑帝，双皇太微，总领符命，仙炼八威，青裙羽，龙文凤衣，上帝所举，制到玉阶。 北辰辅肾，斗牛卫扉，女虚危室，豁落四开，壁总七星，执凶紏非，却灾扫秽，明道动晖。 北山神咒，激阳起雷，流铃焕落，攫天振威，北酆所部，万妖灭摧。 九河倾讫，乌母群飞，蛟龙通道，水陌洞开。 赤文玉书，驿龙风驰。 玉诀章第五 师曰：凡行赤书安镇者，须先关告。 而正尔便为之，无所益也。 须奏章疏通，呈者为佳。 今具法式行用，以为一章。 而五帝策文，随经在前，八威龙文，随经在后。 此直迷五篇真文事节而已。 诸以启愿、求道、投刺等，悉先东向，叩齿三通，如运化章行持记。 次咒曰： 无上三天玄元始三炁太上老君，召出臣身中三五功曹、左右官使者、左右捧香、驿龙骑吏、侍香金童、传言玉女、五帝直符，各三十六人出，关启此间土地、四面真官：臣今正尔烧香关启，入意旨，愿得十方正真之炁，入臣身中。 所启上闻，径御无上至真大圣尊神玉帝凡前。 师曰：如不用此，即邪魔所干，不得上达。 五方赤书真文第六#1 全用五书格 师曰：凡投简，如告水帝削除罪籍，即朱书木简上，以青纸晨青丝，缠之金龙水简，以投三河之渊。 如告岳，仍用金纽，埋本命之岳。 告九地土皇，则亦如告岳之式，埋於所住中宫。 於简上书云：具位年若干，某月生。 於水府则云：愿神愿仙，长生不死，三元同存，九府水帝，十二河源，江海淮泽，溟泠大神，乞削罪名，上闻九天，谨诣水府，投简记名，金纽示信，金龙驿传。 五岳则曰：长生度世，飞行上清，五岳真人，至神至灵，乞削罪籍，上名九天，谨诣灵山，投简记名，金纽示信，金龙驿传。 九地则曰：长生度世，飞自上清，中皇九地，戊己黄神，土府五帝，乞削罪录，勒名太玄，谨诣中宫，投简记名，金纽示信，金龙驿传。 太岁某年某月某日某朔，於某处告闻。 用总监鬼神印印之。 右简悉皆背书真文，面书咒文。 水府咒 北向叩齿三通，宣简毕，告下。 召龙天水神内用。 元始五老，赤书高尊。 十方至真，太华灵仙。 赤文告命，无幽不闻。 上御九天，请下玉文。 日月五星，北斗七元。 中告五岳，四方灵山。 下告河海，十二河源。 九府水帝，溟泠大神。 今日上告，万愿开陈。 谨投玉简，乞削罪名。 千曾万祖，九族种亲。 罪相连染，及传我身。 普蒙削除，绝灭种根。 记名水府，言上帝前。 七祖父母，去离八难。 上登九天，衣食自然。 我罪释散，万神鬼咸闻。 谨以金纽，关盟水官。 请如所陈，金马驿传。 岳府咒 东向叩齿九通。 玄上开明，元始监真。 上帝五老，赤书丹文。 天地本始，总领三元。 摄炁合会，催促举仙。

The Western Azure Heavens, the Seven Gates of the White Emperor, radiant with golden luminosity, the Great Hua diffusing its mist, the towering White Stone, the seven qi swirling in abundance—above resides the Primordial Elder, the Great Deity, who governs the qi of the lungs, presides over the Nine Heavens, inspects and verifies the celestial registers, and commands the ascent of the immortals. The Great White governs the lungs, while Kui and Lou guard the hun-soul; Wei, Mao, Bi, and Zi oversee the Seven Passes; Shen, along with the Dipper’s Handle and Ladle, receive the talismans of the Northern Origin. The Crimson Script’s jade characters, the true text of the Nine Heavens, summon and gather the myriad qi, universally returning them to the Lord Emperor. The Western Mountain divine incantation, with its Eight Might and Seven Transmissions, the talismanic water ascending the dragons, summoning mountains and dispatching clouds—wherever it is inspected and recorded, all arrive together at the Emperor’s Gate, aiding and protecting the Perfected Ones above, severing and extinguishing the roots of evil. Should any inauspiciousness arise, it is blocked by the Golden Pass. The Crimson Script’s decrees are transmitted by wind and fire couriers.

The Northern Jade Script
Comprising one hundred twenty characters in all, with the main text set forth below.

The Northern Mysterious Heavens, the five qi meandering, within which resides the Black Emperor, the Dual Sovereigns of the Great Subtlety, who govern the talismanic decrees and refine the Eight Might of the immortals. Clad in azure skirts and feathered capes, dragon-patterned and phoenix-embroidered robes, they are raised by the Supreme Emperor, their commands reaching the Jade Stairs. The Northern Asterism assists the kidneys; the Dipper and Ox guard the gates; the Maiden, Void, Rooftop, and Chamber open the Four Vastnesses; the Wall encompasses the Seven Stars, seizing the malevolent and correcting the wrong, averting disasters and sweeping away impurities, illuminating the Dao and setting the radiance in motion. The Northern Mountain divine incantation, stirring the yang to summon thunder, the flowing bells and falling ornaments, seizing the heavens to display might—the legions of the Northern Feng, the myriad demons crushed and destroyed. The Nine Rivers pour forth, the Crow Mother and her flock take flight, the flood dragons clear the paths, the watery thoroughfares open wide. The Crimson Text’s jade script is borne swiftly by dragon couriers and wind.

Jade Instructions, Chapter Five
The Master said: For all who perform the Crimson Script’s pacification and stabilization rites, one must first submit a petition. To proceed without doing so is of no benefit. One must present a memorial to establish communication; this is the proper method. Here is the prescribed form and procedure, presented as a single memorial. The memorial texts for the Five Emperors follow the scriptures above, and the Eight Might Dragon Scripts follow the scriptures below. This merely outlines the essential matters of the Five True Scripts. For all petitions, prayers, entreaties for the Dao, or formal submissions, one must first face east, knock the teeth three times, and proceed as recorded in the "Practice of Transformative Circulation" chapter. Then recite the incantation:

"Most High Three Heavens, Primordial Origin, Three Qi, Supreme Elder Lord, summon forth from within this servant’s body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Attendants, the Left and Right Incense-Bearers, the Courier Dragon Riders, the Incense-Attending Golden Youths, the Message-Transmitting Jade Maidens, and the Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans—thirty-six of each—to emerge and notify the local earth deities and the true officials of the four directions: This servant now burns incense and submits this petition, conveying the intent, and wishes to receive the qi of the ten directions’ true and upright ones into this servant’s body. May this petition be heard above and swiftly presented to the Most High, Perfect, and Great Sage, the August Jade Emperor and all the deities before him."

The Master said: Without this, the petition will be obstructed by demonic forces and fail to reach the heavens.

The Five Directions’ Crimson Script True Texts, Chapter Six (Part 1)
All follow the Fivefold Script Format.

The Master said: For all submissions of wooden tablets, such as when petitioning the Water Emperor to erase one’s sinful records, write in vermilion on the wooden tablet, then bind it with azure paper and azure silk, forming a "Golden Dragon Water Tablet," to be cast into the depths of the Three Rivers. When petitioning the mountains, use a golden clasp and bury it at the mountain corresponding to one’s life destiny. When petitioning the Nine Earths’ Earth Sovereign, follow the same procedure as for the mountains, burying it at the central palace of one’s dwelling. On the tablet, write: "The humble official, aged so-and-so, born in such-and-such month." For the Water Palace, write: "Wishing for divine transcendence, long life without death, the Three Origins preserved together, the Nine Palaces’ Water Emperors, the Twelve River Sources, the Jiang, Hai, Huai, and Ze, the vast and profound great deities—beg to erase this servant’s sinful name, that it may be heard in the Nine Heavens. Respectfully presented to the Water Palace, this tablet records the name, with a golden clasp as token and a golden dragon courier for transmission." For the Five Peaks, write: "Long life and transcendence of the world, flying ascent to the Supreme Clarity, the Perfected of the Five Peaks, most divine and numinous—beg to erase this servant’s sinful records, that the name may ascend to the Nine Heavens. Respectfully presented to the Sacred Mountain, this tablet records the name, with a golden clasp as token and a golden dragon courier for transmission." For the Nine Earths, write: "Long life and transcendence of the world, flying ascent to the Supreme Clarity, the Central August Nine Earths, the Yellow Deities of Wu and Ji, the Five Emperors of the Earth Palace—beg to erase this servant’s sinful records, that the name may be inscribed in the Great Mystery. Respectfully presented to the Central Palace, this tablet records the name, with a golden clasp as token and a golden dragon courier for transmission." Dated in the such-and-such year, month, and day of the Great Year, submitted at such-and-such place. Seal with the "Inspector of Ghosts and Spirits" seal. On the reverse of all tablets, write the true text; on the front, write the incantation.

Water Palace Incantation
Face north, knock the teeth three times, recite the tablet, and make the announcement below. Summon the Heavenly Water Dragons for internal use.

"The Primordial Five Elders, the exalted Crimson Script, the Perfected of the Ten Directions, the numinous immortals of Great Hua. The Crimson Text’s decrees are heard in even the most hidden places. Ascending to the Nine Heavens, beseech the descent of the Jade Script. The sun, moon, and Five Stars, the Northern Dipper’s Seven Origins. Petition the Five Peaks and the sacred mountains of the four directions. Petition the rivers and seas, the Twelve River Sources. The Nine Palaces’ Water Emperors, the vast and profound great deities. Today, this servant makes this supreme petition, unfolding ten thousand wishes. Respectfully submitting this jade tablet, beg to erase this servant’s sinful name. A thousand ancestors, ten thousand forebears, the nine clans and all kin—sins that have spread and stained, transmitted even to this servant’s body. May all be universally erased, their roots severed and extinguished. Recorded in the Water Palace, proclaimed before the Supreme Emperor. Seven generations of ancestors and parents, delivered from the Eight Difficulties. Ascending to the Nine Heavens, clothed and fed by nature. This servant’s sins released and dispersed, heard by all spirits and ghosts. Respectfully with a golden clasp, pledged to the Water Officials. May the petition be as stated, transmitted by golden horse couriers."

Peak Palace Incantation
Face east, knock the teeth nine times.

"The Mysterious Above opens and illumines, the Primordial Origin oversees the Perfected. The Supreme Emperor’s Five Elders, the Crimson Script’s cinnabar text. The origins of heaven and earth, governing the Three Origins. Gathering and uniting the qi, hastening the ascent of the immortals."

chunks.original_text: 凡隐书五方赤书真文，置五方，则五岳仙官至。 长斋百日，精思，则天神下降。 但佩此文，亦得尸解。 朱书五方五色石上，灾殃自灭，凶逆自消。 凡五岳不必正岳，只以住居之山分五岳，以命方为命，皆取像以招灵气，岳之神无不住也。 凡人一面之上，亦有五岳备焉。 折用五书诀 师曰：梵熙开廓，出图度世，无文不光，无文不立，无文不成，无文不度，无文不生。 故百魔隐韵，离合自然。 因文以治事，因意以立章。 凡灵书中篇，上下二品，皆可离合而用，并用总监鬼神印。 投灵山之岳法咒 每遇本命甲子，遇立春，写东方赤书，自东方起，至举仙住，凡二十四字。 书於九天元台。 立夏，则写南方赤书，自南方起，至太阳住，凡三十二字。 书於九天洞阳之馆。 二分、二至，则写中央赤书，自中央起，至万神住，凡四十字。 书于太玄玉宝玄台。 立秋，则写西方赤书，自西方起，至上仙住，凡四十八字。 书于九人素灵宫北轩之上。 立冬，则写北方赤书，自北方起，至玉阶住，凡四十字。 书于玄元紫微台北轩之内。 天书须依方色，书白刺上，记姓名，日月。 如投简，则九年五方仙官到，使青腰、赤圭、黄素、大素玉女来。 皆先叩齿十二通，咒曰： 玄上高灵，元始尊神，大圣徘徊，万圣临轩。 三景敷晖，庆云四陈。 上投校图，推算九天。 今日启愿，投刺灵山。 丹书赤字，自然真文。 上告五帝，记名玉篇。 万神监映，日月明言。 愿度愿生，愿神愿仙。 天地星宿，互照我身。 三官九府，五岳太神。 普告无穷，削除罪根。 元始大开，莫不纳言。 九祖幽魂，受福自然。 三途五苦，永离八难。 得与三景，同晖紫宸。 轮转不灭，身得飞仙。 毕，读刺了，投於绝岔，便散香灵山之上。 又叩齿三通，向本命咒曰： 元始监映，仙名已书，三官九府，罪莫不除。 散香五帝，告监太虚。 请如所陈，万劫长居。 安镇星度天灾法咒 安镇五方赤书，主召某方星官，正天文分度，若天灾安镇，则随方而息。 东方自岁星起，写至灾群住，凡三十二字。 以青纸朱书，露中庭九日九夜，依法以火烧，散灰於青烟之中。 并刻书於青石上，埋之。 南方目荧起，写至命灵住，凡三十六字。 以青纸朱书，露中庭三日三夜，依前法烧。 并刻书於赤石上，埋之。 中央自镇星起，写至驿传住，凡四十字。 以青纸朱书，露中庭十二日十二夜，依前法烧。 并刻书於黄石上，埋之。 西方自太白起，写至北元住，凡二十四字。 以青纸朱书，露中庭七日七夜，依前法烧。 并刻书於白石上，埋之。 北方自北辰起，写至动晖住，凡三十二字。 以青纸朱书，露中庭五日五夜，依前法烧。 并刻於黑石上，埋之。 皆向方面散发，叩齿十二通。 咒曰： 元始上天，三官高明，回景臜曜，四方朗清。 运度所冲，激扬流星。 三界错越，三统失宁。 五斗总是，七宿明灵。 真君大魁，厥讳玉精。 夫人皇妃，字曰育婴。 总御玄关，回转诸天。 今有客灾，玄告不祥。 谨以真文，赤书上呈。 散发谢愆，披露丹诚。 惟垂玄监，回复天经。 炁不横越，灾不横生。 坟烧灵文，散烟玉庭。 上景照监，普告万灵。 炁消三关，灾灭九冥。 阴阳调和，国土太平。 谨以金龙，风驰驿呈。 毕，露真文於中庭，以金龙镇之，随日而化。
chunks.translated_text:
Whenever the Hidden Script’s Five Directions’ Vermilion Writ of True Text is placed in the five directions, the immortal officials of the Five Peaks will arrive. After a hundred days of strict fasting and concentrated meditation, the celestial deities will descend. Merely wearing this text also enables *shijie* (corpse-liberation). Inscribing the Five Directions’ texts in vermilion on five-colored stones causes disasters to vanish and inauspicious omens to dissolve.

The Five Peaks need not be the true mountains; one may designate the mountains of one’s dwelling as the Five Peaks, aligning the directional mandate to summon the numinous *qi*. The spirits of the peaks will invariably respond. Even upon a person’s face, the Five Peaks are fully present.

**Method of Employing the Fivefold Writ**
The Master said: *"Brahmā’s vast expanse unfolds, revealing charts to deliver the world. Without script, no radiance; without script, no establishment; without script, no completion; without script, no deliverance; without script, no life."* Thus, the hundred demons conceal their rhymes, their coalescence natural. Govern affairs through script; establish chapters through intent.

Within the numinous writs, both upper and lower ranks may be separated or combined for use, always employing the *General Inspector of Ghosts and Spirits Seal*.

**Ritual Incantation for Presenting Petitions to the Peaks of the Numinous Mountains**
On each *benming* *jiazi* day or at the *Lichun* solar term, inscribe the Eastern Vermilion Writ, beginning from the East and concluding at *"Immortal Dwelling"*, comprising twenty-four characters. Write it upon the *Nine Heavens’ Primordial Terrace*. At *Lixia*, inscribe the Southern Vermilion Writ, beginning from the South and concluding at *"Great Yang Dwelling"*, comprising thirty-two characters. Write it upon the *Nine Heavens’ Cavern Yang Lodge*. At the equinoxes and solstices, inscribe the Central Vermilion Writ, beginning from the Center and concluding at *"Myriad Spirits Dwelling"*, comprising forty characters. Write it upon the *Great Mystery Jade Treasure Mystic Terrace*. At *Liqiu*, inscribe the Western Vermilion Writ, beginning from the West and concluding at *"Upper Immortal Dwelling"*, comprising forty-eight characters. Write it upon the *Nine Transcendents’ Pure Numinous Palace’s Northern Pavilion*. At *Lidong*, inscribe the Northern Vermilion Writ, beginning from the North and concluding at *"Jade Staircase Dwelling"*, comprising forty characters. Write it upon the *Mystic Origin Purple Tenuity’s Northern Pavilion*.

The celestial writ must adhere to the directional color: inscribe on white paper, noting the name, day, and month. If submitting a petition, after nine years, the immortal officials of the Five Directions will arrive, dispatching the *Azure Waist*, *Vermilion Jade Tablet*, *Yellow Silk*, and *Great Jade Maidens*. First, knock the teeth twelve times and recite the incantation:

*"Mystic and exalted numina, Primordial Venerable Deities,
Great Sages meander, myriad sages attend the pavilion.
Three luminaries spread their radiance, auspicious clouds array on four sides.
Upward, the celestial charts are submitted, the reckoning of the Nine Heavens advanced.
Today, this vow is initiated, a petition presented to the numinous peaks.
Vermilion writ of cinnabar script, natural true text.
Reporting to the Five Thearchs, names recorded in the Jade Chapters.
Myriad spirits oversee and reflect, sun and moon bear witness.
May deliverance be granted, may life be bestowed,
May divinity be attained, may immortality be achieved.
Heaven and earth, stars and constellations, mutually illuminate this body.
Three Officials and Nine Bureaus, Five Peaks and Great Spirits,
Universally proclaim without end, transgressions and roots of sin erased.
The Primordial Beginning grandly opens, none fail to receive these words.
Nine generations of ancestral souls, naturally receive blessings.
Three Paths and Five Sufferings, forever parted from the Eight Difficulties.
Attaining union with the Three Luminaries, together radiant in the Purple Court.
Revolving without extinction, this body ascends as a flying immortal."*

Conclude the reading, cast the petition into a secluded fork in the path, then scatter incense upon the numinous peaks. Knock the teeth three more times and face the *benming* direction, reciting:

*"The Primordial Beginning oversees and reflects, immortal names already inscribed.
Three Officials and Nine Bureaus, no sin remains unabsolved.
Scatter incense to the Five Thearchs, report to the overseer of the Great Void.
As herein stated, may [this petition] abide for ten thousand kalpas."*

**Incantation for Pacifying and Stabilizing the Stars and Celestial Disasters**
To pacify the Five Directions’ Vermilion Writ and summon the stellar officials of a given direction, rectify the celestial divisions. If pacifying celestial disasters, they will subside according to the direction. For the East, begin from *Jupiter* and write to *"Disaster Flock Dwelling"*, comprising thirty-two characters. Inscribe in vermilion on blue paper, expose in the central courtyard for nine days and nights, then burn according to the method and scatter the ashes into blue smoke. Also carve and inscribe on green stone, then bury it. For the South, begin from *Mars* and write to *"Life Spirit Dwelling"*, comprising thirty-six characters. Inscribe in vermilion on blue paper, expose in the central courtyard for three days and nights, then burn as before. Also carve and inscribe on red stone, then bury it. For the Center, begin from *Saturn* and write to *"Courier Relay Dwelling"*, comprising forty characters. Inscribe in vermilion on blue paper, expose in the central courtyard for twelve days and twelve nights, then burn as before. Also carve and inscribe on yellow stone, then bury it. For the West, begin from *Venus* and write to *"Northern Primordial Dwelling"*, comprising twenty-four characters. Inscribe in vermilion on blue paper, expose in the central courtyard for seven days and seven nights, then burn as before. Also carve and inscribe on white stone, then bury it. For the North, begin from *Polaris* and write to *"Moving Radiance Dwelling"*, comprising thirty-two characters. Inscribe in vermilion on blue paper, expose in the central courtyard for five days and five nights, then burn as before. Also carve and inscribe on black stone, then bury it.

Face the respective direction, scatter the hair, and knock the teeth twelve times. Recite the incantation:

*"Primordial Beginning of the Upper Heavens, Three Officials exalted and luminous,
Revolving radiance and effulgence, the four directions resplendent and clear.
Where the celestial revolutions clash, meteors surge and stream.
The Three Realms are disordered, the Three Sequences lose their peace.
Five Celestial Ladles unite, Seven Lodgings brightly numinous.
True Lords, Great Leaders, their tabooed names are Jade Essence.
The Sovereign’s Consort, styled ‘Nurturing Infant’,
Together governs the Mystic Pass, revolving all heavens.
Now, an ominous calamity arises, darkly reported as inauspicious.
Respectfully presenting the true text, the Vermilion Writ is submitted above.
Scattering hair to atone for transgressions, baring the cinnabar sincerity.
May the Mystic Overseer deign to observe, restoring the celestial canon.
Let *qi* not stray, disasters not arise wantonly.
Burn the numinous writ, scatter the smoke in the Jade Court.
Upper luminaries oversee and reflect, universally proclaiming to the myriad spirits.
*Qi* dissolves the Three Passes, disasters vanish in the Nine Netherworlds.
Yin and yang harmonize, the land attains great peace.
Respectfully with a golden dragon, swiftly transmitted by wind-driven couriers."*

Conclude by exposing the true writ in the central courtyard, stabilizing it with a golden dragon, which dissolves with the passing days.

Moreover, according to the directional colors and numerical correspondences, employ lamps for illumination and use silk as tokens.

**Method of Summoning and Incantation**
Whenever receiving the supreme method, one must first subdue demonic spirits.
Once demonic essences are subdued, divine luminaries naturally transform.

For the **east**: inscribe from "Dongshan" to "Jiyan zhu" (32 characters), written in vermilion on a green wooden tablet. Address it to the **Hall of Eastern Florescence and Mystic Numinosity**.
For the **south**: inscribe from "Beishe" to "Cuwang zhu" (36 characters), written in yellow on a red wooden tablet. Address it to the **Jade Palace of the Southwestern Yang Rectitude**.
For the **center**: inscribe from "Chishe" to "Dangqian zhu" (16 characters), written in white on a yellow wooden tablet. Address it to the **Jade Terrace of the Mystic Metropolis**.
For the **west**: inscribe from "Chishu" to "Dijun zhu" (16 characters), written in black on a white wooden tablet. Address it to the **Hall of the Nine Heavens’ Golden Mound and Two Charts**.
For the **north**: inscribe from "Beishan" to "Mie cui zhu" (24 characters), written in green on a black wooden tablet. Address it to the **Northern Cavern of Yin and the Northern Wilderness**.

When reciting the incantation:
- Face north five times,
- Face east nine times,
- Face south three times,
- Face the center twelve times,
- Face west seven times.
Each time, strike the teeth thirty-six times, hold the *qi* for nine breaths, and, looking upward, recite the incantation:

*"The Three Origins illuminate, revolving the celestial constant.
The reckoning of fate concludes, ascending the Hundred-Six.
At the great kalpa’s convergence, myriad demons contend.
The Northern Feng defies restraint, releasing the ancestral ghosts.
Hordes of demons rampage, obscuring the celestial light.
The Supreme Emperor commands, universally proclaiming to the ten directions.
The celestial measure is expounded, the Dharma’s teachings unfold.
The true Dao governs the people, sweeping away inauspiciousness.
What petty fiends gather to cause harm?
The vermilion writ and jade script restrain and subdue the demonic realms.
The Three Officials of the Northern Feng swiftly transmit the decree.
A thousand demons are bound, ten thousand ghosts surrender their forms.
Interlocking bells radiate, stirring the *qi* of the Great Yang.
Golden tigers patrol the four quarters, celestial soldiers seize the fugitives.
Great and small assemble together, none may conceal or hide.
What the Primordial Beginning proclaims is reported to the celestial bureaus."*

**Incantation for Summoning the Dragon, Celestial Water Deities, Halting Floods, and Crossing Waters**
When the great kalpic disasters of heaven and earth arise, and floods surge from all directions, this talisman may avert or halt them. Alternatively, it may command dragons to open waterways, creating passages to ferry one’s form across.

For the **east**: inscribe from "Xiazhi Donghe" to "Wuwen zhi" (32 characters), written in yellow on green paper, and cast it into the water.
For the **south**: inscribe from "Nanhe" to "Bucong zhi" (14 or 8 characters).
For the **center**: inscribe from "Zhongshan" to "Puwenzhi" (48 characters).
For the **west**: inscribe from "Xishan" to "Yichuan zhi" (48 characters).
For the **north**: inscribe from "Jiuhe" to "Fengchi zhi" (24 characters).
For all directions, follow the eastern method: strike the teeth five times, hold the *qi* for thirty-five breaths, and visualize fire arising from the heart and mind, emerging from the crown of the head to burn the mountains, forests, grasses, and even one’s own body entirely into ashes, all scattering and ascending into the azure smoke without remnant. Then, envision the great waters surging and billowing, while one’s own form transforms into a dragon, drifting with the current.

Next, strike the teeth twenty-five times and recite the incantation:

*"The Supreme Origin revolves the numinous, illuminating the Nine Heavens.
The primordial impels the earth’s turning, the Three *Qi* flow in transmission.
The Five Phases press upon one another, the mechanism of fate’s reckoning turns.
Yin and yang clash in opposition, congealing into calamitous collisions.
The great kalpa’s record topples, sweeping away filth and dispelling miasma.
The Nine Rivers receive their retribution, torrents surge through the streams.
Water mothers wander, crows and horses gather in flocks.
Sun and moon darkly converge, the Three Luminaries halt at the passes.
The Supreme selects its ministers, examining the jade script.
Abandoning evil and esteeming good, the clear and turbid waters part.
I partake in the imperial decree, my name listed in the Nine Heavens.
At the convergence of the four great disasters, the vermilion writ absolves all.
On this day, the mandate is proclaimed, and the myriad spirits all hear.
Sun, moon, and the five planets illuminate my soul.
The numinous light of the Five Peaks, the mountains float to ferry my body.
The water palaces of the Nine Rivers, the vast and cold great spirits,
Open and clear the waterways, dredging the river fords.
Dragons respond to the talisman, drawing mountains and sending clouds.
Bearing me, ferrying me, startlingly reversing the celestial patterns.
Vermilion script and jade characters, the Primordial Beginning’s true writ.
Golden dragons swiftly transmitted, the moment unheard.
This must be reported above, presented before the Imperial Honored One."*

Conclude by swallowing *qi* twenty-five times. Shortly thereafter, water deities will naturally open the passageways. In the mountains, the mountains will float; in the waters, the waters will part. This may be called deliverance in times of urgent peril.

chunks.original_text: 师曰：受学道士佩此灵文，施於神咒，以策文指天，则天神下降，指地则地只朝礼，三界束带，指神神敬，指鬼鬼灭，指水水神通道。 大劫交运，洪灾四会，以策召龙，龙为护身。 长修善事，精诚通达，则神灵交会，所在施召，举向立到，千变万奇，适意所从，出入行藏，位推太极，前导飞龙，后从钧天，凤啸鸾呜，十二华光，建九色之节，命灵之旛。 精思九年，天仪自备。 常朱书三天太上召伏蛟龙虎豹山精文，着一板上。 又书记年月、师姓名，着一板上。 合二板，内囊裹。 又朱书次文，着一板上，凡三板，合封为神策，如簿之状。 板悉用银木为之，长一尺四寸，广二寸四分，以绛纹之缯作囊，合长二尺四寸，衣之封外，又上下封以元始五老之章。 内板格 外板次文洛

The Master said: When a Daoist disciple studying the Way wears this numinous script and employs it in divine incantations, pointing the inscribed staff toward heaven will cause celestial spirits to descend; pointing it toward earth will make the earth spirits prostrate in reverence. The Three Realms will gird themselves in submission. Pointing at spirits will command their respect; pointing at demons will annihilate them; pointing at water will make the water deities open the passageways.

When great kalpas shift and cataclysmic floods converge from all directions, wield the staff to summon dragons, and they will shield your body. Through prolonged cultivation of good deeds and the penetration of sincere devotion, the divine and numinous will commune with you. Wherever you invoke them, they will arrive at once upon your gesture—transforming endlessly in myriad wonders, conforming to your will. In your comings and goings, movements and stillness, your position will be exalted to the Supreme Ultimate. Flying dragons will lead the way before you, while the Celestial Harmony of the Nine Heavens follows behind. Phoenixes will cry and simurghs will sing. Twelve radiant floral lights will shine forth, bearing the nine-colored standards and the banners of the summoned spirits.

After nine years of concentrated contemplation, the celestial regalia will naturally be complete. Regularly inscribe in cinnabar the *Script of the Three Heavens’ Supreme Highest for Summoning and Subduing Flood Dragons, Tigers, Leopards, and Mountain Spirits* upon one tablet. On another tablet, record the year, month, and the names of the master and disciple. Bind these two tablets together and enclose them in a pouch. On a third tablet, inscribe in cinnabar the secondary script. Altogether, three tablets are sealed to form the divine staff, resembling a booklet in shape.

All tablets are to be made of silverwood, each one foot and four inches in length and two inches and four *fen* in width. The pouch is fashioned from crimson-patterned silk, measuring two feet and four inches in total length, and is used to encase the sealed tablets. On the exterior, the upper and lower seals bear the talismans of the Five Venerable Ones of Primordial Beginning. The inner tablets follow the prescribed format, while the outer tablet bears the secondary script of Luo.

These are sealed together to form the staff, to be employed in the rites of prostration and reverence."

"Primordial Beginning, Supreme Perfected,
Five Numinous Ones of Lofty Honor,
Radiant as Mount Taihua’s brilliance,
Illuminating the Eight Gates with clarity,

No hidden realm remains unheard.
Above, they disrupt the Nine Heavens;
At center, they restrain Mount Feng;
Below, they pacify rivers and seas,
The twelve sources of all waters.
Eightfold Might Divine Incantation,
Numinous Staff and Jade Text:
Summon dragons to bear the waters,
Gather qi and amass clouds,
Bind demons and dispatch ghosts,
Sweep away and scatter demonic hordes,
Crush the myriad spirits,
None slain shall escape.
Sun, moon, and five planets,
Northern Dipper’s seven origins,
All heavens, all earths,
All waters, all mountains,
The hosts of the Five Perfected,
The vast spirits of the boundless,
Immortal Kings in their feasts,
Five Emperors with their banners,
Heavenly Soldiers as vanguard,
Golden Tigers in pursuit.
Fierce beasts of heaven,
Arrayed to guard the four gates—
What is called arrives at once,
What is summoned stands before.
Crimson Script shines resplendent,
Wind and fire cease not.
Wherever there is command or verification,
Golden dragons swiftly convey it."

The master says: "The Numinous Chart, Crimson Script, and Jade Formula, the Dragon Staff’s chapters—all briefly recount the unfolding of the Crimson Radiance’s revealed chart, extending to the myriad models’ expansion. Every passage records the Crimson Script’s resplendence, its unfolding and deployment for the salvation of even a fraction of living beings. Though its gates are many, one cannot recall them all. The scholar who masters one thereby masters all things—what need is there for multiplicity?"

chunks.original_text: 如能精专，何施不可。 傥一一求之，虽弹纸墨，不足以尽为用，多乎哉？ 所谓万范开张也。 元纲章第二 元纲流演，三十二天。 轮转无色，周回十方。 旋斗历箕，回度五常。 三十五分，总炁上元。 八景冥合，炁入玄玄。 玄中太皇，上帝高真。 泛景太霞，啸咏洞章。 金真朗郁，流响云营。 玉音摄炁，灵风聚烟。 紫虚郁秀，辅翼万仙。 千和万合，自然成真。 真中有神，长生太君。 无英公子，白元尊神。 太乙司命，桃康合延。 执符把箓，保命生根。 上游上清，出入华房。 入冥之内，细微之中。 下镇人身，泥丸绛官。 中理五炁，混合百神。 十转回灵，万炁齐仙。 师曰：元纲者，升仙之要路，天阶之绝景。 道源既判，神天居空洞之上，非言可尽，非见可闻。 悟其真者，因真修真，而外真自应矣。 识其妙者，因妙得妙，而外妙自应矣。 推神天之象，则元纲之位，其远其近，举可知也。 人之有元炁，关通骨殊骯穴，上达於顶，一如天上元纲之路。 人之魂魄在身，一如人在天中，知出入则长生飞腾，不知则庸愚之夫，不学术业，未知事官联班之次J 而求见君也。 夫元炁融聚，魂魄所养，爰有真精。 真精所本根，於左肾右肾为命门，在春骨之穷。 其下有大骨，骨中髓透(户十九)骨。 其穴多龟尾，其神为王母，面南而治事，因帝所向而言，谓之西龟之山，道家托喻以为名也。 又谓之金阙，以其居西也。 右谓为金阙，左为玉房。 玉房，言其玉在山而木润。 居东方也。 又玉，水之所本，阳精之化，精之所着，名曰净霐。 此元纲之炁，根本所发之地。 宝图之设高坛，起於此。 存三之说，，郁罗萧台，基於此。 台之中尊，直当於心，所谓灵台，此上清之景也。 太清之上际，则心之下也。 心之悬垂，其下为肝。 肝之下二分，北斗七星居之。 其炁达心，其原上通舌下，名曰涌泉。 其炁下达右肾，肾之炁泄者，以涌泉之炁不禁为交锋。 交锋者，言斗之罡星大□所照之地，其性肃杀，其神即欲界也。 如知道者，以舌柱上腭，直运其炁，循脊而上，以脊通头。 头者，上清玉京之要路。 所谓西龟与玉京为邻界者，是今人不知，便以为西龟在脑者有之。 然龟去玉清之炁四千万里，则其辽邈可知也。 心居中，炁直达在天，则火星最低，炁先及也。 又心属火，命门之炁亦属火，言上达而相感，天之日月与火星齐，故曰月参之。 人身，则两乳与心齐。 两乳者，两眼之根原也。 人之二乳，藏精以养目也。 故年老气败目昏，则乳无根，肾无精。 其斗在天之东北，为天之关键，艮之位也。 於人，则右手肩井穴也。 人之炁脉，以右为始。 天道行，以西北为始，由行西而至牛宿，而天事毕。 人之炁，自右手肩井至左手，而人炁周。 天事虽毕，而未可发生，故造化於北起焉，言重入火星也。 人炁虽一周，而消息系焉，言重入心中也。 由火、木、水、金而行者，天度也。 由心、肝、肾、肺而行者，炁脸背脊之穴也。 取脊穴而观，则上下左右见矣。 求其妙而推其喉环，通顶门，所以为玄玄之妙。 妙者，言之不能尽，不可指而名也。 无色之界，在心之下，空洞之处，□之左也。 后自斗口，以舌柱上胯也。 舌柱上腭者，名上天桥，则超上清矣。 如此则玉清之景，头也，太清之景，丹田也；

**Chapter Two: The Primordial Net**

The Primordial Net flows and unfolds,
Through thirty-two heavens.
Revolving without form,
Circling the ten directions.
Spinning the Dipper, traversing the Winnowing Basket,
Revolving through the five constants.
Thirty-five divisions,
Converge in the qi of the Upper Prime.
Eight luminous scenes merge in darkness,
Qi enters the Mystery of Mysteries.
Within the Mystery, the Grand August,
The Highest Perfected of the Supreme Emperor.
Floating upon the radiance of the great rosy clouds,
Chanting and intoning the cavernous chapters.
Golden perfection shines resplendent,
Its resonance flowing through the cloudy encampments.
Jade tones gather qi,
Spiritual winds amass mist.
The Purple Void flourishes in elegance,
Assisting and sheltering the myriad immortals.
A thousand harmonies, ten thousand unions,
Naturally attain perfection.
Within perfection dwells the spirit,
The Ever-Living Grand Lord.
The Peerless Duke,
The Venerable White Prime.
The Great One who Oversees Destiny,
Peach and Health unite to prolong life.
Grasping talismans, holding registers,
Preserving life and planting its root.
Ascending to the Upper Clarity,
Entering and exiting the Flowery Chambers.
Within the darkness,
In the subtlest of subtleties.
Below, it governs the human body,
In the Crimson Palace of the Mud Pill.
Centering the five qi,
Blending with the hundred spirits.
Ten revolutions return the numinous,
Myriad qi ascend as immortals.

The master says: "The Primordial Net is the essential path of ascending immortality, the supreme vista of the celestial steps. Once the source of the Dao divides, the divine heavens reside above the Hollow Cavern—beyond what words can exhaust, beyond what sight can perceive or hearing can grasp. Those who awaken to its perfection, through perfection cultivate perfection, and external perfection naturally responds. Those who recognize its subtlety, through subtlety attain subtlety, and external subtlety naturally responds. Observing the image of the divine heavens, the position of the Primordial Net—whether distant or near—can be known at once.

The human body possesses primordial qi, connected through the bone’s hidden apertures, ascending to the crown, just as the Primordial Net’s path exists in the heavens. The human soul and spirit within the body are like a person within the heavens—knowing their entry and exit leads to long life and flight; ignorance makes one a common fool, unlearned in arts and skills, unaware of the order of offices and ranks, yet seeking an audience with the sovereign.

When primordial qi fuses and gathers, it nourishes the soul and spirit, giving rise to true essence. The root of true essence lies between the left and right kidneys, called the Gate of Destiny, located in the spring bone’s aperture. Below it lies the great bone, its marrow penetrating the nineteenth vertebra. This aperture is often likened to the Tail of the Tortoise, its spirit the Queen Mother, who faces south to govern affairs. As the Emperor faces her, it is called the Mountain of the Western Tortoise—a metaphor adopted by Daoists. It is also called the Golden Watchtower, for its residence in the west. The right is termed the Golden Watchtower, the left the Jade Chamber. The Jade Chamber signifies jade within the mountain, its wood moistened, residing in the east. Moreover, jade is the origin of water, the transformation of yang essence, where essence congeals—named the Pure Abyss. This is the place from which the qi of the Primordial Net originates, the foundational site of its emanation. The establishment of the precious chart’s high altar begins here. The discourse on the Threefold Storage, the Terrace of Luxuriant Mist, is based upon this. The honored center of the terrace aligns directly with the heart—what is called the Numinous Terrace, the scene of the Upper Clarity. The upper boundary of the Grand Clarity lies below the heart.

The heart’s suspended root extends downward to the liver. Two divisions below the liver, the Northern Dipper’s seven stars reside. Its qi reaches the heart, its origin ascending to the tongue’s underside—named the Bubbling Spring. Its qi descends to the right kidney; the kidney’s qi leaks when the Bubbling Spring’s qi fails to restrain the crossing blades. The crossing blades refer to the Dipper’s handle star, the great □ illuminating the earth—its nature stern and deadly, its spirit the realm of desire. Those who know the Dao press the tongue against the upper palate, directly guiding the qi to ascend along the spine, connecting the spine to the head. The head is the essential path to the Upper Clarity’s Jade Capital. The so-called Western Tortoise and Jade Capital as neighboring realms—some today, unaware, mistakenly place the Western Tortoise in the brain. Yet the Tortoise lies forty million miles from the Jade Clarity’s qi—its remoteness is evident.

The heart resides in the center, its qi ascending directly to the heavens, where the Fire Star is lowest and its qi reaches first. Moreover, the heart pertains to fire, as does the Gate of Destiny’s qi—speaking of their mutual ascent and resonance. The heavens’ sun and moon align with the Fire Star, hence called the lunar triad. In the human body, the two breasts align with the heart. The two breasts are the root origin of the two eyes. The human’s two breasts store essence to nourish the eyes. Thus, when old age depletes qi and the eyes dim, the breasts lose their root, the kidneys lack essence.

The Dipper in the heavens’ northeast serves as the heavens’ pivot, the position of the mountain. In humans, this corresponds to the Shoulder Well point of the right hand. The human’s qi vessels begin on the right. The heavenly Dao moves, beginning in the northwest, proceeding west to the Ox Mansion, completing celestial affairs. Though celestial affairs conclude, generation cannot yet begin—thus creation arises in the north, re-entering the Fire Star. Though the human’s qi completes one cycle, its ebb and flow depend on re-entering the heart. Proceeding through fire, wood, water, and metal is the heavenly measure. Proceeding through heart, liver, kidneys, and lungs is the path of qi along the face and spine’s apertures. Observing the spine’s apertures reveals the above and below, left and right. Seeking its subtlety and tracing the throat’s ring, penetrating the crown gate—this is the subtlety of the Mystery of Mysteries. Subtlety cannot be fully expressed in words, nor can it be pointed to and named.

The formless realm lies below the heart, in the hollow space to the □’s left. From the Dipper’s mouth, the tongue presses the upper palate—this is called the Upper Heavenly Bridge, transcending the Upper Clarity. Thus, the scene of the Jade Clarity is the head, the scene of the Grand Clarity is the cinnabar field..."

Every passage records the Crimson Script’s resplendence, its unfolding and deployment for the salvation of even a fraction of living beings. Though its gates are many, one cannot recall them all. The scholar who masters one thereby masters all things—what need is there for multiplicity?"

chunks.original_text: 上清之景，绛宫也。 心为灵台，则灵宝之说可见矣。 於是而守，守之在心。 於是而朝，朝之在头。 此三华离便，而见大有之庭也。 故天中之天，无英、白元之会於心也。 自然成真，则会於头也。 修上道而至此，则事毕矣，不可得而容声也。 故录为元罡飞步之法，其有细微，出在净明法中，今具罡图于后。 师曰：元罡之事，参於身中，则啸、咏洞章之说。 以经而论，则云玄中太皇，至自然成真住也。 究其义，则玉清之景也。 玉清者，天上之天也。 仰而视之，则无上也； 俯而窥之，则日月五星斗宿之神也，三十二天之帝也。 言会而朝高真太皇也。 太皇在洞房中，三十二天罗布，二十八宿环之，日月五星侍立於前，峨然大有之庭也。 以人身而求之，天则头者，上天也。 两眉间者，太皇上帝高真所居也。 泛景太霞者，两目中光也。 啸、味洞章，鼻口出入息也。 金真者，鼻应金也。 流响云营，玉音摄炁者，口鼻之息，其响韵如此。 紫虚者，眉　也。 辅翼万仙，千和万合者，耳目鼻。 不妄为出入，有真人童子存焉。 其声合乎天籁，与洞章参言，中正之和气分，以其音召和气出，为布炁阮水之咒。 师曰：长生太君，火之正星，玄中太皇之炁也。 无英公子、白元尊神，是金木之神星。 太乙司命，是水之尊号。 桃康合廷，是土之真帝。 以洞房仙法验之，世书之论不同，今正本法，推穷得旨要之精者，为洞房法。 咒水布炁法 诸呢水布炁，见玄中太皇，身着上清衣，手执青书，坐师子座。 左有长生大君，右有太乙司命，亦衣上清衣，执圭侍立。 其大如枣，在两眉间，方阔一寸，如亭殿金阙，照耀有光，如青红瑠璃照水中。 如布炁，则存照病人念咒，自玄中太皇起，至自然成真住，凡九遍，存思耳目。 鼻中，有仙乐洞章步虚之声。 咒水时，吹炁於水中九。 。 布炁吹病人亦九口。 布炁未验，再存吹三次而止。 洞房修真法 诸修真洞房者，亦存三守一之要法也。 每日静坐，不拘时候，存玄中太皇，身着上清衣，手执青圭，坐师子上。 长生大君在左，太乙司命在右； 无英在左，白元在右； 桃康在左； 桃孩在右。 长生，火也。 火传厨不息，故为长生，心也。 太乙，命门之神也，故为司命。 无英，肝神。 白元，肺神。 桃康、合延，土神。 物入土则分析而生，故其神有二。 此神居脐中，脐为命之根，土为五行之根。 今以为肾神，则非也。 肾，水也，得土而知。 故存肾者，亦思二桃也。 存之，则次第存，自本宫出，各衣上清金缕霞衣，侍卫中尊。 太皇在眉间，分明了然。 眉中一寸，广和宫殿。 微咒曰：真中有神至，万炁齐仙住。 凡八十一徧，一徧，取炁一口。 又思已魂衣绛绫衣抱，戴远游之冠，朝见太皇高尊，与太皇高尊相对坐，众真侍立如前。 复念前咒九徧，咽津八十一过而止。 灵芽章第三 师曰：经自梵炁而分，其言包含万范，皆明梵炁分布，施生灵秀。 於是而知赤书之字，结为五芽。 在天则为五帝之精，在人则为五官之秀。 中理五炁者，以其下镇安於一人也。 故自修洞房，行元纲，布神炁，而服五芽，存思食生炁之法。 服五芽法 师曰：九炁青天，三炁丹天，中央黄天，七炁素天，五炁玄天，各有五帝五灵之童。 东方青灵之童，典清帝之书，讳开阳，长九寸，青羽衣，执青麾，侍文左。
