The scene of the Upper Clarity is the Crimson Palace. The heart as the Spirit Terrace reveals the teachings of the Numinous Treasure. Thus, in guarding, one guards the heart. Thus, in audience, one attends the head. When the Three Flowers depart from their stems, the court of the Great Existence is revealed. Therefore, within the Heaven of Heaven, the assembly of Wu Ying and Bai Yuan occurs in the heart. Naturally attaining perfection, they assemble in the head. Having cultivated the Upper Dao to this point, the task is complete—no sound can contain it. Thus, it is recorded as the method of the Primordial Stem’s flying steps. Its subtleties are expounded in the *Pure Brightness* teachings; the Stem Diagram is presented below.

The Master says: The affairs of the Primordial Stem, when aligned within the body, pertain to the practices of whistling and chanting the Cavernous Chapters. Discussed in the scriptures, it is called the *Great Sovereign within the Mysterious*, culminating in the state of *Naturally Attaining Perfection and Abiding*. In essence, this is the scene of the Jade Clarity. The Jade Clarity is the Heaven above all heavens. Gazing upward, it is the Supreme; peering downward, it is the spirits of the sun, moon, five planets, and constellations, the emperors of the thirty-two heavens. This describes the assembly and audience before the High Perfected and Great Sovereign. The Great Sovereign resides in the Cavern Chamber, surrounded by the thirty-two heavens in array, encircled by the twenty-eight lunar lodges, with the sun, moon, and five planets standing in attendance—truly the court of the Great Existence.

Seeking this within the human body: the head is the Upper Heaven. The space between the eyebrows is the dwelling of the High Perfected and Great Sovereign. The floating radiance of the Great Auroras is the light within the eyes. Whistling and savoring the Cavernous Chapters are the breath entering and exiting the nose and mouth. The Metal Perfected corresponds to the nose. The flowing resonance of cloud formations and the jade tones that gather qi are the breath of the nose and mouth, their harmonics thus. The Purple Void is the space between the eyebrows. Assisting the myriad immortals, uniting the thousand harmonies and myriad unions, are the ears, eyes, and nose. Without reckless ingress or egress, true youths and children abide within. Their voices harmonize with the celestial sounds, resonating with the Cavernous Chapters. The balanced qi of central rectitude divides, and by its tone, one summons the harmonious qi to emerge, forming the incantation for spreading qi and sprinkling water.

The Master says: The Lord of Longevity is the true star of fire, the qi of the Great Sovereign within the Mysterious. Wu Ying, the Venerable Youth, and Bai Yuan, the White Prime, are the spirit-stars of metal and wood. The Supreme Unity Controller of Destiny is the honorific of water. Peach Prosperity and Union Court are the true emperors of earth. Verified through the Cavern Chamber’s immortal arts, secular texts differ in their discussions. Now, rectifying the original method and exhaustively pursuing its essential purport, we establish the *Cavern Chamber Method*.

**Method for Sprinkling Water and Spreading Qi**
For all incantations of water and spreading of qi: visualize the Great Sovereign within the Mysterious, clad in Upper Clarity robes, holding a green jade tablet, seated upon a lion throne. To his left stands the Lord of Longevity, to his right the Supreme Unity Controller of Destiny, both dressed in Upper Clarity robes and holding jade scepters in attendance. His form is the size of a jujube, located between the eyebrows, one inch square, resembling a golden palace pavilion, radiant with light like blue-red lapis lazuli illuminating water. When spreading qi, visualize the afflicted person and recite the incantation from the *Great Sovereign within the Mysterious* to *Naturally Attaining Perfection and Abiding*, nine times in total, contemplating the ears and eyes. From the nose, hear the immortal music of the Cavernous Chapters and the *Steps in Void* melody. When incanting water, blow qi into the water nine times. When spreading qi over the afflicted, blow nine breaths. If the spreading of qi proves ineffective, repeat the visualization and blowing three more times before ceasing.

**Cavern Chamber Method for Cultivating Perfection**
For all who cultivate perfection in the Cavern Chamber: this is also the essential method of *Three Guarding One*. At any time of day, sit in stillness and visualize the Great Sovereign within the Mysterious, clad in Upper Clarity robes, holding a green jade scepter, seated upon a lion throne. The Lord of Longevity stands to his left, the Supreme Unity Controller of Destiny to his right; Wu Ying to the left, Bai Yuan to the right; Peach Prosperity to the left, Peach Child to the right. The Lord of Longevity is fire. Fire transmits the kitchen without cease, hence it is called Longevity—the heart. The Supreme Unity is the spirit of the Gate of Destiny, hence the Controller of Destiny. Wu Ying is the spirit of the liver. Bai Yuan is the spirit of the lungs. Peach Prosperity and Union Court are the spirits of earth. Things entering earth decompose and generate, hence their spirits are two. These spirits reside in the navel, the root of life, as earth is the root of the Five Phases. To consider them as kidney spirits is incorrect. The kidneys are water, which is known through earth. Thus, when visualizing the kidneys, one also contemplates the two peaches. In visualization, proceed step by step: from their original palaces, each dons Upper Clarity robes woven with golden threads and auroral hues, attending the Central Venerable. The Great Sovereign resides between the eyebrows, clearly and distinctly. Within the inch between the brows lies the vast palace. The subtle incantation says: *"Within the true, the spirit abides; the myriad qi unite with the immortals."* Recite this eighty-one times, taking one breath per recitation. Next, visualize one’s own hun-soul clad in crimson silk, wearing a *Far-Wandering* crown, paying audience to the High Venerable Great Sovereign, sitting opposite him, with the host of perfected in attendance as before. Recite the previous incantation nine times, swallowing saliva eighty-one times before ceasing.

**Chapter Three: The Spirit Sprouts**
The Master says: The scriptures derive from the Brahman qi, their words encompassing myriad principles, all elucidating the Brahman qi’s distribution and the generation of numinous excellence. Thus, one knows that the red-script characters coalesce into the Five Sprouts. In heaven, they are the essences of the Five Emperors; in humans, the excellence of the five viscera. Governing the Five Qi at their center is to stabilize and pacify the One. Therefore, in cultivating the Cavern Chamber, practicing the Primordial Stem, spreading the spirit-qi, and ingesting the Five Sprouts, one employs the method of visualizing and consuming the generative qi.

**Method for Ingesting the Five Sprouts**
The Master says: The Nine Qi Azure Heaven, the Three Qi Cinnabar Heaven, the Central Yellow Heaven, the Seven Qi White Heaven, and the Five Qi Mysterious Heaven each possess the Five Emperors and Five Numinous Youths. The Azure Numinous Youth of the East oversees the books of the Pure Emperor, his name is Kai Yang, nine inches tall, clad in kingfisher-feather robes, holding a green banner, attending the left of the scripture.

chunks.original_text: 南方赤灵之童，典赤帝之书，讳丹珠，长三寸，赤羽衣，执赤节，侍文前。 中央黄灵之童，典黄帝之书，讳红瑛，长一寸二分，黄羽衣，执黄钺，侍文中央。 西方白灵之童，典白帝之书，讳明石，长七寸，素羽衣，执白旗，侍文右。 北方黑灵之童，典黑帝之书，讳玉滋，长五寸，黑羽衣，执黑幢，侍文后。 学者思此五童，降己身百日，及佩真文百日。 其神居五藏之中，为致五芽之精。 常以立春之日，鸡呜入室，东向九拜，平坐，叩齿九通，思青帝字灵威，长九寸，冠青玉冠，衣九炁青羽飞衣，驾苍龙玉舆，建鸮旗，从甲乙始老之官九十万人来降。 须臾，化生青炁，如云贯覆己形，从己口直入下肝腑。 又思木星焕明在东方，照己身，便开目，念咒九遍，吞东方真文十二字。 又常以立夏日，鸡呜入室，南向三拜，平坐，叩齿三通，思赤帝字飘弩，长二寸，冠赤玉冠，衣三炁丹羽飞衣，驾丹龙王舆，建采旗，从丙丁真老之官三十万人来降。 须臾，化生赤炁如火，贯覆己形，从己口入，直下心腑。 又思火星焕明在南方，照己身，便开目，念咒三遍，吞南方真文十二字。 又常以二分二至四日，鸡呜入室，向王十二拜，平坐，叩齿十二通，思黄帝字含枢纽，长一尺二寸，冠黄玉冠，衣五色羽衣，驾黄龙玉舆，建黄旗，从戊己元老之官十二万人来降。 须臾，化生黄炁如云，覆己身，从己口入，直下脾腑。 又思土星在天中，照我身，便开目，念咒十二遍，吞中央真文十六字。 常以立秋日，鸡呜入室，西向七拜，平坐，叩齿七通，思白帝字曜魄宝，长七寸，冠白玉冠，衣七炁白羽飞衣，驾白龙玉舆，建素旗，从庚辛皇老之官七十万人来降。 须臾，化生白炁如云，贯覆己身，从己口入直下肺腑。 又思金星焕明在西方照己身，便开目，念咒七遍，吞西方真文十二字。 又常以立冬日，鸡呜入室，北向五拜，平坐，叩齿五通，思炁帝字隐侯局，长五寸，冠玄玉冠，衣五炁玄羽飞衣，驾黑龙玉舆，建皂旗，从壬癸玄老之官五十万人来降。 须臾，化生黑炁如流星之光，贯覆己形，从己口入，直下肾腑。 又思水星焕明北方，照覆己身，便开目，念咒五遍，吞北方真文十二字。 东方咒曰 九炁青天，元始上精，皇老尊神，衣服羽青。 役御天官，焕明岁星。 散辉流芳，陶溉我形。 上餐明霞，服引木精。 固养青芽，保镇朽龄。 肝腑充溢，玉芝自生。 回年亿劫，色及童婴。 五炁和合，天地长并。 南方咒曰 三炁丹天，朱宫灵童。 元始上老，参驾赤龙。 丹羽飞衣，锦被明光。 驱策灵官，运导阴阳。 三炁吐辉，溉我绛宫。 赤子但镇，炼芽饰容。 朝餐朱景，玉芝满充。 回停劫年，朽骸反童。 长龄天地，永享无穷。 身生水火，断绝群凶。 中央咒曰 中黄太山，元炁徘徊。 上有皇老，总统四垂。 参驾黄龙，五色羽衣。 运导九天，轮转璇玑。 焕明七星，流光散辉。 玉英芳芝，充溢四飞。 陶溉我身，脾臃先开。 养芽餐精，万神总归。 检魂制魄，仙炼八威。 表裹洞明，长生不衰。 通真达灵，升入玄微。 西方咒曰 金灵七门，皓映西华。 中有素皇，元始之家。 参驾白龙，七炁峨峨。 徘徊玉门，散精朱霞。 金星吐辉，芳芝，玄奥我身，养我素芽。

The Vermilion Numinous Youth of the South oversees the books of the Vermilion Emperor, his name is Dan Zhu, three inches tall, clad in vermilion-feather robes, holding a vermilion staff, attending the front of the scripture. The Yellow Numinous Youth of the Center oversees the books of the Yellow Emperor, his name is Hong Ying, one inch and two fen tall, clad in yellow-feather robes, holding a yellow halberd, attending the center of the scripture. The White Numinous Youth of the West oversees the books of the White Emperor, his name is Ming Shi, seven inches tall, clad in plain-feather robes, holding a white banner, attending the right of the scripture. The Black Numinous Youth of the North oversees the books of the Black Emperor, his name is Yu Zi, five inches tall, clad in black-feather robes, holding a black standard, attending the rear of the scripture.

The practitioner visualizes these Five Numinous Youths descending into their body for a hundred days, and wears the true scripture for a hundred days. Their spirits reside within the five viscera, bringing forth the essence of the Five Sprouts.

On the day of *Lichun* (Beginning of Spring), at cock’s crow, enter the chamber, face east and bow nine times, sit upright, and click the teeth nine times. Visualize the Azure Emperor, whose name is Ling Wei, nine inches tall, wearing a crown of azure jade and a flying robe of nine-qi azure feathers, riding a jade chariot drawn by green dragons, bearing an owl banner, followed by ninety myriad officials of *jiǎ-yǐ* and the Elder of Beginnings descending. In an instant, generative azure qi transforms, like clouds enveloping one’s form, entering directly through the mouth into the liver viscera. Then visualize Jupiter gleaming brightly in the east, illuminating one’s body. Open the eyes, recite the incantation nine times, and swallow the twelve true characters of the Eastern scripture.

On the day of *Lixia* (Beginning of Summer), at cock’s crow, enter the chamber, face south and bow three times, sit upright, and click the teeth three times. Visualize the Vermilion Emperor, whose name is Piao Nu, two inches tall, wearing a crown of vermilion jade and a flying robe of three-qi cinnabar feathers, riding a jade chariot drawn by vermilion dragons, bearing a multicolored banner, followed by thirty myriad officials of *bǐng-dīng* and the True Elder descending. In an instant, generative vermilion qi transforms like fire, enveloping one’s form, entering through the mouth directly into the heart viscera. Then visualize Mars gleaming brightly in the south, illuminating one’s body. Open the eyes, recite the incantation three times, and swallow the twelve true characters of the Southern scripture.

On the four days of the equinoxes and solstices, at cock’s crow, enter the chamber, face the center and bow twelve times, sit upright, and click the teeth twelve times. Visualize the Yellow Emperor, whose name is Han Shu Niu, one foot and two inches tall, wearing a crown of yellow jade and a five-colored feathered robe, riding a jade chariot drawn by yellow dragons, bearing a yellow banner, followed by twelve myriad officials of *wù-jǐ* and the Primordial Elder descending. In an instant, generative yellow qi transforms like clouds, enveloping one’s body, entering through the mouth directly into the spleen viscera. Then visualize Saturn at the center of the heavens, illuminating one’s body. Open the eyes, recite the incantation twelve times, and swallow the sixteen true characters of the Central scripture.

On the day of *Liqiu* (Beginning of Autumn), at cock’s crow, enter the chamber, face west and bow seven times, sit upright, and click the teeth seven times. Visualize the White Emperor, whose name is Yao Po Bao, seven inches tall, wearing a crown of white jade and a flying robe of seven-qi white feathers, riding a jade chariot drawn by white dragons, bearing a plain banner, followed by seventy myriad officials of *gēng-xīn* and the August Elder descending. On the day of *Lidong* (Beginning of Winter), at cock’s crow, enter the chamber, face north and bow five times, sit upright, and click the teeth five times. chunks.original_text: 明右鲜光，万劫不俱。 服以流泉，餐以太和。 九天上帝，给以玉华。 保年驻颜，白景敷罗。 长存天地，三光同遐。 北方咒曰 北方玄天，五炁散灵。 上有大神，始老元精。 驾龙建旗，游宴上京。 是日元吉，庆云敷荣。 飞芝流洒，滂沱四盈。 玉女玄奥，溉我身形。 肾宫充镇，朽芽重生。 五府纳真，上通神明。 五老降接，仙道早成。 变化水火，衣服羽青。 飞行太空，游造紫庭。 寿同三景，万劫遐龄。 右咒毕，各依方数咽津止，便服字。 诸常服字，则以鸡呜阳光始分，东向叩齿如其方数，摩两掌拭面目如其方数。 咒呢，自束方起，至北方终，为一周。 东方青芽云：服食青芽，饮以朝华。 毕，便以舌撩上齿之裹，舐唇三过，令玉泉满口，而咽之三过。 又引青炁九咽，令镇肝中。 南方朱丹云：服食朱丹，饮以池华。 以舌撩下齿表，舐唇漱口，令玉芝满口，而三咽之。 又引赤炁三咽，令镇心中。 中央戊己云：昂昂太山，服食精气，饮以醴泉。 毕，以舌撩上齿，取玉泉，舐唇而三咽之。 又引黄炁十二咽，令镇脾中。 西方明石云：服食明石，饮以灵液。 毕，以舌撩上齿，漱口，令玉芝满口，而三咽之。 又引白炁七咽，令镇肺中。 北方玄滋云：服食玄滋，饮以玉饴。 毕，以舌撩下齿内，舐唇漱口，满而咽之。 又引黑炁五咽，令镇肾中。 右毕，叩齿三十六通，咽炁二十五过止。 又都咒曰：白石岩岩，以次行源，泉通涌洞，灌以玉浆，饮之长生，寿命益长。 毕，以舌撩口上下中央，令玉芝满口，而三咽之。 其道都毕。 东方真文

Bright shines the radiance to the right,
Through ten thousand kalpas unending.
Drink the flowing springs,
Feast upon Great Harmony.
The Nine Heavens’ Lord Emperor
Bestows jade blossoms.
Preserving years and halting age,
White light unfurls in array.
Abiding with heaven and earth,
The Three Luminaries share their distant span.

**Northern Incantation**
Dark is the Northern Heavens,
Five qi scatter their numinosity.
Above dwells the Great Spirit,
Primordial Elder of Original Essence.
Dragon-drawn banners raised,
Roaming the Upper Capital.
This day is supremely auspicious,
Auspicious clouds spread their glory.
Flying mushrooms stream and scatter,
Abundant and overflowing in all four directions.
Jade maidens of mysterious profundity
Irrigate my body’s form.
The kidney palace fills and steadies,
Withered sprouts revive anew.
The Five Palaces receive the true,
Upward connecting with the divine.
The Five Elders descend to greet,
The immortal Dao swiftly accomplished.
Transforming water and fire,
Robes of feathered azure.
Soaring through the Great Void,
Wandering to the Purple Court.
Lifespan equal to the Three Luminaries,
Through ten thousand kalpas of distant years.

The incantation complete, swallow saliva according to each direction’s number and cease.
To regularly practice the method: at cock’s crow when yang light first divides, face east and knock the teeth the number of times corresponding to the direction. Rub the palms together and wipe the face and eyes the same number of times.
Recite the incantations beginning in the east and ending in the north, completing one cycle.

**Eastern Green Sprout** states:
Consume the Green Sprout,
Drink the morning’s blossom.
Afterward, with the tongue stroke the inner side of the upper teeth, lick the lips three times, allowing jade spring to fill the mouth, then swallow three times.
Draw in green qi nine times, allowing it to settle in the liver.

**Southern Vermilion Elixir** states:
Consume the Vermilion Elixir,
Drink the pool’s blossom.
With the tongue stroke the outer side of the lower teeth, lick the lips and rinse the mouth, allowing jade mushroom to fill the mouth, then swallow three times.
Draw in red qi three times, allowing it to settle in the heart.

**Central Earth** states:
Lofty and towering, Mount Tai,
Consume the essence and qi,
Drink the sweet spring.
Afterward, with the tongue stroke the upper teeth, gather jade spring, lick the lips, and swallow three times.
Draw in yellow qi twelve times, allowing it to settle in the spleen.

**Western Bright Stone** states:
Consume the Bright Stone,
Drink the numinous liquid.
Afterward, with the tongue stroke the upper teeth, rinse the mouth, allowing jade mushroom to fill the mouth, then swallow three times.
Draw in white qi seven times, allowing it to settle in the lungs.

**Northern Dark Nourishment** states:
Consume the Dark Nourishment,
Drink the jade nectar.
Afterward, with the tongue stroke the inner side of the lower teeth, lick the lips, rinse the mouth, fill it, and swallow.
Draw in black qi five times, allowing it to settle in the kidneys.

This complete, knock the teeth thirty-six times and swallow qi twenty-five times to cease.

**Final Incantation** states:
White stone, towering and sheer,
Proceed in order to the source.
Springs surge and flow through caverns,
Irrigated with jade nectar.
Drink and attain long life,
Lifespan ever lengthening.
Afterward, with the tongue stroke the upper, lower, and center of the mouth, allowing jade mushroom to fill the mouth, then swallow three times.
The method is now complete.

**Eastern True Writ**

chunks.original_text: 南方真文 中央真文 西方真文 北方真文 仁济章第四 仙道贵生，无量度人。 上开八门，飞天法轮。 罪福禁戒，宿命因缘。 普受开度，死魂生身。 身得受生，上闻诸天。 诸天之上，各有生门。 中有空洞，谣歌之音。 魔王灵篇，辞参高真。 师曰：此唾易修摩也。 其神常集於泥丸之上，在人头，常为人呼集魂魄真神，有沦丧数未尽者，皆救。 其名为法倧，兄弟三人，手执飞天法轮，此是三天魔王之子也。 其灵篇之辞在后，详其义，而为之洞章。 而唾易修摩符，出《净明经》也。 本章今别以为救世符禁之卫。 第一欲界飞空之音：人道渺渺，仙道莽莽。 鬼道乐兮，当人生门。 天道贵生，鬼道贵终。 仙道常自吉，鬼道常自凶。 师曰：此歌音可以断百邪。 凡人家素有妖魅，未欲驱捉，只令自此分散，不为祸患，则以此音治之。 掐酉文，念咒七遍，书符一道镇之，其怪永绝。 符文 右件，以五月五日造印之。 如有患狐魅，即令带之，其鬼自去。 高上清灵爽，悲朗太空。 唯愿仙道成，不欲人道穷。 北都泉曲府，中有万鬼群。 但欲遏人算，断绝人命门。 阿人歌洞章，以摄北罗酆。 束送妖魔精，斩馘六鬼锋。 诸天炁荡荡，我道日兴隆。 师曰：此歌音可以驱捉邪魅。 凡人家有精怪作称，遣之不去者，以此音。 掐酉，朱书真字一通，付所差官将擒之。 其文先以引札叙事，用此粘连巷前，或粘投词前。 如有印文，即掐诀，印粘之。 真文玉篆 第二色界魔王之章：落落高张，明炁四骞。 梵行诸天，周迥十方。 无量大神，皆由我身。 师曰：此歌音可以禳镇。 凡人家宅不宁，所谋不遂，身命逵蹇，可以用朱书符，贴佩。 书时念此咒七遍，又左手辰文。 符文 我有洞章，万徧成仙。 仙道贵度，鬼道必相连。 天地眇莽，秽炁氛氛。 三界乐兮，过之长存。 身度我界，体入自然。 此时乐兮，薄由我恩。 师曰：此歌音，可以解技冤滞，飞疰复连。 凡有此者，以桐木书符，念七遍，手掐巽，取东方炁一口，吹之。 书毕，却以再书写此一段，於其上四畔发出。 用朱书，亦可佩带，令人和合，所向如心也。 符文 右书讫，以字盖之，置於门上。 若解冢讼，则钉墓侧。 龙汉荡荡，何能别真。 我界难度，故作洞文。 变化飞空，以试尔身。 成败懈退，度者几人。 笑尔不度，故为歌音。 师曰：此歌音可以治类邪。 凡心病，不知所主者，以此咒符五伪，取午炁一口，书符，令患吞佩。 左右午文。 符文

**Chapter Four: The Benevolent Salvation**

The Dao of immortality values life, delivering boundless beings.
Above, the eight gates open, the celestial Dharma-wheel takes flight.
Karma and prohibitions, karmic causes from past lives—
Universally received and delivered, the dead soul revives in the body.
Once the body attains rebirth, it ascends to the heavens above.
Above the heavens, each has its gate of life.
Within lies the hollow void, the sound of chants and songs.
The *Lingpian* of demon-kings, its verses match the lofty perfected.
The master says: This saliva is easy to cultivate.
Its spirit constantly gathers above the *niwan*, within the human head,
Ever summoning the true spirits of hun and po for those whose allotted years have not yet run out—all are saved.
Its name is *Fazong*, three brothers, each wielding a celestial Dharma-wheel,
Sons of the demon-kings of the Three Heavens.
The verses of the *Lingpian* follow; their meaning is expounded to form the *Dongzhang*.
The *Tuoyi Xiumo* talisman comes from the *Pure Brightness Sutra*.
This chapter is now separately made into a talisman for worldly salvation and protection.

**First: The Sound of Flight in the Desire Realm**
The human Dao is vast and distant, the immortal Dao boundless and wild.
The ghostly Dao delights—yet it is the gate of human life.
The celestial Dao values life, the ghostly Dao values endings.
The immortal Dao is ever auspicious, the ghostly Dao ever inauspicious.
The master says: This song can sever all evil.
If a household has long harbored demons or spirits and one does not wish to drive them away but only to disperse them so they no longer cause harm,
Use this sound to govern them.
Press the *you* seal, recite the incantation seven times, inscribe one talisman to suppress them, and the specters will vanish forever.
**Talisman**
The above is to be carved into a seal on the fifth day of the fifth month.
If afflicted by fox spirits, have the person wear it, and the ghost will depart of its own accord.

**Lofty, pure, and numinous, resounding through the great void,**
I only wish the immortal Dao to succeed, not the human Dao to languish.
In the Northern Capital’s Winding Springs Prefecture, a myriad ghosts gather,
All seeking to cut short human fate, to sever the gate of life.
Ah! Sing the *Dongzhang* to subdue the Northern Fengdu.
Bind and send off demonic spirits, sever the blades of the six ghostly hordes.
The qi of the heavens surges boundlessly; my Dao daily flourishes.
The master says: This song can drive away and capture evil spirits.
If a household is troubled by malevolent spirits that refuse to leave,
Use this sound.
Press the *you* seal, write the true character in cinnabar once, and entrust it to the dispatched officer to apprehend them.
First, write an introductory note explaining the matter, then affix this to the front of the alley or attach it to a petition.
If there is a seal, press the seal and affix it.

**True Writ in Jade Script**
**Second: The Chapter of the Demon-Kings of the Form Realm**
Lofty and vast, the bright qi soars in all four directions.
The pure conduct of the Brahma heavens encircles the ten directions.
The boundless great spirits all arise from my body.
The master says: This song can ward off and suppress.
If a household is unsettled, plans go awry, or life is beset by misfortune,
Use cinnabar to write the talisman and wear it.
While writing, recite this incantation seven times, and press the *chen* seal with the left hand.
**Talisman**
I possess the *Dongzhang*, perfected ten thousand times to become immortal.
The immortal Dao values deliverance; the ghostly Dao must follow.
Heaven and earth are vast and dim, foul qi swirls thickly.
The three realms delight—pass through them and abide forever.
When the body crosses my realm, it enters spontaneity.
At this time, delight—all by my grace.
The master says: This song can resolve entanglements, flying curses, and lingering grudges.
For those afflicted, write the talisman on paulownia wood, recite it seven times, press the *xun* seal with the hand, draw in one mouthful of eastern qi, and blow upon it.
Once written, rewrite this passage on all four sides.
Write in cinnabar; it may also be worn to harmonize people and ensure success in all endeavors.
**Talisman**
Once written, cover it with the character and place it above the door.
To resolve grave disputes, drive it into the side of the tomb.

The Dragon-Han era surges boundlessly—how can truth be discerned?
My realm is hard to cross, so I compose the *Dongwen*.
Transform and fly through the void to test your body.
Success or failure, slackness or retreat—how many are delivered?
I laugh at those who fail to cross, so I sing this song.
The master says: This song can treat demonic afflictions.
For heart ailments with no apparent cause, use this incantation and talisman five times.
Draw in one mouthful of *wu* qi, write the talisman, and have the afflicted swallow or wear it.
Press the *wu* seal on both sides.
**Talisman**

White stone, towering and sheer,

chunks.original_text: 第三无色界魔王歌曰：三界之上，眇眇大罗。 上无色根，云历峨峨。 唯有元始，浩劫之家。 部制我界，统乘玄都。 有过我界，身入玉虚。 我位上王，匡御众魔。 师曰：此歌音可以佩带，百神稽首。 公私灾患，不及书符，即用此咒之。 左手寅文，咒三徧，取东西二方炁各一口。 书讫，朱写文封之，一边写，一边押字。 符文 空中万变，秽炁纷葩。 保真者少，迷惑者多。 仙道难固，鬼道易邪。 人道者心，谅不由他。 仙道贵实，人道贵华。 尔不乐仙道，三界那得过。 其欲转五道，我当复奈何。 师曰：此歌音乃遣鬼咒也。 凡有祖先为祸，不可摄罪者，以此音咒符一道，烧之。 书符时，再掐酉文。 符文 此三界之上，飞空之中。 魔王之音，音参洞章。 诵之百遍，名度南宫。 诵之千徧，魔王保迎。 万徧道备，飞升太空。 过度三界，位登仙公。 有闻灵音，魔王敬形。 师曰：此歌音真书，以封前所烧之符。 封符如简，上书此文。 勑制地祇，侍卫送迎。 拔出地户，五苦八难。 七祖升仙，永离鬼官。 魂度朱陵，受炼更生。 师曰：此章可以救沉滞。 凡有幽魂，则先烧遣鬼咒符，次焚符。 追度之时，其文当写如历关诸天，关子叙事意。 凡为弟子追度，则同历关诸天同为之。 以黄纸墨写符文 符文

**Third Song of the Formless Realm’s Demon King**

The Third Song of the Formless Realm’s Demon King says:
Above the Three Realms, vast and boundless is Great Luo.
Beyond the root of form, clouds tower in layered majesty.
Only the Primordial Beginning dwells in the kalpas’ abode.
It governs my realm, ruling over the Mysterious Capital.
Those who transgress my domain enter the Jade Void.
I, the supreme king, command and govern the demon hosts.

The master says: This song may be worn as an amulet—all spirits bow in reverence. For public or private calamities, if no talisman is inscribed, recite this incantation instead. Press the *yin* seal with the left hand, chant the spell thrice, and draw one mouthful of *qi* from the east and west. When the writing is complete, seal it in red, inscribing and pressing the characters on both sides.

**Talisman**

In the void, ten thousand transformations swirl—filth and *qi* bloom in profusion.
Those who preserve the truth are few; the deluded are many.
The Dao of immortality is hard to secure; the demonic path strays easily.
The human path lies in the heart—truly, it does not depend on others.
The immortal Dao values substance; the human path values splendor.
If you do not delight in the immortal Dao, how can you pass the Three Realms?
Should you wish to traverse the Five Paths, what can I do for you?

The master says: This song is an exorcism incantation. For ancestral spirits causing harm—when their transgressions cannot be restrained—inscribe this talisman with the song, then burn it. While writing the talisman, press the *you* seal again.

**Talisman**

Above the Three Realms, within the flying void,
the Demon King’s song interweaves with the cavern’s verses.
Recite it a hundred times, and your name enters the Southern Palace.
Recite it a thousand times, and the Demon King escorts you.
Ten thousand recitations perfect the Dao—ascend to the great void.
Cross the Three Realms, and your rank becomes that of an immortal lord.
Those who hear this numinous song, the Demon King honors in form.

The master says: Inscribe this song in its true form to seal the previously burned talisman. Bind the talisman like a letter, writing this text upon it:
*"By decree, the earth spirits are restrained; attendants escort and receive.
Draw forth from the earth’s gate, deliver from the Five Sufferings and Eight Hardships.
Seven generations of ancestors ascend as immortals, forever freed from the ghostly bureaus.
The soul crosses the Crimson Mound, undergoes refinement, and is reborn."*

The master says: This chapter can rescue those mired in stagnation. For lost souls, first burn the exorcism talisman, then the sealing talisman. When summoning and delivering them, inscribe the text as a celestial pass, detailing the matter in the pass’s preface. For disciples performing deliverance, proceed as with the celestial passes. Write the talisman in ink on yellow paper.

**Talisman**

chunks.original_text: 太上灵宝净明飞仙度人经法卷四竟 太上灵宝净明飞仙度人经法卷五 高明大使神功妙济真君许旌阳释 秘藏章第一 是谓无量，普度无穷。 有秘上天文，诸天共所崇。 泄慢堕地狱，祸及七祖翁。 师曰：此是元始说经，不可轻易，皆上天秘宝，泄慢则招祸。 故神仙学道，以秘之。 今为收法文咒，凡收秘文，则以左手恰午，勒入向下，念此咒，则其法通灵，所在神护，镇宅安家也。 着例章第二 道言：此二章，并是诸天上帝及至灵魔王隐秘之音，皆是大梵之言，非世上常辞。 言无韵丽，曲无华宛，故谓玄奥，难可寻详。 上天所宝，秘於玄都紫微上宫。 依玄科，四万劫一传。 若有至人，宝金宝质心，依旧格告盟十天，然后而付焉。 道言：夫天地运度，亦有否终。 日月五星，亦有亏盈。 至圣神人，亦有休否。 末学之夫，亦有疾伤。 凡有此灾，同炁皆当齐心修斋，六时行香，十徧转经。 福德立降，消诸不详。 无量之文，普度无穷。 道言：夫末学道浅，或仙品未充，运应灭度，身经太阴。 临过之时，同学至人为其行香，诵经十过，以度尸形如法，魂神径上南宫，随其学功，计日而得更生，转输不灭，便得神仙。 道言：夫天地运终，亦当修斋，行香诵经。 星宿错度，日月失昏，亦当修斋，行香诵经。 四时失度，阴阳不调，亦当修斋，行香诵经。 国主有灾，兵革四兴，亦当修斋，行香诵经。 疫毒流行，兆民死伤，亦当修斋，行香诵经。 师友命过，亦当修斋，行香诵经。 夫斋戒诵经，功德其重。 上消天灾，保镇帝王； 下禳毒害，以度兆民。 生死受赖，其福难胜。 故曰无量，普度天人。 道言：凡有是经，能为天地、帝主、兆民，行是功德。 有灾之日，发心修斋烧香，诵经十过，皆诸天记名，万神侍卫，右别至人，克得为圣君，金阙之臣。 诸天记人功过，毫分无失。 天中魔王，亦保举尔身。 得道者，乃当洞明是至言也。 师曰：此是元始说经，明其有经者，可以行事。 每件举而用，则表奏状牒，皆云准经格，言遵奉天尊诲约，推而行之，不敢别立外意。 今录一件以为式，谓如为同学灭度，诵经修齐，则其辞文云准经格，道言至便得神仙，右某，伏为甲乙云云。 内音章第三 诸天中梵隐语无量音元始灵书中篇。 东方八天 亶娄阿苍，无恕观音。 须延明首，法揽菩昙。 稼那阿奕，忽诃流吟。 华都曲丽，鲜菩育臻。 答落大梵，散烟庆云。 飞洒玉都，明魔上门。 无行上首，回跖流玄。 阿陆龙罗，四象吁员。 南方八天 南阎洞浮，玉眸诜诜。 梵形落空，九灵推前。 泽各菩台，绿罗大千。 眇莽九丑，韶遥缘遭。 云上九都，飞生自骞。 那育郁馥，摩罗法轮。 霐持无镜，揽姿运容。 馥朗廓奕，神缨自宫。 西方八天 刀利禅猷，婆泥咎通。 宛薮涤色，太眇之堂。 流罗梵萌，景蔚萧嵎。 易邈无寂，宛首少都。 阿鉴郁竺，华莫延由。 九开自辨，阿那品首。 无量扶盖，浮罗合神。 玉诞长桑，栢空度仙。 北方八天 玃无自育，九日导乾。 坤母东覆，形摄上玄。 陀罗育邈，眇炁合云。 飞天大丑，总监上天。 沙陀劫量，龙汉瑛鲜。 碧落浮黎，空歌保珍。 恶奕无品，洞妙自真。 元梵恢漠，幽寂度人。 师曰：天书玉字，凝飞玄之炁，启运数之期，八会而成音，五合而成章，焕乎诸天，曜於太幽，与龙汉、赤明而俱化，炼水火於五行之终，含金木於五行之始，兆开三景，分判二仪，立五岳，超生死，而振潜伏者，自然之文也。

*The Upper Chapters of the Numinous Treasure Pure Clarity Flying Immortals Scripture for Delivering Humanity, Scroll Four Concludes*

*The Upper Chapters of the Numinous Treasure Pure Clarity Flying Immortals Scripture for Delivering Humanity, Scroll Five*

*Revealed by the Most High, the Illustrious Great Envoy, the Perfected Lord of Divine Merit and Wondrous Salvation, Xu Jingyang*

**First Chapter: The Secret Treasury**
This is called the Boundless, universally delivering the inexhaustible.
There are secret celestial texts, revered by all heavens.
To leak or slight them is to fall into hell, bringing calamity upon seven generations of ancestors.

The master says: This is the Scripture spoken by the Primordial Beginning; it must not be treated lightly. All are the heavens’ secret treasures—leakage or disdain invites disaster. Thus, those who study the Dao as immortals guard them in secrecy.

Now, for the method of gathering and sealing the scriptural texts: When collecting secret texts, press the left hand at the *wu* position, drawing inward and downward while reciting this incantation. Then the method becomes numinous, spirits protect wherever one is, and the household is secured and at peace.

**Second Chapter: The Model Precedents**
The Dao says: These two chapters are the hidden sounds of the Celestial Thearchs and the Kings of the Numinous Demons—all are the words of the Great Brahma, not common speech of the mundane world. Their language lacks ornate rhythm, their melodies lack florid embellishment; thus, they are called profound and obscure, difficult to fathom in detail.

The heavens treasure them, secreting them in the Purple Tenuity Palace of the Mystic Metropolis. According to the Mystic Regulations, they are transmitted but once every forty thousand kalpas. If there is a perfected person whose heart is as precious as gold and jade, they must follow the old protocols, pledging an oath before the Ten Heavens, and only then are they entrusted with them.

The Dao says: The revolutions of heaven and earth also have their ends. The sun, moon, and five planets also wax and wane. Even the most sagely and divine persons have their times of rest and decline. Those of shallow learning also suffer illness and harm. When such disasters occur, all of like *qi* should unite in mind to perform purification rites, offer incense in the six periods, and recite the scripture ten times. Blessings and virtue will descend at once, dissolving all inauspiciousness.

The boundless text universally delivers the inexhaustible.

The Dao says: Those of shallow Daoist learning, whose immortal rank is not yet full, when their destined time of passing arrives and their bodies enter the Great Yin, at the moment of their departure, their fellow perfected students should offer incense on their behalf, recite the scripture ten times, and deliver the corpse according to the method. Then the soul will ascend directly to the Southern Palace, and according to the merit of their studies, after a calculated number of days, they will attain rebirth, transcend transmigration, and become immortals.

The Dao says: When the revolutions of heaven and earth reach their end, one should perform purification rites, offer incense, and recite the scripture. When the stellar lodges are misaligned and the sun and moon lose their proper times, one should perform purification rites, offer incense, and recite the scripture. When the four seasons lose their order and yin and yang are unbalanced, one should perform purification rites, offer incense, and recite the scripture. When the sovereign faces disaster and warfare arises on all sides, one should perform purification rites, offer incense, and recite the scripture. When pestilence spreads and the multitudes suffer death and injury, one should perform purification rites, offer incense, and recite the scripture. When masters or fellow students pass away, one should perform purification rites, offer incense, and recite the scripture.

The merit of purification rites and scripture recitation is weighty. Above, it dissolves celestial disasters and secures the emperor; below, it wards off poison and harm, delivering the multitudes. In life and death, all rely upon it—its blessings are beyond measure. Thus, it is called the Boundless, universally delivering gods and humans.

The Dao says: Whoever possesses this scripture and performs these meritorious deeds for heaven and earth, the sovereign, and the multitudes—on days of disaster, if they resolve to perform purification rites, burn incense, and recite the scripture ten times—all the heavens will record their names, myriad spirits will attend and protect them, and those of exceptional attainment will become sagely lords and ministers of the Golden Towers. The heavens record the merits and transgressions of people without the slightest error. Even the Demon Kings of Heaven will safeguard and recommend them. Those who attain the Dao will thoroughly comprehend these ultimate words.

The master says: This is the Scripture spoken by the Primordial Beginning. It clarifies that those who possess the scripture may act accordingly. For each matter undertaken, the memorials and documents should state: "In accordance with the scriptural protocols," declaring obedience to the Celestial Worthy’s instructions, and proceeding accordingly without daring to establish separate intentions.

Now, one example is recorded as a model: For instance, when performing scripture recitation and purification rites for a deceased fellow student, the text should state: "In accordance with the scriptural protocols, the Dao says that one may thereby attain immortality. The humble [name], respectfully submits this on behalf of [so-and-so]..."

**Third Chapter: The Inner Sounds**
The boundless sounds of the hidden Brahmanic language within the scriptures of the myriad heavens, from the *Central Chapter of the Numinous Writings of the Primordial Beginning*.

chunks.original_text: 如能以每月初三日，初五日、初九、十五、十二五日，各清斋诵咏龟山丹皇飞玄紫文，以次而思存诵咏，则当名书九天，魔王保举，九玄七祖，皆被福荫。 诵咏之妙法详矣。 今再取其便而易行，使当思咏而不忘者，着于后。 东方 常当叩齿九通，思九色之龙居左，青云九重，覆匝身形。 密咒曰： 赤明开图，九炁回真。 总统玄关，青帝大神。 流化九外，缠绵我身。 灵音八书，六十四篇。 洞明天地，与我合仙。 运致龙驾，上升帝辕。 毕，引炁九咽止。 南方 常当叩齿三通，存朱雀、凤凰翔于前，绛云三重，覆匝身形。 咒曰：三炁徘徊，灵凤来飞。 玉音八字，焕烂紫微。 吉日大庆，我道洞开。 朱丹哺饴，仰吸灵晖。 身生水火，绛破羽衣。 登空步虚，足蹑丹梯。 周旋八天，七祖相随。 毕，引炁二咽止。 西方 常当叩齿七通，存白虎、狮子居右，素云七重，覆匝身形。 密咒曰： 七炁金灵，八天尊神。 白虎策辇，狮子捧辕。 七炁缠绵，炼我成仙。 身发金光，映明素灵。 内外变化，升入金门。 七祖出夜，九幽开魂。 三涂五业，长斩恶根。 同灌福舍，受庆自然。 亿劫开度，随运长存。 毕，引炁七咽止。 北方 常当叩齿五通，思羽盖，玄武从于后，玄云五重，覆匝身形。 咒曰： 元天徘徊，流景上清。 大道启运，八字开明。 飞天澄空，洞音日生。 五炁缠绵，灌我身形。 冠带北单，今日受炼。 洞灵肾府，内外光精。 飞行三界，游宴紫庭。 七祖同庆，欢乐劫龄。 七宝林中，反胎更形。 长夜出离，南宫纪名。 黄箓白简，削死上生。 毕，引炁五咽止。 师曰：有能以黄缯为地，书其真文佩带，而常存念前章，则身应玄谱，九祖升仙。 其佩文之法，已见於升天券矣。 今有服字等法，叙于后，为玉字章。 玉字章第四 师曰：灵书玉字，妙体自然，其炁分出於九梵，其开明见於后。 所以取之者有义，别之者有体。 是以服之者，皆其炁之所受，养之以和，而政仙录。 爰自炁出为字，字散为符，离合出於玄微，旨义本於深奥。 天真皇人，记之以为上篆； 道君天尊，合之以为歌音； 王母译之，以授汉武。 自汉武之后，译而为道体飞篆，今载於灵宝法者，皆西王母所以示汉武之音字也。 若夫用之以为篆符，延生保命，救治弥灾，则必取诸旧本。 吾今以旧本参於仙房者，得其妙旨而明之。 其字其符，其服食之日月，其用度之意义，庶几有补於高人。 玉字真文，出升天券中，此不复叙。 真符章第五 东方

On the third, fifth, ninth, fifteenth, and twenty-fifth days of each month, should one purify oneself in fasting and recite the *Fei Xuan Zi Wen* of Guishan’s Cinnabar Sovereign, contemplating and intoning it in sequence, then one’s name shall be inscribed in the Nine Heavens, demon-kings shall safeguard one’s ascent, and the ninefold ancestors and sevenfold forebears shall all receive blessings and shade. The subtleties of recitation and intonation are manifold. Here, we extract what is convenient and easy to practice, ensuring that contemplation and intonation remain unbroken, as set forth below.

**East**
Knock the teeth nine times. Envision nine-colored dragons dwelling to the left, with nine layers of azure clouds enveloping the body. The secret incantation reads:
*"Red Brightness unfolds the chart, ninefold *qi* returns to truth.
Mastering the Mysterious Pass, Azure Emperor, great spirit.
Flowing transformations beyond the nine realms entwine my form.
Sacred sounds of eight scriptures, sixty-four chapters.
Illuminating heaven and earth, merging with me in transcendence.
Conveying the dragon-chariot, ascending to the imperial axis."*
Conclude by drawing in *qi* and swallowing nine times.

**South**
Knock the teeth three times. Envision the Vermilion Bird and phoenix soaring before you, with three layers of crimson clouds enveloping the body. The incantation reads:
*"Threefold *qi* lingers, sacred phoenix takes flight.
Jade sounds of eight characters, resplendent in the Purple Tenuity.
Auspicious day, great celebration—my Dao unfolds in radiance.
Crimson cinnabar nourishes, I gaze upward to absorb the numinous brilliance.
Body generates water and fire, crimson shatters the feathered robe.
Ascending emptiness, treading the void, feet climb the cinnabar ladder.
Circling the eight heavens, seven ancestors follow in tow."*
Conclude by drawing in *qi* and swallowing twice.

**West**
Knock the teeth seven times. Envision the White Tiger and lion dwelling to the right, with seven layers of white clouds enveloping the body. The secret incantation reads:
*"Sevenfold *qi* of golden numen, eight heavens’ honored spirits.
White Tiger steers the chariot, lion bears the shaft.
Sevenfold *qi* entwines, refining me into immortality.
Body emits golden light, illuminating the white numen.
Inner and outer transformations, ascending into the Golden Gate.
Seven ancestors emerge from night, nine depths awaken souls.
Three paths and five karmas—sever the roots of evil forever.
Together we bathe in the abode of blessings, receiving joy by nature.
For kalpas unbound, following destiny, we endure eternally."*
Conclude by drawing in *qi* and swallowing seven times.

**North**
Knock the teeth five times. Envision the feathered canopy and Dark Warrior following behind, with five layers of black clouds enveloping the body. The incantation reads:
*"Primal Heaven lingers, flowing radiance ascends to the Upper Clarity.
Great Dao inaugurates destiny, eight characters reveal illumination.
Flying heavens clarify the void, cavernous sounds arise daily.
Fivefold *qi* entwines, bathing my form.
Crowned and girded in the Northern Unitary, today I receive refinement.
Illuminating the numinous kidney-palace, inner and outer radiance.
Soaring through the Three Realms, roaming and feasting in the Purple Court.
Seven ancestors rejoice together, delighting in kalpic ages.
Within the Forest of Seven Treasures, reborn with transformed form.
Emerging from eternal night, names recorded in the Southern Palace.
Yellow registers and white tallies—erasing death, inscribing life."*
Conclude by drawing in *qi* and swallowing five times.

The master says: Should one inscribe the true script on yellow silk, wear it, and constantly contemplate the preceding chapters, then the body shall accord with the mysterious register, and ninefold ancestors shall ascend as immortals. The method of wearing the script has already been expounded in the *Ascension Charter*. Here, further methods of ingesting characters and the like are set forth below, forming the *Jade Characters Chapter*.

**Jade Characters Chapter IV**
The master says: The numinous script of jade characters embodies the marvel of nature. Its *qi* emerges from the Nine Brahmās, its illumination revealed in what follows. Thus, the selection of these characters holds meaning, and their differentiation possesses form. Those who ingest them receive the *qi* they bear, nurturing harmony to govern the immortal records. From *qi* issuing forth as characters, characters dispersing as talismans, their separation and union arise from the mysterious and subtle, their purport and meaning rooted in profound obscurity. The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign recorded them as the supreme seal-script; the Dao Lord Heavenly Worthy harmonized them into song; the Queen Mother of the West translated them to instruct Emperor Wu of Han. After Emperor Wu, they were rendered into the flying seal-script of the Dao’s essence, and what is now preserved in the *Lingbao* methods are the sounds and characters the Queen Mother of the West revealed to Emperor Wu. Should one employ them as seal-script and talismans to prolong life, preserve destiny, and remedy calamities, one must draw from the ancient texts. Here, I have compared the ancient texts with those in the immortal chambers, grasping their subtle purport to elucidate them. Their characters, their talismans, the days and months of their ingestion, and the significance of their application—may these serve to aid the noble adept. The true script of jade characters emerges from the *Ascension Charter*; it shall not be reiterated here.

**True Talismans Chapter V**
**East**...

**Chapter VI: Ingesting the Characters**
The Master said: All who study the Dao must grasp its purport, its meaning, and its sequence.

What is meant by grasping its purport? To perceive without delusion, to apply with response, to trust and practice it.

What is meant by grasping its meaning? To base oneself on what is unerring, to seek with reason, to penetrate and awaken to it.

What is meant by grasping its sequence? To employ it with order, to keep it simple yet not cumbersome, to practice it with ease—then natural attainment will follow. How much more so for those with jade-like bearing and golden resolve, who diligently ponder and recite, not treating it as a hasty inquiry?

Now, according to the days and months, I have compiled their use for the entire year, and the work of ingesting the characters is complete. Combined with dispatching spirits, cultivation, ingesting sprouts, and guarding the center, each has its appointed days. Within a single year, this requires but a few days, and when practiced together, the initial effort of vigorous practice—whether to aid the ruler, benefit the people, serve one’s parents, or govern one’s household—is grounded in action, supplemented by merit, and assisted by divine illumination. Its transcendence is beyond measure.

chunks.original_text: 服之，朱宫书名，飞天同功。 恰午。 无品洞妙自真， 出南阳上宫紫轩。 主勋。 服之，识前身，生死超度。 恰午。 元梵恢漠， 出玉清上宫太极之台。 主虚无自然，生真识，知微之几。 服之，则慧智。 恰午。 幽寂度人， 出北阙玄牝之户。 主六府受真体，生光明。 服之，则上游大罗。 恰乾。 自然章第八 师曰：道之为妙，大无不包，小无或遗。 以文纵横倒直，或离或散，无不当其用。 元始中篇玉字，出乎大梵之炁。 分之而为字，合之而为声，妙之而为符，约之而为咒。 於西汉灵宝之书，则有飞篆散殊之体，皆因经言，所以济用。 吾今飞仙度人之法，本於旧载，参於仙房，以增以除，以证灵宝之法，贯通不遗。 今略取灵宝一二所载，以辩其为同。 一者，五帝大魔，本以荐幽滞。 而灵宝则为破坛伐庙，治狂邪武勇之神，可召而任，以护助微劣法子流浪之义。 二者，东方八天，本以四篇皆为升天券。 而灵宝，止取一天者，取东方生炁也。 三者，南方八天，本止可以祈晴於至阳之地。 而灵宝又以祈雨用之，又以持字为使龙之符也。 四者，华莫延由，本治恶梦。 而灵宝取以止盗鬼贼，与之为性一也。 五者，形摄上玄，本禁水之符也。 而灵宝取以止怪兽与水怪，皆阴类也。 六者，总监上天，本主炁之字也。 而灵宝取以止怪、养子难，以贴於堂奥，来生炁也。 凡六者，皆灵宝法与度人有异处。 求其离合之自然，则一也。 复命章第九 道言：此诸天中大梵隐语无量之音，旧文字皆广长一丈。 天真皇人昔书其文，以为正音。 有知其音，能斋而诵之者，诸天皆遣飞天神王，下观其身，书其功勤，上奏诸天，万神朝礼，地祇侍门，大勋魔王，保举上仙。 道备克得游行三界，升入金门。 师曰：此乃本经，叙书所出之因也。 如能观此而悟，则勉而不忘也。 此音无所不辟，无所不禳，无所不度，无所不成，天真自然之音也。 故诵之致飞天下观，上帝遥唱，万神朝礼，三界侍轩，群妖束首，鬼精自亡。 琳琅振响，十方肃清，河海静默，山岳吞烟，万灵振伏，招集群仙。 天无氛秽，地无妖尘，冥慧洞清，大量玄玄也。 师曰：此乃诵洞章法也。 夫存思之道，贵乎绝念。 诚知天中自然之音，能使飞天下观，则必以真而应，则不妄观。 唯知琳琅振响，而诵咏味之，十方肃清，无外浊也，河海静默，无妄动也，山岳吞烟，无妄泄也，万灵振伏，无妄害也，招集群仙，无妄专也。 如此则天地性心，廓然而已。 所以能冥慧洞清，大量玄玄也。 太上灵宝净明飞仙度人经法卷五竟

**Chapter Eight: Spontaneity**

The Master said: The Dao’s wondrousness encompasses all without omission, vast or minute. Through its patterns—whether vertical or horizontal, inverted or direct, dispersed or coalesced—none fail to serve their purpose.

The Primordial’s middle-section jade script emerges from the Great Brahma’s qi. Divided, it becomes characters; combined, it becomes sound; refined, it becomes talismans; condensed, it becomes incantations. In the Western Han’s *Numinous Treasure* texts, there are forms of flying seal-script and scattered graphs, all derived from the scriptures to serve their use.

My present method of flying immortals and delivering humankind is rooted in ancient records, augmented by the immortal chambers, with additions and omissions to verify the *Numinous Treasure* teachings, ensuring thorough transmission without loss. Here, I briefly select one or two examples from the *Numinous Treasure* to demonstrate their unity.

First, the Five Thearchs’ Great Demons were originally for recommending the stagnant and obscure. Yet in the *Numinous Treasure*, they become deities who break altars and topple temples, governing mad, evil, martial, and valiant spirits—summonable and employable to protect and aid the weak and wandering disciples.

Second, the Eight Heavens of the East were originally four texts all serving as passports to ascent. Yet the *Numinous Treasure* retains only one, taking the East’s generative qi.

Third, the Eight Heavens of the South were originally only for praying for clear skies in the supremely yang regions. Yet the *Numinous Treasure* also employs them to pray for rain and uses their characters as talismans to command dragons.

Fourth, *Hua Mo Yan You* originally governed nightmares. Yet the *Numinous Treasure* employs it to halt thieving ghosts and bandits, for their natures are one.

Fifth, *Form Subduing the Supreme Mystery* was originally a talisman to restrain water. Yet the *Numinous Treasure* employs it to halt monstrous beasts and water spirits, for they are all yin types.

Sixth, *General Overseer of the Supreme Heavens* was originally a character governing qi. Yet the *Numinous Treasure* employs it to halt monstrosities, aid difficult childbirths, and affix it to the inner chambers to summon generative qi.

In these six cases, the *Numinous Treasure* methods differ from the *Deliverance of Humankind*. Yet if one seeks their spontaneous convergence and divergence, they are one.

**Chapter Nine: Returning to the Mandate**

The Dao said: Within these heavens, the Great Brahma’s hidden language and boundless sounds—ancient texts all measured a full *zhang* in length. The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign of Old inscribed their script to establish the correct pronunciation. Those who know these sounds and fast while reciting them will have the Flying Celestial Divine Kings of all heavens descend to observe their bodies, record their merits, and ascend to report to the heavens. Myriad spirits will pay homage, earthly deities will attend at the gates, great merit demon-kings will protect and recommend them as superior immortals. With the Dao perfected, they may roam the Three Realms and ascend through the Golden Gate.

The Master said: This is the origin of the scripture’s compilation. If one can contemplate this and awaken, they will strive without forgetfulness.

These sounds repel all, exorcise all, deliver all, and accomplish all—sounds of the Heavenly Perfected’s spontaneity. Thus, reciting them summons the Flying Celestials to descend and observe; the Supreme Thearch chants from afar; myriad spirits pay homage; the Three Realms attend at the carriage; demonic hordes bow their heads; ghostly essences perish of themselves. The jade-like resonance vibrates, the ten directions grow solemn and clear; rivers and seas fall silent; mountains and peaks swallow their mists; myriad spirits tremble and submit; immortals are summoned and gathered. The heavens are free of defilement, the earth free of demonic dust; dark wisdom is thoroughly purified, and the vastness of the Mystery of Mysteries is attained.

The Master said: This is the method of reciting the cavernal chapters. The Way of visualization values the severance of thought. Truly knowing the spontaneous sounds of heaven’s midst can summon the Flying Celestials to descend and observe. Thus, one must respond with authenticity, not false observation. Only by knowing the jade-like resonance and reciting and savoring it can the ten directions grow solemn and clear, free of external turbidity; rivers and seas fall silent, free of reckless movement; mountains and peaks swallow their mists, free of reckless leakage; myriad spirits tremble and submit, free of reckless harm; immortals are summoned and gathered, free of reckless monopolization. Thus, the nature and mind of heaven and earth become vast and empty. This is how dark wisdom is thoroughly purified and the vastness of the Mystery of Mysteries is attained.

**The Fifth Scroll of the Supreme Numinous Treasure Luminous Clarity Flying Immortals Deliverance of Humankind Scripture Concludes.**
